name: cities
comment: Do not edit this file! It will be automatically updated and all manual changes are lost.

properties.Name: Aaminiut
properties.text:
Aaminiut is the largest town in the decentralized Erutaki land of Hasanaliat. It is located on the southeastern end of Whitefang Bay at the mouth of the great Taraska River. Built on stilts, Aaminiut covers numerous small islets in the river delta and the nearby Hazalin Marshes.

Numerous Erutaki tribes are represented in Aaminiut, each tribe claiming its own islet or (for the smaller tribes) sharing an islet with a few other tribes. The largest clan in the city are the Miusunnit, whose claims in the city include control of the rare ice peppers found in the Hazalin Marshes. Many of the Erutaki migrate away from Aaminiut during the summer months, but most of the town's populace is permanent. A small colony of Ulfen traders from Almhult also lives in Aaminiut.

properties.Name: Aaramor
properties.text: The city-fortress of Aaramor stands on the banks of the West Sellen River in the northwest of Numeria, hard on the edge of the Worldwound.

properties.Name: Abberton
properties.text: Abberton is a small, declining town in the eastern part of the Isle of Erran. It is debated whether the town's name is shortened from Abadartown, or if it was named after the Abber founding family.

properties.Name: Abken
properties.text: One of the newest settlements in Varisia, the village of Abken was founded in 4668 AR as a commune by peace-loving, lower-class Korvosans. It is located on the banks of the upper Yondabakari River (before it flows into Lake Syrantula), about 45 miles northeast of Melfesh. The town is surrounded by a wooden palisade, and is fiercely protected by its inhabitants.

properties.Name: Absalom
properties.text: For more than 4,000 years, Absalom (pronounced AB-sah-lahm) has been the City at the Center of the World, a metropolis-sized showcase of the greatest treasures in all Golarion. The importance and influence of Absalom upon the Inner Sea and the whole of Golarion can not be overstated. The city not only holds a key strategic position for both commercial and military endeavors in the region, but encompasses the site of the ascension of four deities and claims to have been founded by none other than the Last Azlanti, the god Aroden. It is not without reason that the passage of time throughout the Inner Sea region is counted in Absalom Reckoning.

properties.Name: Acisazi
properties.text: Acisazi is a small aquatic elven shoreline village in Ravounel, north of the Ravounel Forest. It was a part of Cheliax until 4714 AR, when the Archduchy of Ravounel seceded and became an independent nation.

properties.Name: Acorn's Rest
properties.text:
Acorn's Rest is a small village located in the portion of the Fangwood south of the Marideth River in Nirmathas. Most of its residents are druids attempting to maintain the forest during the nation's war with Molthune.

The druids of Acorn's Rest are friendly and open to visitors who respect the Fangwood.

properties.Name: Adhaarm
properties.text: Adhaarm is a small village that surrounds a monastery on the south-western edge of the Narhari Desert in Vudra. Its sole purpose is to feed the never-ending hunger of the great devourer Rudrakavala who dwells nearby.

properties.Name: Adrast
properties.text: The Barony of Adrast is a small barony and settlement in the north-west of Taldor, located north of the Verduran Forest and south of the westernmost mountains of the Fog Peaks in the Northern Tandak Prefecture. The Baron of Adrast is Baron Stelan who is married to Baroness Lenelle. The headsman of Adrast settlement, a small village, is Odric; while the captain of the guard is the dromaar Captain Drelm. Following the professed faith of the baron, the religion predominantly followed is that of Abadar; the barony has a cleric and temple to that god.

properties.Name: Akafuto
properties.text:
Akafuto, Minkai's second largest port, is located at the mouth of the Tagiryu River and serves as a major part of the Tian Xia lumber trade. Akafuto exports a wide variety of raw and finished goods, and the city's junks are among the most common Minkaian ships in foreign ports, particularly Tianjing.

Akafuto's most famous temple is the Ukuashi-Ji, dedicated to the god of prosperity Kofusachi, who is said to bless the harvested goods and crafts that flow through Akafuto's markets. Akafuto is also home to the Juhimeiyo School, a monastic institution attended primarily by young nobles looking to work within the imperial court.

Akafuto has maintained a remarkable political stability over the centuries. It has been ruled by a member of the Moniwa family for over a millennia.

properties.Name: Al-Hiraf
properties.text: Al-Hiraf is a Qadiran city in the south-western corner of the Maharev region, one of the safest and most fertile regions in all Qadira. Al-Hiraf itself is located on the eastern bank of the Maharev River a few miles upriver of the metropolis of Qaharid.

properties.Name: Al-Varish
properties.text: Al-Varish is one of the numerous massive trading cities that dot the Qadiran region of the Plains of Paresh, but is often overshadowed by the capital of Katheer. It is located at the head of the Jackal River, one of the two sources for the River Ladan.

properties.Name: Alabastrine
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Alabastrine", please see Alabastrine Peaks.

Alabastrine is a city in Druma built in 4607 AR to accommodate Arodenite refugees after the deity's death; however, the migration never happened in the numbers its investors expected, and its hasty construction ceased before it was completed. High Prophet Kelldor purchased the partially finished city in 4711 AR, and since then the Druman government has auctioned control of the city in five-year spans to the highest bidder. The most recent auction occurred in 4716 AR.

properties.Name: Albatross
properties.text: The small, coastal fishing town of Albatross perches precariously on a cliffside off the coast of Nidal on Conqueror's Bay. Although it is a settlement of less than 400 souls, it is home to many times that number of its namesake avians. Residents of Albatross claim to be able to predict the weather, foretell ill omens, and see the approach of death simply by observing and interpreting the flights of these birds.

properties.Name: Alendruan Harbor
properties.text: Founded by the elven witch called Kaala Raingold around 4622 AR, Alendruan Harbor is now the main port on the Shackles' island of Kepre Dua.

properties.Name: Algidheart
properties.text: The city of Algidheart is the regional capital of the Irrisen province of Bleakmarch. It lies to the west of Glacier Lake on the Rimeflow River. From the city, the Rimeflow continues westward into the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The city's buildings are built upon bridges across the river, and rise to staggering heights. They are connected by a tangled network of platforms, ladders, and ramps.

properties.Name: Alkenstar City
properties.text:
Alkenstar City is the capital city of the Grand Duchy of Alkenstar and houses the whole of the Duchy's governmental infrastructure. The city is located on top of the Hellfallen Cliffs, where the Ustradi River falls seven hundred feet down Alken Falls. Monumental works of engineering and architecture, including the Bridge of the Gods, connect the city to the vassal communities of Martel and Dongun Hold. As a result of the urban development of the Duchy, many incorrectly consider these vassals mere districts of Alkenstar City proper, rather than distinct communities in their own right.

Alkenstar City is also the nation's center of industry, housing the Duchy's infamous Gunworks, the source of mass-produced firearms used both for the protection of the city-state and for trade throughout the Inner Sea region. As a result of the industrial advancement of Alkenstar, a constant cloud of white steam and sooty smoke hangs in a haze over the city, generated by the gears and pistons of countless factories operating around the clock.

To the west of the city are the Karggat Hills, a rocky region dotted with mines and factories.

properties.Name: Almas
properties.text: Almas (pronounced AHL-mehs) is the capital of the free nation of Andoran, and one of the largest and most influential cities on the Inner Sea. In many ways, the city's egalitarianism and multi-culturalism typify the assumptions and prejudices that are held about Andoran society in general.

properties.Name: Alvis
properties.text: Located in the Arthfell region of southeastern Andoran near Aspo Bay, the town of Alvis is best known for the recent kidnappings perpetrated by a local cult. Alvis is also home to the Andoran Alchemical Society.

properties.Name: An
properties.text:
An is the first of Sothis' trio of southern sister cities, along with Tephu and Wati. It was founded in -107 AR by Pharaoh Hirkoshek I as a worker city housing the laborers and artisans working to construct his pyramid.

The City of Triangles is so-called because of the similar shapes of distant Mount Na-Ken and the surrounding peaks, as well as the pyramids visible on the southern horizon. Aside from the pyramid of Hirkoshek I, the region also holds the pyramids of Hirkoshek II, Zahur I, and Kamaria the Brazen. Kamaria's pyramid, thought plundered long ago, continues to attract followers of the cult of Rovagug, and some whisper that there may be unopened levels beneath those already explored.

properties.Name: An-Alak
properties.text: An-Alak is a small community on Osirion's Scorpion Coast that includes the Temple of An-Alak, dedicated to the god Irori.

properties.Name: Anactoria
properties.text:
Anactoria is a settlement in the rural inland of the Ustalavic county of Caliphas on the banks of the Droa River and south of the Albria Woods.

The village is famous across Ustalav for the Maid of Anactoria: a corpse that was found in the local bogs in an incredibly well-preserved state despite its great age, which is now displayed in one of the village's cottages. The locals make their living cutting peat which is sent all around Ustalav as a cheap fuel.

properties.Name: Anthusis
properties.text: Anthusis, formerly called Eleder, is the capital of Vidrian and the country's only deepwater port.

properties.Name: Antoll
properties.text: Antoll is the former capital of Iobaria, serving that role between 3304 AR and the fall of New Iobaria in 4659 AR.

properties.Name: Anuli
properties.text: Anuli, also known as 'The City of New Beginnings', is the northernmost city of the celestially empowered nation of Holomog, a distant nation in southern Garund, and is close to the southern border of Geb.

properties.Name: Apertan
properties.text: Apertan is a city in the Arcadian nation of Xopatl located to the south of the country's centre. Apertan is home to the largest market in all Xopatl that attracts merchants and traders from across the land. The market itself is an enormous open-air tower with many levels, each teaming with shops and stalls. Visitors use a system of platforms to raise and lower themselves between the various stalls and shops.

properties.Name: Aphet East
properties.text: Aphet East is a small town in the Footprints of Rovagug that sprung up to support the Aphet Mines. It provides goods and services to the miners, although not all residents are supportive of the practices of the mine's owners, the Aspis Consortium.

properties.Name: Arbo
properties.text: Arbo is a mostly abandoned limestone quarry village in the western Swardlands of the Isle of Kortos, located north of the Irr River on the western edge of the Inland Hills on a farm track that connects the northern Husna Crossroads to Stump south of Arbo.

properties.Name: Ardagh
properties.text: Ardagh is the northernmost settlement of the Ustalavic county of Odranto, located on the Moutray River, hard against the unforgiving lands of the Worldwound.

properties.Name: Ardis
properties.text: Ardis is the former capital of the Immortal Principality of Ustalav. It is located in the eastern region of Soivoda, in the County of Ardeal and is the largest settlement in Ardeal. The city contains many decaying estates and fallow fields.

properties.Name: Arena
properties.text: Arena is a small town on the northeastern coast of Widowmaker Isle in the Shackles. It gets its name from the enormous gladiatorial arena that occupies the center of the settlement. This arena is home to some of the most competitive and violent blood sports in the region.

properties.Name: Arsmeril
properties.text: The cliff-side elven village of Arsmeril can be found where the northwestern Mierani Forest meets the Steaming Sea. Along with the settlement of Crying Leaf, it is the only elven settlement in Varisia, and like its companion on the far side of the Mierani, it is an outpost of the elven nation of Kyonin who wish to keep a closer eye on the ruins of Celwynvian.

properties.Name: Artume
properties.text: Artume is a small kingdom amid hills and fertile plains within the River Kingdoms. Artume is located on a western branch of the Sellen River, not far from the cities of Daggermark, Gralton, and Sevenarches. The region boasts high-quality livestock, especially horses, as well as leather goods and stone. The kingdom welcomes adventurers, who are frequently requested to deal with bandits and nagas. The nation has recently experienced a rebellion, resulting in the overthrow of Regent Waike in favour of Edryd Artume and the restoration of the monarchy.

properties.Name: Arwyll Stead
properties.text:
Arwyll Stead is a mining town in the far north of Lastwall on the border with the dangerous orc territory of the Hold of Belkzen and close to the haunted county of Virlych in Ustalav. Residents of the town are commonly referred to as "Steaders".

The town is located on the Path Road that leads from Vigil into Ustalav. It is named after the Arwylls, a famous family of knights who have fought the orcs for generations.

properties.Name: Ash Hollow
properties.text: Ash Hollow is a small mining village in the foothills of the Mindspin Mountains in northeastern Nidal. It is known for being the primary supplier of coal for Pangolais, and for its annual Festival of Night's Return, held on the nearby mountain of Aghor Thal.

properties.Name: Asleifar
properties.text: Asleifar is a large whaling town on the coast of the Thanelands in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings.

properties.Name: Aspenthar
properties.text: Aspenthar is Thuvia's second largest city-state, and is the country's second port city on the Inner Sea after the capital, Merab. Generally seen as more dour in character than the capital, Aspenthar is under the rulership of the ambitious Prince Zinlo, who has decreed that martial training is mandatory for all citizens. Some worry that this training is in preparation for an invasion of one of the other city-states, or perhaps even an attempt to kidnap Artokus Kirran, the inventor of the sun orchid elixir.

properties.Name: Asre
properties.text: Asre is a town in Almhult. It is located on the southern coast of Cape Almhult on the shores of the Steaming Sea, between Surtse to the west and Roshik to the east.

properties.Name: Auginford
properties.text: Auginford is a small village in southern Nidal near the southern Usk River.

properties.Name: Augustana
properties.text: Augustana is an Inner Sea port city in the nation of Andoran located on Aspo Bay. It is the second-largest city in the nation, and boasts one of the largest shipyards of the Inner Sea region.

properties.Name: Avendale
properties.text: Avendale is the capital city of Touvette. General Cabol Voran took over after the death of the king, removing all temples from the city after driving out all the priests. The city was once dominated by a variety of faiths who filled the power vacuum left by a weak and incompetent king. These new faiths engaged in holy wars that further weakened the kingdom. With the coming of Cabol Voran this ended, he banished the priests from his capital and the entire nation. Now all of Avendale's temples have been converted in to "charities" equal parts orphanages, schools, hospitals and government work centres that serve the city's people.

properties.Name: Avennara
properties.text:
Avennara is an elf village located near the western edge of the Fierani Forest halfway between the settlements of Riverspire and Erages. An elf gate within the village opens to a large number of other gates around Golarion.

The Lantern Bearers, an elven secret society that hunts the drow, use a site close to the gate as their main meeting place.

properties.Name: Averaka
properties.text:
The town of Averaka is located on the south-western coast of the island of Flintyreach in the Linnorm Kingdom of the Ironbound Islands and is predominantly populated by dromaars. The remote island of Flintyreach was long considered too dangerous and barren to be worth settling. A small group of dromaars decided to settle in the island and they managed to establish the now flourishing town of Averaka. They have granted the right to accept any dromaar to settle there, making the Averaka the largest dromaar settlement in the Inner Sea. The town is a haven of the dromaar culture. Most residents are occupied in fishing and railing while the others work in a supporting industry as shipwrights, or sail-makers. There are also a few small farms around the town.

Averaka is ruled by a council of three: Kalla Tusk-Breaker, Bravok, and Suota Iron-Tongue. Councilor Kalla leads the town guards, the groups that patrol the island's interior, and the raiding groups that help fund the town. Councilor Bravok is a cleric of Desna and often travels to other Linnorm Kingdoms, Varisia and beyond, spreading the word of Averaka among the dromaars to recruit more settlers. Suota Iron-Tongue is the official keeper of the town's lore, mentor of the local artists, and moderator of the yearly meeting of Orcmoot.

The greatest threat to Averaka comes from the hill giants, ettins and trolls who live in the mountains of the island's interior. The giants are organized in independent clans or under the sway of the hill giant war chief Gorgnak. The dromaars of Averaka fight fiercely the giants and welcome anyone who shares their hate. The Averaka giant slayers have dedicated themselves to the eradication of their monstrous neighbors.

properties.Name: Avilan
properties.text: Avilan is one of the numerous massive trading cities that dot the Qadiran region of the Plains of Paresh, but is often overshadowed by the capital of Katheer. It is located along the northern banks of the Pashman River halfway between Demirah and the capital, Katheer.

properties.Name: Ayajinbo
properties.text: Ayajinbo is capital of the elven nation of Jinin in Tian Xia, and stewards of the Silver Tree, the Darklands entrance that elves used in millennia past to reach the continent. It is renowned for its gardens, well-crafted stone buildings, and extensive dawnsilver trade.

properties.Name: Ayesh
properties.text: Ayesh is a city on the Alavah Peninsula in Qadira.

properties.Name: Azad
properties.text: The city of Azad is located on the northern shores of the Betul Sea in the Western Ghats region of Vudra. Despite being a city of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra, in terms of aesthetics, Azad is much closer in appearance to a Kelesh city as its architecture is dominated by beautiful domes and soaring minarets.

properties.Name: Azir
properties.text: Azir, the capital of Rahadoum and the birthplace of the Laws of Mortality, is a bustling trade port whose appearance has been greatly modified recently.

properties.Name: Azurestone
properties.text:
The Galtan city of Azurestone takes its name from a the massive blue menhir that towers 100 feet above the town. Located on the plains north of the Boarwood, Azurestone has been relatively isolated from Galt's revolutionary fervour until recently. The stone is an object of religious reverence to the dwarves of the nearby Fog Peaks, who believe it to be a spear that was thrown down from Heaven in prehistoric times by their patron god Torag. These dwarves make regular pilgrimages to Azurestone, pumping up the local economy. Rumors of hidden chambers beneath the stone are beginning to attract adventurers and other undesirables to the city, who have also brought Galt's infamous revolutionary spirit with them.

A trade route links the city with nearby Edme. Azurestone's patron deity is Erastil, but most of the benign gods are honoured by the citizens. The locals are mostly farmers and miners. Ordinarily, the city's location would make it subject to harsh winters, but these are mitigated by the influence of a relic known as the Vernal Key.

properties.Name: Baakai
properties.text: The town of Baakai is one of the settlements scattered throughout the desolate, monster-haunted land of Shenmen ruled over by the fearsome jorogumo, monstrous hybrids of humans and spiders.

properties.Name: Babschu-Jong
properties.text: Babschu-Jong is a major city in the samsaran country of Zi Ha on the continent of Tian Xia. It is located on a southern peak in the Kelsang Mountains and is a major trade connection on the route between Linvarre's capital of New Oppara and Zi Ha's nominal capital of Sangpo-Jong. Primary trade materials include artwork, gems, herbs, incense, livestock, and stone from Zi Ha, which are traded for grain, iron, and textiles.

properties.Name: Bacul Gruii
properties.text: The village of Bacul Gruii was taken over by Petchki, a foreign merchant, who enslaved the locals to harvest wood and livestock for his band of mercenaries. Petchki's men slew Otok, the village chief, and mounted his head in the town square to keep the villagers afraid. Petchki pays the villagers next to nothing and only does so to avoid violating the fifth River Freedom prohibiting slavery. To legitimize his rule over Bacul Gruii, the mercenary captain plans to marry one of Otok's daughters and declare himself the new village chief.

properties.Name: Badelund
properties.text:
Badelund is a well-fortified town on the Frozen Road, in the north of the Irriseni capital province of Thronehold.

Badelund is surrounded by high walls to protect the small peasant town from uninvited fey visitors. Feyfrost fey are notorious child-stealers. Badelund is the first village on the Frozen Road west of Isseld and hosts a number of inns and taverns to serve the tired merchants sailing the Frozen Road. Baroness Pavlina is the ruler of the town. Because of her kindness and her love for a peasant, Pavlina was sent to Badelund as a punishment. The Baroness and her Ulfen husband Oddvar Pavelsson are wise governors and do their best to make peasants' life bearable. It is well known that Pavlina sends mercenary groups north to retrieve stolen children. Such groups are the Home Again Safe led by Helena Oukarnion and the White Dawn Hunters led by Mikhail Shalanov.

properties.Name: Baghava
properties.text:
Baghava is one of the mahajanapadas that make up the sacred region of the Divine Garden at the eastern edge of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. The city-state is located amongst mangrove forests on the region's southern coastline of the Embaral Ocean.

Baghava is renowned for the huge temple and ashram complexes across its holdings and its vast beautiful gardens, all of which are guarded by minotaur-priests of Gaelata.

properties.Name: Baifen
properties.text:
Baifen serves as a central gathering place for the various small Tapestry People communities within the lands of the Szaezan Crags leased by Hao Jin. The day-to-day running of the town is done collectively by about a hundred families.

Baifen is a popular holiday destination because of its many attractions, such as public theater performances, hot spring bathhouses, and night markets filled with delicious foods. Historians and adventurers are also attracted to the area, with the hope that one of the Tapestry People can help solve ancient riddles or provide otherwise lost historical knowledge.

properties.Name: Baldachin
properties.text: Baldachin is a small town at the mouth of the Frozen Road on Glacier Lake in the Irriseni capital province of Thronehold.

properties.Name: Banukmaud
properties.text: The village of Banukmaud is the second-largest Ghol-Gan ruin in the Cannibal Isles. It is inhabited by the cannibalistic humanoids known as the kuru.

properties.Name: Baslwief
properties.text: The mining village of Baslwief is located in the foothills of the eastern Fenwall Mountains in Varisia, on the banks of the Sarwin River.

properties.Name: Beachcomber
properties.text:
The town of Beachcomber on Bag Island in the Shackles is mainly inhabited by halflings, but also a large number of liberated dromaars live in its Lurker District. The port is rowdy and shady characters are often attracted to the town.

An increasingly bold temple to Norgorber is located at the north edge of the town, and it is said that secret tunnels beneath the temple lead to the vast catacombs under the town. Despite the freedom of religion on Bag Island, most of Norgorber's faithful still hide their identity. The two priests of Norgorber in town are Antal Armskeep and Black Gnarea and they are almost open about their faith. They jointly command the ketch Darkbow. The priest-captains are brutally efficient at hunting and destroying slave ships, and often sacrifice the captured slavers to Norgorber.

properties.Name: Belde
properties.text: Belde is a town in western Cheliax situated on the banks on the Maiestas River, between the Menador Mountains and the Barrowood. Despite being geographically located in the Archduchy of the Heartlands, it serves as capital of the rebellious Archduchy of Hellcoast.

properties.Name: Belhaim
properties.text: Belhaim is a small town located on a tributary of the Verduran Fork in the nation of Taldor's Verduran Forest.

properties.Name: Belila
properties.text: Belila is a small Irriseni town of the Iceflow in the northwestern corner of the province of Bleakmarch. Much of the town recently converted to new faith known as the Way of Transcendent Bliss, much to the consternation of its ruler, the Baroness Frederyka.

properties.Name: Bellis
properties.text: Bellis is a remote settlement in far northeastern Andoran along the banks of the Sellen River. Established as a lumber town, it now produces additional agricultural goods in addition to cut timber. Bellisians like to call themselves "foresters" instead of "lumberjacks". The "lumberjacks" are regarded as undisciplined amateurs.

properties.Name: Berus
properties.text: Berus is a very prosperous settlement along the northern border of the Ustalavic county of Ardeal on the banks of the River of Scales.

properties.Name: Bildt
properties.text: Bildt is one of the largest cities in the relatively sparsely populated Lands of the Linnorm Kings, and is located on the island of Aegos in the Steaming Sea. It is also the capital of the Linnorm Kingdom of Broken Bay.

properties.Name: Biston
properties.text:
Among ancient cliff-side structures (rumored to have once housed a long-extinct tribe of harpies) in caves along the shore of Lake Syrantula lies the town of Biston. It was founded in 4574 AR by Jhenni Biston, who cleared the tunnels of their xulgath inhabitants.

While citizens of Korvosa, the farmers and fishermen of Biston have long held a strong sense of independence, and in 4658 AR Jhenni's grandson Randas Biston led a group of separatists in a revolt to cede the town from Korvosan control. The government responded in full force, sending half the Sable Company and an entire regiment of Korvosan Guards to maintain order. All of the rebels were executed in Korvosa, and martial law was maintained in Biston until 4690 AR when it was lifted by King Eodred II.

properties.Name: Bitter Hollow
properties.text: Bitter Hollow is a tiny thorp on the banks of Lake Coal in central Varisia. It is home to only a small number of hunters and trappers, as Lake Coal has very poor fishing. The Gator's Nest, Bitter Hollow's only trading post, is located in the center of town. The founders of Bitter Hollow must have had some foresight, as they built the wood and reed walkway known as the Wicker Walk to encourage trade with gnomes of the nearby Sanos Forest. Although trade with the gnomes is not regular, one can find interesting and unusual items for sale at the Gator's Nest from time to time.

properties.Name: Blackblood Cay
properties.text: Blackblood Cay is a small port town on Shark Island in the Shackles. It is located on a small hidden inlet of the island and was founded by Free Captain Simeon the Vain in 4703 AR. The port now hosts ten more pirate captains, while Simeon remains lord of Blackblood Cay. The town features berths along the wharf for only six vessels at a time.

properties.Name: Blackcove
properties.text: Blackcove is a small and very isolated fishing village on Cheliax's western Hellmouth Gulf.

properties.Name: Blackpipe
properties.text: Blackpipe is a small farming town in Numeria, named after the large adamantine pipe that sticks out of the ground in the farming area's fertile soil.

properties.Name: Blackridge
properties.text: Blackridge is the young capital of the Chelish region of Devil's Perch, within the Archduchy of Hellcoast.

properties.Name: Blackwood Moot
properties.text:
Blackwood Moot is an isolated stand of Blackwood trees deep in the Verduran Forest of Taldor that serves as a meeting place for wild residents dissatisfied with the Treaty of the Wildwood. Those who meet at Blackwood Moot view the members of the Wildwood Lodge as traitors who have enabled Taldor's destruction of the Verduran Forest.

The Blackwood Moot is led by the arboreal regent Oakadence, a powerful sorcerer who has been organising secretive raids on Wispil and the Isle of Arenway using the wild beasts of the forest as disposable foot soldiers.

properties.Name: Blisterwell
properties.text: The settlement of Blisterwell was once an extensive dwarven quarry and strip mine, called Jerengoff, that fell under orc control in -3709 AR with the coming of the warlord Belkzen. It has stayed in orc hands ever since, but is now a hotly contested urban battleground between two tribes: the Haskodars and the One Eyes.

properties.Name: Bloodcove
properties.text: The city-state of Bloodcove is a decadent haven of crime located where the Vanji River meets the Fever Sea on the edge of the vast Mwangi Expanse.

properties.Name: Bluestone
properties.text: Bluestone is a hamlet on the border of Molthune and Nirmathas that frequently changes hands between the two nations. It was originally built around a circle of stones and a shrine to Gozreh. Its frequent changes in ownership has weakened the town's economy considerably, and the village no longer contains many elaborate structures outside the original Gozren shrine.

properties.Name: Bogsbridge
properties.text:
Bogsbridge is a small port in the Motaku Isle in the Shackles. It is built in a marshy wetland completely unworthy of any development.

Falgood Boles, captain of the brig Bitter Wind, founded the small port after he had a vision of Besmara. He believed Besmara had tasked him to build a port in this marshy wetland. The devout pirate developed the settlement using his personal wealth, despite the boggy location and the fact that no large ship could use this harbor. Boles lived there alone with his wife for two years.

The marsh was gradually silting the harbor when Falgood Boles discovered a unique breed of snail in the surrounding marshes that produced a rare purple dye. The discovery made Falgood Boles a fortune and since then the town has grown. The town still continues to harvest the lucrative snails, transporting it via a sandy road to Lilywhite where the dye is shipped far and wide.

Boles's cheerful granddaughter, Tendry Boles, is the town's mayor. She also tends the inn her grandfather built, the thriving Besmara's Favor.

properties.Name: Bolgrad
properties.text: Bolgrad is an underground mining city in the northeastern Five Kings Range that specializes in gemstones; the cavern city's gem-rich ceiling earned it the nickname "Star-Studded Bolgrad". Most of its majority dwarven population works either in the mining and processing of gems or as jewelers.

properties.Name: Bosco
properties.text: Bosco is a town on the eastern coast of the Isle of Kortos in the nation of Absalom, just southeast of the Tyrant's Grasp.

properties.Name: Bosorka
properties.text: The small town of Bosorka is located on the Frozen Road River, in the southeast corner of Irrisen's Feyfrost province. As with many towns along the Frozen Road River its main purpose is to assist those conveying goods and traveling down the river. It is located within sight of the border with the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, and therefore of a land not eternally dominated by the ravages of winter. No non-Jadwiga are allowed to cross the border out of Irrisen and the Jadwiga guards of Bosorka have to be ever vigilant with the border so plainly visible and enticing.

properties.Name: Botosani
properties.text: The Rahadoumi city of Botosani is located on the Arcadian Ocean on the west coast of the Kingdom of Man. As with the rest of the nation, religion is completely banned in the city but persistent rumors of a cult of Iomedae have recently gained enough credence to be considered a threat, resulting in an increase in activity among the Pure Legion. The ongoing famine besetting Botosani makes fully devoting the resources needed difficult for the Legion, however, and they now look for outside help to either rout the cult by force or to create a public spectacle which they could then clean up. Famine and cults are not the only threats to the well-being of Botosani, though, as three times in the last half century the city has been the victim of a terrible plague and pirates from the nearby Shackles continue to make trouble for the nation's navy and trading vessels going to and from the busy port. Being the major Rahadoumi port nearest the Eye of Abendego, where the pirates often flee for refuge, it is here that able seamen and naval guides are most in demand to help track down and dispatch the seafaring threats.

properties.Name: Bovodport
properties.text: Bovodport is a dwarven city in the nation of Zavaten Gura on the coast of Cholpod Gulf. It is Zavaten Gura's primary center of trade and commerce.

properties.Name: Braganza
properties.text: Braganza is a city on the Plains of Molthune on the western edge of that country, and is one of the centers of the worship of Abadar in the region.

properties.Name: Brastlewark
properties.text: Brastlewark is an almost exclusively gnomish city in eastern Cheliax, located on the western edge of the Aspodell Mountains, at the head of the Brastle River. It is believed to be the largest gnome settlement in the Inner Sea region, perhaps even in the entire world.

properties.Name: Breachill
properties.text: Breachill is a small town in eastern Isger, in the foothills of the Five Kings Mountains.

properties.Name: Brimstone Springs
properties.text: Brimstone Springs is a small settlement high in the Mindspin Mountains of Nidal known for its hot springs: the Soulsheen Baths. Hundreds of people from all over the region come every year to soak in its sulfur-rich mineral waters that fall in natural cascades, giving the town a rather unpleasant smell. These waters then collect to form the source of the Sulfur River, which flows westward out of the mountains toward Usk Lake. Brimstone Springs has also gained a certain amount of notoriety from the golden dream, a special, day-long immersion in poisonous waters that, if it doesn't kill the user, gives him or her visions of the afterlife while permanently dying the skin a deep yellow.

properties.Name: Brinewall
properties.text: Brinewall was an abandoned settlement and castle (see Brinewall Castle) built during the early part of the Chelish expansion into Varisia (see Everwar). Situated in northwestern Varisia where the Steam River flows into the Bunyip Bay, it was designed to encourage trade with, and fend off attacks from, raiders of the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Recently, it gained a new lease of life as a port in the new kingdom of Eurythnia in New Thassilon.

properties.Name: Bronze Hook
properties.text: Bronze Hook is a small trading town located in the foothills of northwestern Katapesh's Brazen Peaks, just a short distance north of the Pale River. Once a stop on a now-defunct caravan route from Ipeq to Solku, the town no longer makes the profits it once did ferrying goods and passengers across the river and charging tolls for the use of the Hook Ford. Since the trade route fell into disuse, the people of Bronze Hook have learned to survive off of what little trade trickles along the old road or the river. With their town's coffers always in mind, the local constabulary has increasingly turned a blind eye as slavers, smugglers, and traders of exotic creatures from the Brazen Peaks bring their goods through the town, despite the moral implications and frequent disturbances that come with them.

properties.Name: Brume
properties.text: Brume is a gypsum mining town village in the Swardlands of the Isle of Kortos named for its misty mornings.

properties.Name: Brunderton
properties.text: The mining town of Brunderton in eastern Rostland in Brevoy is home to a relatively large number of dwarves for the region. Most dwarves throughout southern Brevoy and the northern River Kingdoms have relatives from here, and gem and ore traders from Brunderton can often be found peddling their wares along the Sellen's many tributaries.

properties.Name: Bug Harbor
properties.text: The town of Bug Harbor is a gathering of huts perched on stilts at the edge of swamp Evergrowth. It got its name from the swarms of dragonflies, water striders, and other insects that buzz over the swamp. The town supplies herbs and plants for alchemists, herbalists, wizards, and druids who travel here in search of rare components. The unofficial mayor of Bug Harbor is the aiuvarin Bastin Irriden.

properties.Name: Bundzo
properties.text: Bundzo is a town located on the northern bank of the Lake of the Blessed Prince in the central part of Xopatl. Its economy depends on diving expeditions into a massive underwater keep, which was home to a hero-god who chose to submerge it upon his ascension. The fort seems to be dozens of storeys tall, and has yet to be fully scoured of its treasures.

properties.Name: Butraf
properties.text: Butraf is one of the numerous large, prosperous cities that dot the fertile Qadiran region of Pashman. It is located a few miles south of the banks of the Jackal River; the river forms Pashman's northern border with the neighbouring region of the Plains of Paresh.

properties.Name: Buwayang
properties.text: Buwayang is a settlement in western Minata led by Ikluss the Ghostmarked, an intimidating white-scaled lizardfolk who declared herself Warrior-King of Buwayang and lines her hall with her fallen foes' skulls.

properties.Name: Caldamin
properties.text: Caldamin is a small, rural town in northernmost Andoran, nestled between the Five Kings Mountains to the west, the Verduran Forest to the east, and the Dragonfly River to the south. This otherwise unremarkable settlement has become somewhat of a tourist attraction of late, due to the presence of two extraordinary creatures who make their home nearby: a red reaver named Auger and a gray render called Shepherd Graygulp. These two foes occasionally battle each other, and their fights are of such ferocity that people come from far afield to witness the clashes.

properties.Name: Caliphas
properties.text: A city made rich by trade from across Lake Encarthan, Caliphas has long been described as the very soul of Ustalav. Caliphas is Ustalav's largest city and has a tremendous impact on the surrounding lands, supporting most of the wineries and perfumeries that dot the County of Caliphas.

properties.Name: Canorate
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Canorate", please see Canorate (province).

Canorate is the capital of the nation of Molthune. It is an impressive city which manages to combine architectural splendor with defensive fortifications. It is said that even the poor of Canorate live in luxury, and to a certain extent this is truecitizens allow a select number of necessary laborers to live in fine accommodation (but naturally kept separate from the rest of the population) in order to encourage them to settle in the city.

The city's most exclusive district is known as the Sweet Orchard. Non-residents are not allowed to enter this exclusive section without a valid work or travel permit.

The Imperial Castle dominates the center of the city. The ruler of Molthune, Imperial Governor Markwin Teldas, maintains an impressive war room within the castle. Pride of place is given to a large scale model of the Inner Sea region, on which the generals plot their next campaigns.

properties.Name: Carpenden
properties.text:
This article is about the Andoren city. For the sparkling wine commonly called "Carpenden" after Carpenden Hill, see bubble wine.

Carpenden (sometimes spelled Carpendren) is the most influential city in the Carpenden region of Andoran. Located on the north-central Carpenden Plains, it is surrounded by rolling hills that lend themselves to the creation of numerous plantations and orchards.

properties.Name: Carrion Hill
properties.text:
This is an article on the city of Carrion Hill. For information on the Pathfinder Module of the same name, see Carrion Hill (module).

The city of Carrion Hill in eastern Ustalav is a strange place, resting atop an unnatural and unsettling mound. Why people choose to live here is unclear, but for some reason they always have. Varisians first settled Carrion Hill in 2397 AR; prior to this, Carrion Hill was a holy site for the local Kellid tribes.

properties.Name: Cascina
properties.text: The tiny hamlet of Cascina is a sleepy little settlement located in Meratt County in the Tandak Prefecture south of the Verduran Forest and east of Cassomir. Cascina consists of only a few extended families who once worked for the Voinum barony most of whom now live as simple farmers of goats, sheep, or wheat. The hamlet's most notable resident is Yarelle Towsine, a minor wizard who offers her spells to help the local community. As part of Meratt County, Cascina is subjected to the harsh rule of House Lotheed.

properties.Name: Cassomir
properties.text: Cassomir is located at the mouth of the Sellen River, and is the second largest settlement in the empire of Taldor. It acts as a major trade city, and through its ports enter goods from the Inner Sea, as well as from nations to the north that utilize the Sellen as a trade route. Cassomir is also home to the greatest of Taldor's imperial shipyards, even though the majority of the fleet itself is stationed in Oppara.

properties.Name: Castle Everstand
properties.text: Castle Everstand is a large, abandoned fortification in the Gravelands, located just west of the northern reach of the Fangwood. It was created by Sergeant Strom Gauntwood as a point of defense to hold against the orc hordes from the Hold of Belkzen after Lastwall's Hordeline crumbled in 4517 AR. Command was passed from Gauntwood to Gauntwood all the way to Captain Thaum Gauntwood, the fort's final commander when it was abandoned following Tar-Baphon's invasion of Lastwall in 4719 AR.

properties.Name: Castle Firrine
properties.text: More of a fortified mustering station than a traditional town, Castle Firrine stands just south of Ghostlight Marsh at the edge of a war zone in the nation of Lastwall. It serves as a supply station and a place to regroup for knights battling the orcs to the west and undead to the north. There it controls the headland formed by the confluence of the Esk and Kestrel Rivers.

properties.Name: Castle Odranto
properties.text: Castle Odranto is located in the centre of the Ustalavic county of Odranto.

properties.Name: Castle Urion
properties.text: Castle Urion is the first town most crusaders heading to Mendev up the West Sellen River see when the enter Numeria, but it is far from the typical barbarian settlements that are strewn across the country. This settlement is technically under the control of the Black Sovereign, but it is in reality controlled by an order of knights dedicated to Iomedae. These knights built Castle Urion as a way to protect and guide those crusaders sailing up the River Sellen (or "River Road" as it is often called) from Cassomir in Taldor to Chesed. This order of Iomedaean knights is particularly special, as they ride trained griffons, which help them patrol vast stretches of the river, certainly more than they could if they patrolled only on horseback. The current commander of Castle Urion is Caroliss Minerran.

properties.Name: Cavlinor
properties.text: Cavlinor is an elven outpost in Nirmathas, located on the southern bank of the Deepcut River where it joins the Marideth River. A few dozen mostly transient elves live in this settlement, which resembles a hunting lodge more than an actual town. The elves are mostly concerned with exploring elven ruins in the area and making diplomatic contact with the fey of the Fangwood. Sivron Nal, Cavlinor's manager, was an outspoken advocate for aiuvarins in Kyonin, and their appointment herefar from the other elvesmight be construed as exile.

properties.Name: Cedar Court
properties.text: Cedar Court is less of a settlement in Druma, and more a small group of the oldest dryads' trees in the region. This fey court is one of the most reclusive, and hides somewhere deep in the Palakar region.

properties.Name: Celwynvian
properties.text:
The ancient elven capital city of Celwynvian (pronounced sehl-WIN-vee-enn) sits amid the Mierani Forest in northern Varisia. Abandoned by the elves when they departed Golarion prior to the Earthfall, the city became overridden with drow, and was the site of one of the most vicious conflicts between the two elven races upon their return from Sovyrian. Taking considerable losses from the drow's evil tactics, the elves once again departed the city, and it remains empty and forbidden to this day.

The elves of the Mierani Forest strictly prohibit outsiders from entering the city, under the guise of wanting to preserve it as a refuge from the rest of the world, but those more familiar with the region sense that the elves themselves avoid the city and are still involved in an ongoing war to reclaim it.

properties.Name: Cesca
properties.text: Cesca is a settlement in eastern Ustalav, located in the county of Varno.

properties.Name: Cettigne
properties.text:
Formerly an independent city-state, Cettigne was annexed in 4708 AR by Molthune when the city was beset by plague and famine. Molthune's youngest General Lord, Irina Klim, was set up as Cettigne's new ruler, but the locals continue to chafe at their new-found servitude. The traditional Free City Citizen Militia continues to protect the city independently of the General Lords. Friction between the locals and the national forces may soon lead to violence.

Cettigne is built around four castles representing the various periods of its history; they are reflected on the city's flag, four white castles on a green field. A fifth castle is under construction, representing Molthuni rule.

Cettigne has a small temple of Abadar.

properties.Name: Chalk Harbor
properties.text:
The grim mining town of Chalk Harbor is the only functioning settlement on Whyrlis Rock island in the Shackles. The town is the base of operations of the slaver Alahandra Boisich, rumored to have once been a powerful baroness of Cheliax. The ruthless Alahandra captains the barkentine Cloudbuster's Dream.

There is no wildlife around Chalk Harbor save for bands of earth elementals and the few clusters of cullitox that lair underground, and no one can eat the sparse blighted crops that grow from the rocky soil. Water is drawn from the Elsewhere River, but all food is supplied by other islands and paid for by Alahandra.

properties.Name: Chalya
properties.text: Chalya is a city located in the Lohaparbat Mountains of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. Chalya is the most easily accessible city by land for those visiting the Falling Mountains region, and is home to numerous pagodas and ashrams that draw visitors from across Vudra.

properties.Name: Changdo
properties.text: Changdo (pronounced CHANG-dew), also called the Imperial City, is the capital of Po Li and was the original capital of Lung Wa, the empire that dominated Tian Xia until the death of Aroden.

properties.Name: Chastel
properties.text: Chastel is the largest town in the Ustalavic county of Lozeri, lying on that county's southern border. The town is located close to the southern edge of the Shudderwood just north of the meeting point of the Vhatsuntide River with its tributary, the Vistear River. Chastel has the air of a frontier settlement despite its size, possibly due to the roughness exhibited by the locals. The town, though, does have a large market, lumber mills, and stockyards but lacks any protective walls, and as such, it is often the target of predators, the most notorious being the Rats of Karneik. In 4701 AR, Chastel was invaded by the murderous winter wolf known as the Devil in Gray; in a single night, he killed nearly twenty people before disappearing back into the wilds of Lozeri.

properties.Name: Chateau Douleurs
properties.text:
Chateau Douleurs is home to the Caliphvaso family and is located in the north of the Ustalavic county of Caliphas.

Located on the eastern shore of Lake Raiteso, Chateau Douleurs boasts a paradise of labyrinthine gardens, statue-guarded pavilions, strange menageries, and luxurious retreats. The palace also contains the accumulated art, treasures, and decadences of the Caliphvaso clan. Yet few ever look upon the estate grounds or are permitted into the palace's interior, as a legion of deadly family guards defend the grounds with lethal efficiency. Such extreme measures to ensure privacy has spawned countless rumors of orgies, murderous hunts and various sordid family secrets.

The halls of the chateau are haunted are haunted by the ghost of Ralagen Caliphvaso.

properties.Name: Chennipon
properties.text: Chennipon is a settlement in the distant nation of Vudra in Casmaron briefly mentioned in Paths Across Vudra by the author Liteim Krinas. The shipbuilders that live here are rumored to know the secrets of building flying ships.

properties.Name: Chesed
properties.text:
The huge city of Chesed (pronounced CHES-ed) is the last port of call on the River Road for most pilgrims heading to the Mendevian Crusades before they reach their final destination of Mendev. It is the final port (or first depending on the direction of travel) along the length of the Sellen River, sitting where the river meets the Lake of Mists and Veils.

Because it is so near the lake, the city is often shrouded by the fog. In addition to the mist, unregulated waste disposal into the lake has led to the waters up to a mile away from the city being highly toxic, to the point of creating oozes due to combining with runoff from the Chymist's Ward.

The city has a blend of alien technology as well as stark social inequality, resulting in peoples' perception of the city being very different depending on who you talk to. Some former crusaders have found their way here, spending their money on squalid gambling halls and old taverns while reflecting on the consequences of their wartime experiences.

properties.Name: Chillblight
properties.text: Chillblight is the regional capital of Feyfrost, the Irrisen province ruled by the cold fey. The city is located in northeastern Irrisen on the Frozen Road, and was built by the cold fey themselves. Being creatures of the First World, they eschewed traditional building materials, and carved the whole city out of ice that shimmers in the cold, northern sun.

properties.Name: Chilmbi
properties.text: Chilmbi is a town in northern Xopatl, located near the source of the Follower's River and the Traveler's River. Its residents spend weeks following the large lizards, called tunbaros, that roam the nearby grasslands. They await an opportunity to capture and tame one so they might sell them as mounts, as they are well-known across Xopatl as the best steeds in the country.

properties.Name: Chimera Cove
properties.text: Chimera Cove is a small, nominally Andoren fishing village located on Aspo Bay on the northern shores of the Inner Sea. The coast here is rough, battered by waves and wind, and usually cloaked in fog. The village sprang up during the difficult years following Andoran's split with Cheliax and is named Chimera Cove because of the three large islands just offshore: the Lion, the Dragon, and the Goat. Due to its precarious location, the town has failed to expand and thrive, although its residents have no trouble feeding themselves via subsistence farming and fishing.

properties.Name: Chiron
properties.text: Chiron is a small Katapeshi town on the small island of Sand Haven.

properties.Name: Chitterhome
properties.text:
Chitterhome is the largest ratfolk settlement in Numeria and serves as a de facto capital to the ysoki ethnicity of Numerian Tinkerers. It is located in the Sellen Hills region, about 50 miles east of Scrapwall. The settlement itself is a square mile in size and consists of natural caverns that have been further excavated.

Chitterhome contains three, and possibly more, carefully guarded entrances to Nar-Voth.

Outsiders are not allowed in Chitterhome, but its residents trade throughout eastern Numeria, particularly Chesed, Hajoth Hakados, and along the Sellen River.

properties.Name: Cho-Tzu
properties.text:
Cho-Tzu is the main settlement on the Shenchu Bay island in the Shackles. It is built around a large triangular harbor.

Most of the harbor is used by the Shenchu pirate vessels and the merchants ships. A second city is formed in the remaining part of the harbor consisting of 50 or more junks, rafts, and other ramshackle watercraft occupied by over 200 Tian-Sings, descended from sailors from Zo Piaobo, the floating city of Minata. These folk rarely set foot on dry land and are known to provide services from fortune-telling to midwifery but can also be hired as thugs. Most of the inhabitants of Cho-Tzu are Tian-Sings but the ramshackle neighborhoods on the northernmost side of the city are populated by tengu who escaped from Imperial Lung Wa long ago.

properties.Name: Ciricskree
properties.text: Ciricskreethe Screeching Spire in the Strix languageis the largest strix settlement in the Inner Sea region and perhaps in all of Golarion. It is located in the southern Menador Mountains of Cheliax, in the Archduchy of Hellcoast.

properties.Name: City of Bone and Juniper
properties.text:
The City of Bone and Juniper is a taiga giant settlement in the mountains of Zi Ha in Tian Xia.

The giants believe they are descendants of an underworld dragon and an ancient samsaran noble who sought to escape the cycle of rebirth to remain with her beloved. They keep the remains of their samsaran progenitor in a golden mausoleum on a hidden plateau marked by three towers made of wood and bone high in the mountains that happens to be located at the intersection of two ley lines, which provide the plateau special magical properties. Anyone who dares approach the mausoleum will be slain.

The taiga giants spend most of the time dressed in red and black, but occasionally honor the samsaran noble by dressing in mottled blue and white. During the latter times they travel peacefully to the lowlands to trade with the human and samsaran villagers, all the while maintaining a strict code of silence.

properties.Name: Claes
properties.text:
The Andoren fishing village of Claes is located on the Inner Sea coast, just over 50 miles south of the Andoshen River delta. A humble town, the inhabitants make their living from the ample harvest of the sea, supplementing it with some subsistence farming. When pirates or slavers attack, the people of Claes retreat to an ancient, underground Azlanti fortress known as the Claes Redoubt; the ruin is known to be quite deep.

General Reginald Cormoth, commander of Andoran's Eagle Knights, was born in Claes.

properties.Name: Clear Waters
properties.text: The city of Clear Waters floats atop Lake Clear Waters in the centre of the Forest of the Sacred Eye and draws visitors from across Xopatl and beyond. Clear Waters is renowned for its beauty and anyone wishing to travel through the city must use one of the city's small boats, most of which are decorated with a special flower that blooms every new moon. Clear Waters draws in the most visitors during the full moon, however, as during the height of the full moon Lake Clear Waters begins to glow with moonlight.

properties.Name: Coldwater
properties.text:
Coldwater is a small town on the western bank of the Gullik River in the Irriseni capital province of Thronehold. Baroness Wilimina is the ruler of the town.

The peasants of Coldwater look with envy the changing seasons in the Realm of the Mammoth Lords but no peasant is allowed to cross the river. They have to work the docks and house and entertain the merchants traveling up and down the Gullik River. Some young and rebellious Jadwiga have formed a stilyagi gang and call themselves the Lords of the Tusk. They are led by Paval Turosky, a foolish youth, and enjoy crossing the river and imitate the Kellid barbarians. On some occasions the Lords wander deep into the foreign lands and they say they want to forage deeper into the wilds to hunt bison and the prehistoric animals that roam those lands.

properties.Name: Colvaas Gibbet
properties.text: The small port of Colvaas Gibbet is situated in the Mainland area of the Shackles, approximately 25 miles northeast of Port Peril.

properties.Name: Commonfield
properties.text:
Commonfield is more of a collection of pesh-farming homesteads in western Katapesh than a town, but it represents the nation's densest concentration of pesh farming. Twenty-two farmers, their families, and their hired hands call Commonfield's 36 farms home. These farmers are, for the most part, hardworking and honest; their crops are precious, requiring them to post guards at night.

The five wealthiest farmers meet weekly to discuss coordinating guard patrols, how the season fares, any insect or rodent pests affecting the crop, and other topics. Two notable members of the council are the aiuvarin Richele Gerst and the halfling Kerek Cullstone.

properties.Name: Copperwood
properties.text: Copperwood is a small town located northeast of Absalom just outside the city's walls that is the home of many of Absalom's laborers, tradesmen, and domestic servants. Originally a tent city of unskilled laborers who could not afford to live in the city proper, conditions steadily improved over the centuries until Copperwood became a town in its own right. The locals are often known as "Copperheads".

properties.Name: Coralesian
properties.text: The small town of Coralesian sits high in the northeastern Five Kings Mountains, and even though it is considered to be within the territory of the dwarves, it has been settled by mostly elves from neighboring Kyonin, who live here among the snowcapped peaks and pine trees of the mountains. Some live in small huts in the high alpine meadows, while others have built cliff-dwellings connected by ladders, bridges, and tunnels. No matter where they make their home, however, they all band together to support each other through the long, cold mountain winters.

properties.Name: Corentyn
properties.text: The Chelish city of Corentyn (pronounced KOHR-ehn-tin) is located on the far southwestern tip of the country, as the capital of the Archduchy of Longmarch. Founded as a military outpost, the Arch of Aroden forms the western border of the city, and a 50-foot-high limestone wall continues on around the northern and eastern landward sides. Also known as Port Indomitable and the City of Nine Forts, Corentyn has survived dozens of wars, and remains a major trade center and military outpost in the new, infernal Cheliax of House Thrune.

properties.Name: Corpselight
properties.text:
For other meanings of "Corpselight", please see Corpselight (disambiguation).

Corpselight is a small farming settlement in the undead nation of Geb situated north of the Axan Wood and about two day's travel east of Graydirge.

Corpselight is not a traditional farming community however. The town raises intelligent humanoids for use as food and sustenance for the various undead beings throughout Geb. These human chattel are kept in pens until they are ready to be shipped out. Standard crops are also grown in order to feed them.

properties.Name: Corvischior
properties.text: Corvischior, sometimes spelt Corvischoir, is located in the south of the Ustalavic county of Varno. The town is now a shadow of its former self, the derelict county capital, and sits across the water from the equally forlorn Castle Corvischior, once the residence of the noble Tiriac family. Though still technically subject to the absentee Lord Ristomaur Tiriac, it has sat fallow for decades, though rumours speak of strange lights and unnerving shadows up at the castle. The most pessimistic residents whisper that Castle Corvischior, once known as Korsinoria Palace, is cursed, and whatever fell hex hangs over the castle has now settled over Corvischior as well.

properties.Name: Court of Endless Revelry
properties.text: The Court of Endless Revelry is the largest congregation of satyrs in the Palakar region, and is the closest thing to a satyr court.

properties.Name: Court of Seasons
properties.text: The Court of Seasons is a court of nymphs that actively resists anyone coming into their domain without permission.

properties.Name: Courtaud
properties.text: Courtaud is a settlement in the western corner of the Ustalavic county of Lozeri, near the edges of the southern Tusk Mountains. Rumors of a beast named the Devil in Gray have started to make the locals nervous, but the town's ruling council has yet to pay attention to them.

properties.Name: Crooked Cove
properties.text: Crooked Cove, often referred to as Crookcove or Crook Cove, is a small village on the southwest coast of Ravounel.

properties.Name: Crossfen
properties.text:
Crossfen is a Nirmathi village in the Fangwood near the Lastwall border and a mile-wide wetland. Of the settlements inside the Fangwood, Crossfen is one of the few capable of supporting cattle that feed on thick-growing sedge.

The wetlands host boggards and will-o'-wisps known to claim visitors and villagers who attempt to cross it at night.

properties.Name: Crosspine
properties.text: Situated along the southeastern edge of the Uskwood, Crosspine is a village that stands out due to its distinctive practice of guiding a remarkably elevated proportion of its youth into the paths of arcane and druidic learning. Among its notable denizens are Isiem, a prominent shadowcaller, and Ascaros, a renowned sorcerer skilled in shadow magic.

properties.Name: Crown's End
properties.text:
Not long after the first landing of Chelish settlers at Eleder, one group split from the main party to establish their own settlement on a bluff further north, along Desperation Bay.

The settlers befriended the local Ijo tribe and fought off attacks from hostile jungle life, and their new port became known as Crown's End. The port soon attracted smugglers, slavers, and pirates, driving out more honest trading. Many of its current inhabitants have criminal pasts, but the town pays its taxes to the government of Sargava on time and tries to keep a low profile.

It is ruled by Ilina Ysande, who takes a dim view of those who draw outside attention to the town.

properties.Name: Crowstump
properties.text: Crowstump is a port town at the mouth of the Tourondel River where it enters Lake Encarthan. It serves as a waypoint for Mendevian Crusaders due to its proximity to southern Lastwall and lively selection of taverns, but is also known as a regional center of academia, trade market, and relatively peaceful settlement in a chaotic region.

properties.Name: Crowtop
properties.text:
Crowtop is an abandoned village in the Irriseni province of Hoarwood. Inexplicably, the village has not decayed or been buried by the snow. It stands just as it did over a thousand years ago. Nobody knows its original name, but it is now called Crowtop because of the thousands of crows that perch on the village's roofs and fence posts in strange silence. It is one of the few places in Irrisen where crows can be found in large numbers, as they are normally killed on sight.

People say the village's residents suddenly vanished. Within the houses, meals sit unfinished and chores half-completed, but nobody is known to have actually set foot in the place. It is said that Crowtop is cursed and the crows are the souls of all the Ulfen slain in Baba Yaga's conquest. They also say the crows serve some nefarious purpose for the White Witches, while others claim that they are psychopomps.

properties.Name: Crying Leaf
properties.text:
Crying Leaf is an isolated elven village in Varisia's Mierani Forest. It is a day's travel from the ruins of the former elf city of Celwynvian, where the elves are engaged in a bitter struggle with the drow. As a result, it is used by the elves as a staging ground for their warriors, including contingents of Lantern Bearers, and is not entirely safe from drow raids.

The village consists mainly of simple, low stone and wooden structures, decorated with graceful carvings. It is protected by a wall of thorns. Most of the village's trade and supplies arrive from Kyonin through the use of magic there is little contact with Riddleport and the rest of neighbouring Varisia. Non-elven visitors are rare.

The leader of the village is the sorcerer Eviana Nirgassan, who was appointed by Kyonin a decade ago following the assassination of her predecessor by the drow.

properties.Name: Crystalcrag
properties.text: Crystalcrag is a town of geniekin in the remote southern Zho Mountains of Qadira. Due to prejudices against geniekin, the town is protected by illusions created by Tygora Cinderfury, an ifrit exile from Medina Mudii'a.

properties.Name: Crystalhurst
properties.text: Crystalhurst is a secretive town in the Southern Fangwood ruled by a circle of druids who make sure the homes and other structures of the town blend in with the natural landscape. The druids willingly help the Nirmathi repel Molthuni invaders, now that their previous central concern, the fight against the Darkblight, was ended with the fall of the debased fey ruler Arlantia in 4717 AR.

properties.Name: Cutter's Holdout
properties.text: Cutter's Holdout is a small village near the borders of Druma and Kyonin, and has been disputed territory between the two nations.

properties.Name: Cuttle
properties.text:
Cuttle is a small settlement on the west coast of Mediogalti Island. It is much smaller and much less known than the island's main settlement of Ilizmagorti.

It consists of a collection of huts on the edge of the beach and serves as a way station for the whalers of the Arcadian Ocean. The whalers pay the Red Mantis for the use of the site, normally in the form of whale oil, and it is believed that some of the villagers are probably Red Mantis members. The whalers resupply here and also render the catches.

properties.Name: Cypress Point
properties.text: The small town of Cypress Point, located about 40 miles northeast of Kintargo, on the point of land furthest north on the coast, is the largest settlement in Ravounel east of the Yolubilis River.

properties.Name: Cyremium
properties.text: Cyremium is a small, isolated fishing town on the Inner Sea coast, just east of the southern tip of the Cape of Hope on the Missa Shelf. Now located within the Arthfell region of Andoran, the town once was the site of a Taldan fortress that was abandoned soon after the end of the Even-Tongued Conquest of 4081 AR. Local settlers began dismantling the four watchtowers to build their homes as soon as the soldiers left, although the outer, sun-bleached walls still remain.

properties.Name: Czarny Las
properties.text: The small town of Czarny Las sprang up around the Bloodstone Conservatory in the middle of the of the Irrisen province of Feyfrost. The town and school sit atop a conjunction of arcane energy.

properties.Name: Dabril
properties.text: The town of Dabril can be found on the Sellen River in the tumultuous nation of Galt, just south of Kallas Lake. Despite being on the river, the residents here rarely work as river traders or fishermen. Instead, the people generally work as gardeners or perfumers, and the town has become known for its immense fields of roses and its manufacture of exotic perfumes.

properties.Name: Daggermark
properties.text:
The largest city in all of the River Kingdoms, Daggermark has maintained enough political and economic stability to secure an abundant supply of food, a rarity in the chaotic Broken Lands region of northeastern Avistan. Daggermark is so stable that it even has a thriving industry and is wealthy enough to mint its own currency.

The main reason for this stability are the two guilds for which the city is so famous: the Daggermark Assassins' Guild and the Daggermark Poisoners' Guild. These two organizations often work hand in hand, as the assassins favor the use of poisons, believing that only amateurs leave behind an obvious cause of death. Few bandit lords would be stupid enough to attack Daggermark for fear of being found poisoned, strangled, or having succumbed to some other seemingly "accidental" death.

properties.Name: Dalaston
properties.text:
Dalaston is a large town on the southwestern edge of Taldor's World's Edge Mountains. Although members of all the major races reside in the town, dwarves are the second-largest group after humans. The three major employers are the local iron mine (owned by the Dalassenos family), the Morian Foundry, and the Irini brewery.

In 4709 AR, the red dragon Horranath attacked Dalaston.

properties.Name: Dalun
properties.text:
Located in the south of the Irriseni province of Wintercrux on the Thundering River, Dalun is a small trade town that does business with the outside world.

Though Dalun strongly encourages trade with the outside world, which is essential for Irrisen's survival, its diplomatic efforts are ruined because of the Irriseni raids launched from Redtooth and Saarbotten in the Verge to the west. Indeed, Dalun is derisively called 'Gentle Dalun' by the people of Saarbotten despite the fact that Dalun supplies most of Saarbotten's food.

Baroness Nadya is the ruler of Dalun. She has tried to foster stable trading relations with Southmoor and Varisia but not with great success. Dalun is responsible for supplying Redtooth and Saarbotten with grain and other foodstuffs. Nadya's bloodthirsty sister, Urgalaena, baroness of Saarbotten, often sabotages Nadya's diplomatic attempts. Lady Nadya's chief steward, Betrona Harcatha, is actually a spy for her sister Urgalaena.

properties.Name: Dammartorp
properties.text:
Dammartorp is a small settlement on the Marbleflow River in Irrisen's Hoarwood province. It is jointly ruled by the Jadwigas Tereza and Tsviata, twin sisters locked in a struggle for control of the town.

The peasantry are divided between the two baronesses and they even frequent different markets and taverns and spit on the ground when passing one another. The peasant followers of Lady Tereza are led by Viglund Lyubienko, who is also the owner of the Tavern on the Water, while those who favor Lady Tsviata are led by the prominent wool seller Zora Oblatov.

Bandits infest the trade route between Dammartorp and Hoarwood but the baronesses are too engaged in their quarrel to address the problem.

properties.Name: Darinkhuur
properties.text: The ancient hold of Darinkhuur is a town in the Erutaki confederation of Yumyzyl, built in the forested foothills of the Wall of Heaven. Though Kyzuv is Yumyzyl's de facto capital, Darinkhuur is its cultural center and has a higher permanent population. All members of the Yumyzyl tribe make occasional pilgrimages to Darinkhuur's spirit-lodges, where the nation's largest canoes are built and receive blessings.

properties.Name: Davarn
properties.text: The town of Davarn in the southwestern Five Kings Mountains is one of the centers of dwarven culture in the region.

properties.Name: Dawnfoot
properties.text: The small town of Dawnfoot lies just southeast of the city of Absalom, between the city walls surrounding the Precipice Quarter and Starwatch Keep. It began as a camp for members of the Starwatch (who must live outside the city walls due to an ancient agreement with the First Guard), but has since grown into a somewhat insular community of military families, many of whom can look back on ten generations who have served in the Starwatch. Those families who do not have members in the Starwatch generally work in some other support capacity in Starwatch Keep. Its city hall is housed in a converted siege engine.

properties.Name: Deadbridge
properties.text: Deadbridge is the capital of the Protectorate of the Black Marquis in the River Kingdoms.

properties.Name: Deepgate
properties.text: Deepgate is a huge stone and iron fortress located deep in the Kodar Mountains of the Hold of Belkzen, to the east of the source of the Kazaron River.

properties.Name: Deepmar Penal Colony
properties.text: Under Chelish rule, Deepmar hosted a small penal colony, known as Deepmar Penal Colony, where the prisoners mined crystals useful as arcane reagents. The prison camps were abandoned before Ravounel's secession, and the new government has let them remain so.

properties.Name: Dekarium
properties.text: The Chelish settlement of Dekarium rests on the northeastern bank of Lake Sorrow near the mouth of the Tomarsulk River. Across Lake Sorrow lies Cheliax's capital, Egorian, while the Barrowood begins just west of the city. The city is renowned for its highly skilled fishermen and abundant fey-blooded sorcerers. Local legend tells that the townsfolk of Dekarium are descended from nereids. A druid patrols the land between the town and the forest, mounted on a griffon named Ironwing Kazi, seeking out evildoers and those wishing to make sacrifices to their diabolic masters in the Barrowood. Much of the village secretly worships Gozreh, including its mayor Lalita Jireen, who manages the town's image and tithes to House Thrune.

properties.Name: Delenah
properties.text: Delenah is one of the numerous massive trading cities that dot the Qadiran region of the Plains of Paresh, but is often overshadowed by the capital of Katheer. It is located along the northernmost limits of the nation along its border with Taldor on the southern banks of the Jalrune River.

properties.Name: Delmon's Glen
properties.text:
Delmon's Glen is a small gnome town located in the far east of the Grungir Forest, in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, at the point where the Summermelt River flows into the Thundering River; the town's current mayor is Bavakanka Winterlisp.

Delmon's Glen is located along the most important overland trade route that connects Jol and Varisia to the south with the northern lands. The town is unusually mundane for a gnome settlement. Most of its buildings are like Ulfen buildings except for their small size. A few larger buildings catering to visitors are located on the edge of the town, like a trading post and the popular Raven's Best inn.

The small town has had trouble in the past with monsters from the southeastern badlands, especially bulettes, and Bavakanka Winterlisp many times recruited visiting adventures to protect her town.

properties.Name: Demgazi
properties.text: Demgazi is a small Taldan town located on the Jalrune River in Sophra Prefecture, on the border between Taldor and Qadira, south of the Border Wood. It is also across the Wood from the town of Heldren, and contributes inexperienced fighters to the High Sentinels.

properties.Name: Demirah
properties.text: Demirah is one of the numerous massive trading cities that dot the Qadiran region of the Plains of Paresh, but is often overshadowed by the capital of Katheer. It is located at the south-western limits of the Plains of Paresh along the banks of the Pashman River estuary as it reaches the Inner Sea.

properties.Name: Detmer
properties.text: The main shipyard that powers the naval arm of Druma's mercantile empire, the city of Detmer is located on a rocky outcrop that is thrust out into the Gulf of Accord on Lake Encarthan. It is from here that the barges and caravels that cross the lake and ensure Druma's wealth are launched. The city is famous for its Sapphire Harbor which, thanks to Druma's incredible wealth, is a lot more literal description than most people think. Very little trade (at least by Drumish standards) actually takes place in Detmer, as it is primarily focused on shipbuilding and maintenance. The Drumish Navy is headquartered here as well, providing security in the Gulf of Accord and wherever else Drumish merchant ships travel in the pursuit of trade.

properties.Name: Dhalanagar
properties.text: Dhalanagar serves as the de facto capital of the relatively young mahajanapada of Nayapul in Vudra.

properties.Name: Dhucharg
properties.text: Dhucharg is the capital of the hobgoblin nation of Kaoling in northwestern Tian Xia, and is by far the most impressive of all the country's cities.

properties.Name: Dimayen
properties.text: Dimayen is a sizable farming settlement located in southern Qadira in the Meraz Desert south of the Meraz River.

properties.Name: Diobel
properties.text: Diobel is one of the larger towns under the rule of the city-state of Absalom. While not as large as Escadar off the Isle of Kortos' northern coast, Diobel plays an important role in the commercial and political affairs of the City at the Center of the World.

properties.Name: Djefet
properties.text: Djefet is a small town on the Sphinx River of Osirion that bears a terrible curse. At first glance, it looks like many other Osirian towns with reed-and-wood homes built on stone foundations, but this is where the similarities end. All of Djefet's residents bear a curse that causes their skin to turn ash-colored as they enter adulthood and then wrinkle and wither away. Residents who try to escape Djefet find that their paths inevitably always turn back to the town and are never able to escape. Legend tells of an artifact in the Pillars of the Sun that could put an end to the curse, but none of the residents have ever been able to leave to verify the validity of this claim.

properties.Name: Djeneg
properties.text: Djeneg is a village in the Footprints of Rovagug area of Osirion. It is located near the mineral spring known as The Great Pool. The Great Pool has been visited by Osirian nobles for millennia, and the village of Djeneg grew up around the pool to support its visitors.

properties.Name: Dobrova
properties.text: Dobrova is a small Irriseni town on the Marbleflow River in the province of Wintercrux. It struggles under the notorious distinction of having the highest taxes in the entire nation, thanks to its new ruler, Baron Vasyl Yelizaveta.

properties.Name: Dokeran
properties.text:
