The ruined city of Dokeran, sometimes written Dokaren, stands on the Defaka River in the Mwangi Expanse. The city was destroyed several centuries ago by Tyruwat the Lost One using the artifact known as the Song of Extinction.

Tyruwat now lives beneath the city's grand temple, his life greatly extended by the years stolen from his cult and the local tribes using the Song. He is guarded by packs of howlers and a tribe of wild elves he has subjugated.

The people of Dokeran built the city of Saruhk nearly a thousand years ago as a place of pilgrimage for followers of Winlas, an empyreal lord, and Aroden.

A tapestry of the city hangs in Venture-Captain Nieford Sharrowsmith's office, which obscures the secret entrance to the Pathfinder lodge hidden within Sharrowsmith's Exports in Nantambu.

properties.Name: Dongun Hold
properties.text:
The dwarven Sky Citadel of Dongun Hold, located in the Mana Wastes of southeastern Garund, is part of the magic-bereft Grand Duchy of Alkenstar. While the nation as a whole has a primarily human population, Dongun Hold is almost exclusively inhabited by dwarves.

The ancient forge within Dongun Hold is surrounded by gargantuan dwarven statues, seemingly gazing at the forge within. A flaming inverted hammer is engraved into the handle of every item forged in Dongun Hold to show its provenance.

properties.Name: Doommark
properties.text: Doommark is the seat of Molthune's Umbral Basin province and home to the only significant fetchling population in the nation, many of whom work for the territorial governor, General Lord Francyne Magga.

properties.Name: Downpour
properties.text: Downpour is a small fishing town on Tempest Cay island in the Shackles. It was founded to take advantage of the plentiful fish that once made their way up and down the Bluehook River during spawning season. Since the cruel catoblepas Gruzugr made its home in the river, the waters have been poisoned and the fish are gone. The residents survive by harvesting the numerous nearby clam colonies.

properties.Name: Dragonsthrall
properties.text: Dragonsthrall is the only settlement on the island of Dahak's Horn. The island of Dahak's Horn was chosen by the great dragon-priest Aashaq when she first came to the isles of the Shackles, for her loyal humanoid worshipers to inhabit.

properties.Name: Dravod Knock
properties.text: The muddy fishing town of Dravod Knock is located on the eastern banks of Lake Prophyria in the Kellid nation of Numeria. Across the lake lies the city of Karcau, but Dravod Knock could not be more different from that cultured, Ustalavic city. Its houses are little more than crude wooden shacks speckled with generations of river silt, while its people make their simple living from fishing the waters of Lake Prophyria, or firing bricks using the copious mud found along its shore. Despite their poverty, the Kellid inhabitants of Dravod Knock are a proud bunch who cling to ancient traditions, many of which seem to revolve around the very mud that seems to be the town's foremost identifier. Countless social occasions are tied to the mud, from how they bury their dead to how they execute their criminals.

properties.Name: Drenchport
properties.text:
The city of Drenchport is on Tempest Cay in the Shackles. Its proximity to the dreaded Eye of Abendego means the city is constantly lashed by storms. The city itself is constructed from driftwood and the remains of wrecked ships.

Drenchport's most infamous tavern is the Drowned Dwarf. It serves surprisingly tasty black kelp beer, but is notorious for its very high murder rate.

The ruler of Drenchport is the pirate lord known as the Master of the Gales.

The city is the home of the gnome salvager Tho Rimplethember, who is well known as an expert on the currents and winds of the dangerous Eye of Abendego.

properties.Name: Drezen
properties.text: Founded as a city-fortress during the hubris of the First Mendevian Crusade, Drezen was overtaken by the demonic hordes of the Worldwound. For years, it stood as a demonic monument to the foolish naivety of those early crusaders, until it was freed with the rest of the Worldwound by members of the Fifth Mendevian Crusade in 4718 AR.

properties.Name: Drowning Rock
properties.text:
Drowning Rock is a small town on the southwestern side of the island of Tempest Cay in the Shackles. Its position largely shields it from the stormy winds of the north.

The town is built around a towering monolith that gradually sinks into the muddy soil, and the townsfolk hold their landmark in high esteem. Every summer the town throws a two-day festival, and the main event involves the strongest men coming together and hoisting the rock from the muck via rope and pulley. The town economy is based on its farms and clam fields.

properties.Name: Dustpawn
properties.text: Dustpawn is a small town in eastern Isger, about seven miles from the Conerica River and close to the border with Druma, and was founded in 4324 AR.

properties.Name: Duwwor
properties.text: Duwwor is the fourth-largest of Thuvia's five allied city-states. It is situated in the south of the country on the edge of the Barrier Wall mountains, near the headwaters of the Turvanar River. Its ruler is Kharane, Defender of Duwwor.

properties.Name: Dyinglight
properties.text: Standing at the headwaters of the Sarkora River and surrounded by the marshes and sulfurous hotsprings of the Frostmire Fen, Dyinglight was once a major city in the Kellid nation of Sarkoris. Abandoned by its human inhabitants shortly after the opening of the Worldwound in 4606 AR, Dyinglight is now the home of a particularly violent band of fiendish, cannibalistic marsh giants.

properties.Name: Eagle's Head
properties.text:
Eagle's Head is both an amphitheatre and the settlement that assembles around it every summer while the theatre is in season. Located in the Kazuhn Prefecture of Taldor, Eagle's Head has existed for many millennia, having been built shortly after the god Aroden ascended to full godhood at the beginning of the Age of Enthronement. Ever since then, Eagle's Head has been a centre for the performing arts which attracts viewers and performers from across the Inner Sea region. Practically, every major work of Taldan drama has been performed at Eagle's Head. Every performer from across Taldor dreams of performing here and that their performance captures the imagination of the people and elevates them as a new cultural phenomena, as has happened to countless artists before them.

Every summer, the land for a mile around Eagle's Head becomes a makeshift city of tents, performers, and theatre-goers that is in constant flux as artists and theatre aficionados come and go as the season progresses. This chaotic atmosphere also proves a heaven for those with less-refined interests. Scheming nobles, spies, revolutionaries, and just plain old criminals all use the cover of the Eagle's Head season to conduct their business, its underhanded side an open secret across the nation. The Brotherhood of Silence, one of the Inner Sea's largest thieves' guilds, has a large presence at Eagle's Head. Many members of the Brotherhood of Silence use Eagle's Head as a place to lie low after committing particularly attention-grabbing crimes in nearby Oppara. Eagle's Head propmaster Rouriss Barthel is secretly a member of the Brotherhood and is the closest thing it has to a leader in the theatrical city.

Because of the amount of espionage, intrigue, and general skulduggery that goes on at Eagle's Head, the Lion Blades, Taldor's secret spy organisation, has a strong presence here. They are led by Myro Gravilla, a long-time regular of Eagle's Head, and between them they attempt to keep a secret catalogue of all the season's intrigues. Unbeknownst to most, almost every season sees the Lion Blades foil some major plot to disrupt, poison, invade, or destroy Eagle's Head. The Lions Blades keep this undercover, this way next season's villain will assume the festive settlement to be an easy target.

For the last five years, the elven virtuoso Tirilee Ambrasa has been the talk of Eagle's Head. This is a near-unprecedented hot streak, most performers are only able to claim the spotlight for, at most, a couple of seasons. Despite being a powerful bard, Tirilee's popularity seems to have nothing to do with magic. Her sway over the attendees gives Tirilee incredible access to the Taldan nobility and prestigious guests from other nations meaning the Lion Blades keep a close eye on her. Tirilee maintains an air of mystery by returning to her home nation of Kyonin at the end of every season.

properties.Name: Eagle's Watch
properties.text: The city of Eagle's Watch sits at the top of Mount Veshka in Brevoy.

properties.Name: East Rikkan
properties.text: The small port towns of East Rikkan and Westpool lying to the north of Westcrown are known collectively as the Rikkan Ports. These settlements house large numbers of merchants dealing in the trade of goods up and down the River Adivian, as well the numerous slaves required to operate the Stavian Arches and portage stations. Although Westpool is larger, East Rikkan has more docks for fishermen and travelers.

properties.Name: Ecanus
properties.text:
Ecanus is a fortress-city in southern Nex that was established during the centuries-long war with neighbouring Geb. It is a sprawling city that serves as the hub of Nex's arcane-powered military. Here the battle mages that make up the backbone of the army are trained in a mixture of potent evocation and battle tactics. The city is also famous for its fleshforges: building-sized artefacts created by the archmage Nex himself that provide the terrifying war beasts which support the battle mages. The fleshforges are responsible for many of the nightmarish creatures which roam the wastelands of Nex, the Barrier Wall mountains, the Mana Wastes, and even the Mwangi Expanse.

The city is the terminus of a trade route that winds its way south through the Mana Wastes, ending at the Gebbite town of Graydirge.

properties.Name: Edme
properties.text: The city of Edme, in the easternmost reaches of Galt north of the Boarwood, was once a great center of learning.

properties.Name: Egede
properties.text:
The port city of Egede (pronounced eh-GEHD-eh) is located on the Lake of Mists and Veils. It is the second-largest city in the Mendev, and as the end of the River Road, is the first Mendevian city that most crusaders entered during the period of the Mendevian Crusades.

From Egede, trade from neighbouring nations (in particular Brevoy, since the recent fall of House Rogarvia) usually flows into Mendev, as did crusaders traveling from the south through the River Kingdoms and Numeria. During the Mendevian Crusades, exhausted soldiers were often sent to Egede for much needed rest and relaxation, whether that was for prayer at the temples or a trip to the covert brothels and bawdy houses that thrived there. A great deal of work was also done here in support of the war effort, often by travelers thoroughly bankrupted by unscrupulous merchants on their way to the crusades.

The growth of industry, trade, and business proved helpful to the crusaders' cause, but some have begun to worry that the city is becoming a den of sin and debauchery.

properties.Name: Egorian
properties.text: Egorian (pronounced eh-GOR-ee-an) became the capital of Cheliax upon the Thrune Ascendancy in 4640 AR, replacing the city of Westcrown. House Thrune wished to create a new imperial capital to honor its new allegiances far from the nobles and history of Westcrown. It is also known as the City of Thorns.

properties.Name: Ehur
properties.text: Ehur is a city in Qadira. Lying in the center of the Ketz Desert, this genie city is where denizens of the various Elemental Planes have their embassies and serves as a trading hub for these people within Qadira.

properties.Name: El-Fatar
properties.text: A Pathfinder discovered an enormous set of catacombs beneath a ruined city of Ancient Osirion, in northern Katapesh. Adventurers came to the ruined city to explore the ancient tunnels and over time the small town of El-Fatar sprang up amidst the ruins. The intriguing artifacts discovered attracted many researchers and historians as well.

properties.Name: El-Shelad
properties.text:
El-Shelad is a small city on the Scorpion Coast of Osirion. It was once just a slave camp housing a part of the hordes of slaves that built Tumen. The city flourished under the Qadiran rulership of the country mainly because of the resulting influx of Keleshites that strengthened its economy.

El-Shelad is a city of fierce political struggle and racial tension. When the first Osirian ruler of the country after 3,000 years of Keleshite rulership, Khemet I, the Forthbringer, installed a loyal governor in El-Shelad, he tried to dissipate the political tension. He allowed the city's ruler to retain the traditional Qadiran title of "wali" but the struggle between the Osirian loyalists and Keleshite sympathizers has never ceased. The city is known for its stormy elections which until recently produced Garundi governors loyal to Sothis. Its current ruler, Sarita Senbi is Keleshite and thus distrusted by Garundi citizens.

properties.Name: Elbistan
properties.text: Elbistan is a small town in the western foothills of Taldor's Southern Range mountains.

properties.Name: Eldentre
properties.text: The town of Eldentre can be found in the south-western corner of the Linnorm Kingdom of Hagreach in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, on the banks of the Thundering River. The town is famous for the Lightning Oak, and the weapons that are made using the electrical energy from this tree.

properties.Name: Elesomare
properties.text: Elesomare is a small farming and lumber-producing colony, established in pre-revolutionary times by the then province of Andoran on the far-away shores of Arcadia. As it was overwhelmingly settled by commoners looking for a better life abroad, it greeted Andoran's radical change in government with great hope and sympathy. Being separated from the motherland and the many political and economic compromises that a large government necessitates, the citizens of Elesomare are more idealistic than their counterparts in Avistan. In recent years, the colonists have been attempting to decrease the local influence of the authoritarian and sometimes brutal Lumber Consortium. Although the government in Almas does not support this subtle insurrection, they have been noticeably slow in responding to the Consortium's call for help and reinforcements.

properties.Name: Elidir
properties.text: Elidir (pronounced EL-eh-deer) is both the capital of Isger and the nation's largest city. Far from the Chitterwood, Elidir escaped the worst of the Goblinblood Wars, a fact that still engenders bitterness from those whose homes were overrun. It is a commonly held belief throughout the rest of the country that if the capital had been in greater danger during the war, the fighting would have been over much faster.

properties.Name: Elistia
properties.text:
The Hold of Elistia, or Fortress of the Bluffs, is a military outpost of the elven kingdom of Kyonin, located in the north-eastern part of the dwarven nation of the Five Kings Mountains. Elistia has a garrison of 500 elves commanded by Lord Alavar.

The Hold is protected by the Sentinels of Elistia, led by Lord Alavar in his role as Captain of the Sentinels. The Hold's elves are unfriendly to visitors, particularly orcs and dromaars, but assist mountaineers in need that they encounter in their patrols.

properties.Name: Elith Lorin
properties.text: Elith Lorin is one of the most pleasant settlements in Nidal, and is one of the most important transportation hubs in the nation.

properties.Name: Elokolobha
properties.text: The city of Elokolobha is carved out of a massive limestone formation on the eastern edge of the Screaming Jungle in the Mwangi Expanse. It is inhabited by fey bilokos and elokos.

properties.Name: Elsekulp
properties.text: Elsekulp is a large Taldan town on the banks of the Porthmos River, approximately 90 miles upriver from the capital, Oppara.

properties.Name: Elyon
properties.text: Elyon is a settlement on the western coast of the Isle of Kortos in the nation of Absalom. It is located in the western Swardlands just west of the town of Kerrick.

properties.Name: Enganoka
properties.text: Enganoka is the capital of Hosekikozan Province in Minkai and a significant port for trade. It is particularly well known for the luxury goods it trades out of its Kuroi Lane market.

properties.Name: Eongman Bog
properties.text: Eongman Bog is the largest enclave of dokkaebi in Tian Xia, with few human residents. The settlement hosts an annual festival where dokkaebi engage in kimchi-eating competitions.

properties.Name: Erages
properties.text: Erages is a small fishing community located on the shore of Lake Encarthan in the elven nation of Kyonin. Erages' population is almost entirely aiuvarins who live in virtual exile from the rest of the country.

properties.Name: Eran's Rest
properties.text:
Eran's Rest is a remote but picturesque settlement within the Hungry Mountains, perched on the eastern side of the Ghorcha Pass among the Hundred Haunted Vales and overlooking the Adghain Valley. It is located in the Ustalavic county of Amaans, and a steep goat path provides access to the village.

The village is dominated by herders and weavers but is also associated with fairy tales and other stories of badly-behaved fey. The villagers portray these tales in their art and architecture as well as their stories. Unfortunately, there may be more to the tales than mere story as the village suffers regular disappearances and other strange events.

properties.Name: Eranmas
properties.text: The walled city of Eranmas is on the shores of Lake Encarthan. It is the second largest city in Molthune, and home of the country's navy. This navy is the largest fleet on the lake, and its main role is to blockade Tamran, capital of the "rebel" nation of Nirmathas. The city is governed by Lord Resket.

properties.Name: Erekrus
properties.text:
Erekrus is a subterranean necropolis in southern Osirion, west of Mount Osiki. It is built on the side of the mountain and serves as a necropolis for pharaohs who were noble and worthy for Pahmet's blessings. In Ancient Osirion it was a great honor to be blessed by the Pahmet.

Two of the pharaohs who earned the blessings of the Pahmet of Erekrus were Osezis II and Menedes XVII. Osezis II became famous for his policies which ended a nationwide famine. He was entombed in Erekrus in -652 AR. Menedes XVII earned Pahmet's favor because he managed to abolish the slavery system during his reign. He was entombed in Erekrus in 1262 AR.

Erekrus is ruled by a pair of priests who claim to be siblings, Garzukk and Trelka. Together they guide the Pahmet in their prayers and rituals to honor the deceased god-kings of Osirion. They have disparate features for siblings as Garzukk who is the older of the two, has long golden locks of hair and bronze skin while Trelka is dour with dusky skin.

properties.Name: Escadar
properties.text: Escadar is a city on the Isle of Erran off the north coast of the Isle of Kortos. It houses a city-sized military outpost, acting as one of Absalom's primary bases of naval operations.

properties.Name: Eto
properties.text: Eto is the largest city of central Osirion, located just north of the mountain range known as the Pillars of the Sun. It sits at the crossing of numerous overland trade routes, including the major one between Sothis to the east and Shiman-Sekh to the west, and has seen its fortunes wax with the increase of foreign trade since Osirion's independence. In addition to benefiting from this increased trade, it has also become a launching pad for adventurers seeking to plunder the country's many ancient tombs.

properties.Name: Evaren
properties.text: The town of Evaren is a centre for trade between Iobaria's human and non-human populations. Located on the edge of the Syrzemyan Highlands, the town is still recovering from losing much of its population over the course of the past two plagues, though it does attract those tired of living solitary lives in the wilderness. The town is ruled by the Council of Three, the most notable being Councilor Pavla Trynar, regarded as the most powerful magic user in all of Iobaria. Trynar's many apprentices help to protect the town and keep the peace.

properties.Name: Everpine
properties.text: Everpine is an unusual fey settlement in the western Barrowood of Cheliax.

properties.Name: Falchion Point
properties.text:
Falchion Point is a small town in the Widowmaker Isle in the Shackles. Falchion Point has a reputation for unshowy fighting. The town is known for the Bloody Twins event, in which two combatants are manacled together and fight one another with glass shards. Usually, both opponents in a battle of Bloody Twins end up bleeding to death. Lefty Kemya, Falchion Point's mayor, is famous for having actually survived the Bloody Twins, albeit at the cost of his right hand.

Other attractions include Beaten Eyes, wherein four combatants are temporarily blinded with magic and pitted against one another in a bare-knuckle battle. Another unnamed game of wits is also played that involves two heavily armored combatants who duel in a small pit the ground of which is covered in hidden deadly traps.

properties.Name: Falcon's Hollow
properties.text:
Falcon's Hollow is a town in Darkmoon Vale, in the nation of Andoran. The settlement sits only a short distance from Darkmoon Wood and is little more than a logging village, comprised almost exclusively of lumberers in the employ of the Lumber Consortium and their families. With few exceptions, the buildings and their inhabitants belong to the Consortium and totally depend on the overpriced goods delivered by the organization.

It is said that in times long past dwarves settled in the surroundings of Falcon's Hollow; rumors persist that forgotten treasures of their fallen civilization yet remain to be found. Yet today it is a place for the desperate with no other place to go, for outcasts and religious zealots seeking to avoid hindrances brought on by their surroundings.

properties.Name: Faldamont
properties.text: Faldamont is a small town in the western foothills of the World's Edge Mountains in northern Taldor.

properties.Name: Ferny
properties.text: The village of Ferny is the largest settlement of shoonies in the Swardlands of the Isle of Kortos.

properties.Name: Finder's Gulch
properties.text: Finder's Gulch is a ruined and abandoned village in the Menador Mountains of western Isger that is home to a powerful priestess of Urgathoa named Illcayna Alonnor. She was transformed by her goddess into a monstrosity known as a daughter of Urgathoa and raids the countryside around Finder's Gulchincluding neighboring Cheliax and Molthunefor victims to expand her growing army of wights.

properties.Name: Finderplain
properties.text:
Near the center of Katapesh, the small gnome city of Finderplain provides temporary home for travelers exploring the area.

Finderplain has stood 300 years as a way-point for gnomes traveling south of the Inner Sea. It holds almost 2,000 residents, but the constant influx and departure means that the number could change completely every few years. Families rarely establish permanent homes in Finderplain; the lure of adventure and desert beckons, and the gnomes move on, leaving their houses empty for the next travelers. The transitory nature of the gnomes means that no individual consistently rules over Finderplain. The current ruler is a gnome bard named Wexlis Bean.

properties.Name: Flameford
properties.text: Flameford is a small Shoanti camp near Kaer Maga.

properties.Name: Flesk
properties.text: Flesk is a settlement on the central eastern coast of the Isle of Kortos in the nation of Absalom.

properties.Name: Folarth
properties.text: The town of Folarth is located in southern Nirmathas near the Deepcut River.

properties.Name: Fort Bandu
properties.text: Fort Bandu is a fortification in eastern Sargava, located in the Bandu Hills on the banks of the River of Lost Tears near the border with the Mwangi Expanse.

properties.Name: Fort Benbem
properties.text: Fort Benbem is a small port fortress on the Pangalley Atoll in the Shackles. It has been the home port of the Screaming Reaver since the ship was banned from using even Shark Island ports. Black-Eye Benbem had the fortress built using slaves that he drowned soon after its completion. Fort Benbem consists of no more than a dozen wooden buildings surrounded by a log palisade, and is hidden by thick palm trees.

properties.Name: Fort Drelev
properties.text: Fort Drelev is located on the north-western banks of Lake Hooktongue in the Stolen Lands region of the River Kingdoms and is ruled by Baron Hannis Drelev, originally under a charter from Brevoy.

properties.Name: Fort Fang
properties.text:
Fort Fang has been the headquarters of its region's kholos for decades. This fortress is built on top of Ancient Osirian ruins and was founded by the kholo slaver Hlasho. It houses around 500 soldiers and slavers and 1,500 slaves at any given time.

The fort is the target of frequent attacks by the Eagle Knights of Andoran as part of their abolitionist activities.

The status of this fortress is unknown since the widespread abolition of slavery in the Inner Sea region since 4719 AR.

properties.Name: Fort Holiday
properties.text:
Fort Holiday is a refuge built by the marooned survivors of Raptor Island in the Shackles. It is located atop a rocky hill of the island, at the fork of the Broken Hope River and its main tributary. It consists of a number of huts surrounded by a wooden palisade.

The castaways continue to strengthen the palisade of their small refuge with stones and welcome any new survivors who can make it to the gates of Fort Holiday.

properties.Name: Fort Kragang
properties.text: Fort Kragang is an occupied fort among the mountain realms of Zi Ha, originally constructed by invading hobgoblins from Kaoling under the leadership of Warlord Tsung-cha Kavangaki. It is currently occupied by a contingent of troops led by Ping-la Maningki, which harass local samsarans, raiding them for supplies and capturing them. Some samsarans of Zi Ha have hired mercenaries to oppose the hobgoblins, so it may only be a matter of time before a clash erupts.

properties.Name: Fort Liberthane
properties.text: Fort Liberthane is the only settlement in the tiny River Kingdom of Liberthane founded by the revolutionary "Young Knight" Achille Parsall in 4689 AR. The small fortress was the base of operations of a notorious bandit before Parsall and his followers seized control of it. The fort is home to approximately 50 soldiers. A number of farming families have settled around the fort.

properties.Name: Fort Longjaw
properties.text: Fort Longjaw is located northeast of Solku, near the Brazen Peaks. It is a wooden stockade that stands as a symbol against kholo aggression. Its proud red flag displays a bleached white jawbone divided by a silver sword. The fort's residents are desert warriors who dedicate themselves to driving back kholo raiding parties, destroying kholo settlements wherever they lurk, and hunting down any other desert dangers such as hyenas. Led by Giana Secondstride, every day they scout the area for miles, hunting for slaver tracks, setting up false caravans to act as decoys, and interrogating travelers about any signs of kholo activity.

properties.Name: Fort Ramgate
properties.text:
Fort Ramgate is a frontier town of the nation of Molthune, in the Marideth River valley. It has impressive fortifications, which are tested on an almost daily basis by the forces of neighboring Nirmathas. In fact, the town takes its name from the repeated attempts to destroy its gates. Despite this, the town's population continues to grow, as Molthune's Imperial Army concentrates its forces here in preparation for the almost inevitable invasion of Nirmathas. Indeed, most of the few elite troops of the Imperial Army are currently stationed in Fort Ramgate.

The town is commanded by General Hakar. General Lord Resper Cyrno ostensibly rules the Border region of Molthune from Fort Ramgate as its territorial seat, but spends very little time there.

properties.Name: Franax
properties.text: Franax, a port town located on the Lake of Mists and Veils, was once the centre of Iobaria's shipbuilding and repair thanks to its advantageous geography. Located on a series of bays protected by three islands, Franax's port eventually spread to cover the islands. However, much of the town now lies in ruins after a fire consumed 80% of the town in 4651 AR. The fire was started in an ill-advised attempt to contain the "plague of boils and bone-aches" that afflicted Franax, but ultimately led to an exodus of its shipbuilding industry to Orlov. Now those few who remain in the city are caught in a conflict between the zealous druids of the Glacircle and local fisherman Niath Koyra.

properties.Name: Free Station
properties.text:
Free Station (sometimes spelled "Freestation") is a town built on the confluence of the Little Vanji and Vanji River in the Mwangi Expanse.

To the west of the city lies the Gutblood Labyrinth: a mighty fissure in the Rechiend's Plains, which the locals of the city call Calistria's Grin and which contains Ghol-Gani ruins.

properties.Name: Freedom Town
properties.text: Freedom Town is a predominantly human settlement located on the border of the Hold of Belkzen and Lastwall. It is located in fertile farmland due east of the capital of Urgir, north of the Flood Road.

properties.Name: Frembrudd
properties.text: The town of Frembrudd is located on the south-western cliffs of the island of Battlewall in the Linnorm Kingdom of the Ironbound Islands.

properties.Name: Funako
properties.text: Funako (pronounced fu-na-ko) is one of the many cities of the Tian Xia nation of Linvarre, which was formerly the Taldan colony of Amanandar. It is home to most of the nation's elven population and known for its Jininese metalworking and dawnsilver trade.

properties.Name: Fusil
properties.text: Fusil is a town in far-eastern Andoran surrounded on all sides by the Verduran Forest. Ages ago, the inhabitants of the hamlet made a pact with the local druids and fey-folk. In exchange for the location of a rich gem mine, the citizens of Fusil pledged that no one would chop down a single tree of the forest. The terms of the agreement have not been breached, and the inhabitants make a decent living from the mine, use only stone in the construction of their homes, and rely on peat fires for warmth.

properties.Name: Gadbadigat
properties.text: Gadbadigat is an outlaw city located at the heart of the arid Narhari Desert, one of the most rugged and harsh regions of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. The Bahig River, the desert's largest source of water, disappears into a miles-wide sinkhole around which Gadbadigat is built.

properties.Name: Galduria
properties.text: Galduria is a town in central Varisia, located on the western shore of Ember Lake. Generally thought of as a dependent of the city-state of Magnimar, most of the town's wealth is generated by the trade of grain and lumber across the lake and along the Lampblack River. Its true claim to fame is its arcane college, the Twilight Academy, the founding of which in 4629 AR by Galdurin Barmier was the establishment of the town. The Twilight Academy rivals the larger colleges in Varisia, the Stone of the Seers in Magnimar, and Korvosa's Acadamae. The college was founded specifically to avoid the political pressure and intrigues of those two cities. The Twilight Academy has a reputation for undertaking many experimental and unconventional practices. Nevertheless, locals turn the other way regarding its strange ways in exchange for the money that the college is able to provide for various civic projects.

properties.Name: Galizhur
properties.text: Galizhur is a largely dwarven mining settlement on the southern coast of the Isle of Kortos in the nation of Absalom.

properties.Name: Ganagsau
properties.text:
Ganagsau is the largest set of Ghol-Gan ruins in the Cannibal Isles of the Shackles. It is also the location of their so-called deity, the Blood Queen. The Blood Queen is actually a powerful outsider of astounding power and evil who has transformed the kurupeople who were forced onto the islandsinto primitive monsters.

The Blood Queen's current high priest is Bukrugsor. He serves in the Sanguine Cathedral as the intermediate between the kuru and their "goddess", making demands that include human sacrifices and other acts of repugnant devotion.

properties.Name: Ganda-Uj
properties.text:
Ganda-Uj is the treetop lair of the monkey goblins of Mediogalti Island. It consists of precariously balanced bark huts, linked by swaying vines and bridges. Scholars believe that the current site is the fifth lair to bear the name; the other four were accidentally burned down by the fire-loving goblins.

The goblins delight in attacking travellers, using nets and poison darts to take prisoners, who are then presumably sacrificed to whatever demons the goblins worship. It is best to travel through monkey goblin territory in large, well-armed groups.

properties.Name: Gao Bie
properties.text:
Gao Bie (pronounced gau-bier), also spelled Gau Bie, is a large town in the Sun Shogunate of Songbai that serves as a waystation for land and river trade routes. Its name is derived from the Tien phrase for "goodbye".

During peacetime Gao Bie hosts traders and furloughed soldiers, and the town's lack of security despite its strategic location also draws criminals and adventurers.

properties.Name: Gardens of Shepeska
properties.text: The Gardens of Shepeska lie on the north eastern tip of Osirion, where the Inner Sea meets the Obari Ocean. They are tended by druids who have granted many saplings to the crown prince at Sothis.

properties.Name: Garizs City
properties.text: Sitting in the north-western reaches of the Arcadian nation of Xopatl, Garizs City is renowned for the prominent musical style that is named after it. This musical style is a lively one typified by an inclusion of common instruments, like flutes, guitars and trumpets, alongside the more unusual garizan, a musical instrument made of entwined plant matter that is squeezed and stretched to make different sounds. Garizs City is the primary place that garizans are manufactured and those that are not made in Garizs City are normally viewed as being of inherently inferior quality.

properties.Name: Gazbilah
properties.text: Gazbilah is a Qadiran city located in the Northern Zho Mountains area, nestled in the foothills between two different spurs of the Zho Mountains. The Northern Zho Mountains are the poorest region in Qadira and face the neighbouring land of Taldor across the Jalrune River. As such, it is the least hungry for war with their neighbors.

properties.Name: Geb's Rest
properties.text: The small settlement of Geb's Rest, sardonically called Bitter End by the locals, is located on the northern border of the nation of Geb, on the edge of the Spellscar Desert. It is little more than a ruin, but this dusty hamlet serves as a supply post on the road which connects the city of Graydirge to the south, through the Mana Wastes and all the way to the city of Ecanus in Nex.

properties.Name: Genzei
properties.text:
Genzei, the City of Lanterns, is the capital of the Ushinawa Isles. It was established nearly two centuries ago, when samurai patriarch Tanagowu Useme conquered the islands.

The fiercely independent samurai and his rowdy followers fought the murderous kuru natives who populated the stony Ghol-Gani ruins that dotted the island. The bloody fighting lasted one month and, at the end, every kuru was put to the sword. The warriors and the Tian-Min sailors and servants who accompanied them established the new, limestone town of Genzei.

The settlers went to great efforts to erase any signs of the original Ghol-Gani builders, painting over the depictions of cannibalism and bloody alien rituals and removing the limestone carvings portraying their ravenous gods.

properties.Name: Gholinom
properties.text: Gholinom is a secret alghollthu factory-city hidden in an oceanic trench west of Rahadoum.

properties.Name: Ghrinitshahara
properties.text:
Ghrinitshahara is the capital of the Rampore Isles in the Shackles. The busy town is located on the central island of the archipelago and is famous for its large harbor and shipyards where captured ships are repaired and refitted for sale to buyers across the Shackles, Sargava, and the Inner Sea region.

The cruel rakshasa Bedu Hanji rules the Rampore Isles from his sprawling palace in Ghrinitshahara. The town once resembled the hamlets of the distant Kingdom of Vudra, home to the Vudrani mariners who established the settlement. When Bedu Hanji infiltrated Rampore's loose organization and became the master of the isles in 4662 AR, Ghrinitshahara became the center of a thriving business around the trade of humanoid slaves.

properties.Name: Gildside
properties.text: Gildside is a vertical mining town consisting of six levels built into the side of the Rancor Canyon.

properties.Name: Gillamoor
properties.text:
Gillamoor is a village in Isger on the edge of the Chitterwood. It managed to survive the destruction of the Goblinblood Wars but has now fallen to what is being called the Gillamoor Plague.

According to the usually fearless caravan guards of the Mercenary League, many of the villagers have been transformed into ravenous disease-carrying zombies. The village is under quarantine by order of the Isgeri army, and its leaders secretly hope that the steward's 5,000 gold piece reward for eliminating the undead plague will convince outsiders to cleanse the town for them. A few of the village's inhabitants are still believed to be alive, trying to last out the siege in heavily barricaded homes.

properties.Name: Gitna
properties.text: Gitna is an iruxi settlement that has existed here since before Geb and Nex began their conflict.

properties.Name: Glimmerhold
properties.text: Glimmerhold is a small dwarven city located within the borders of the human country of Nirmathas. Situated in the Mindspin Mountains by the border with Nidal, Glimmerhold is near the banks of the Gjurn River.

properties.Name: Goatshead
properties.text: Goatshead is the main settlement on the Firegrass Isle in the Shackles. It was founded In 4642 AR by a trio of pirate captains who settled on the island. The Pirate Council laid the blame for all and any pirate misbehavior against Sargavan vessels on the Firegrass island buccaneers. Made the scapegoats of every Sargavan complaint, these three captains named their settlement Goatshead and adopted a flag with a white goat's head on a black field.

properties.Name: Gojko
properties.text: Gojko is a tiny Irriseni village located directly on the border with the Lands of the Linnorm Kings in the province of the Verge.

properties.Name: Goka
properties.text: Goka (pronounced go-kar) is a free city-state on the western coast of Tian Xia. Formerly part of Imperial Lung Wa, it broke free when the empire collapsed and is now enjoying a golden age of trade and prosperity. Goka is a vital port city that rivals Absalom and Katapesh in size and diversity, and serves as a gateway to Tian Xia for travelers from the west.

properties.Name: Golquila
properties.text: The walled city of Golquila is one of the numerous prosperous ports that rim the Betul Sea in the Western Ghats region of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. Its defences are enhanced by being built into the mountains. Further protection for the city is provided by two huge gorillas and their keepers who stay near the city. Golquila sits at one end of the Seabound Road, the completion of which heralded a new era of prosperity for the once-desolate region of the Western Ghats.

properties.Name: Golsifar
properties.text:
Golsifar is a small port town on Taldor's Inner Sea coast, located approximately 90 miles north of the mouth of the Jalrune River in the prefecture of Moda. It serves as the prefectural capital.

As the southern staging point for the Taldan Imperial Navy, the settlement unsurprisingly has strong military leanings.

properties.Name: Gralton
properties.text: The inhabitants of Gralton consist almost entirely of people who have fled the ongoing revolution (some would say anarchy) in Galt. Many of those who have fled to Gralton are the old nobility of Galt. Deposed and fallen from grace, they desperately seek any means to regain what they have lost, be it by sponsoring counter-revolutionary activity, or sending parties of hapless adventurers back into Galt to search for family heirlooms left behind in the rush to escape the guillotine's blade. As the desperation of the deposed nobility grew, Gralton began to attract con-artists and tricksters. These tried to hustle the desperate nobility by offering quick fixes and false hope. The town has two notable temples: one to the drunken hero deity, Cayden Cailean, the other to the Vengeful Sting, Calistria. In fact, many suspect the people of Gralton to be possessed by some spirit of Calistria. So bent on vengeance against Galt are they, that many see divine intervention in their hate-filled eyes.

properties.Name: Grand Pass
properties.text: The small city of Grand Pass is located on the cusp of the Mildanesi Mountains, next to the pass that links Xopatl with the neighbouring nation of Innazpa. During the height of the Razatlan Empire, Grand Pass was little more than a watch post but, after the empire's fall, the soldiers who once manned the border-post established the city of Grand Pass. Nowadays, Grand Pass is mostly known for being home to the most renowned fighting school in Xopatl. This school holds a biannual tournament that concludes with a spectacular battle atop the nearby Panischo Mountain, the tournament is so well known that it draws combatants from across the whole of Arcadia.

properties.Name: Graybanks
properties.text: Graybanks is an abandoned Nirmathi town south of Kraggodan.

properties.Name: Grayce
properties.text:
Grayce is an Ustalavic settlement in the south-west of the county of Caliphas with the border of Lastwall, the Path River, a mere stone's throw away. This proximity means the town is a bridge to Lastwall with the Chapel Bridge, a drawbridge that can span the Path, literally fulfilling this role. From the southern end of the bridge, roads lead to Vigil, north-west of Grayce, and to Vellumis to the south.

The townsfolk are predominantly farmers, shepherds, and weavers.

properties.Name: Graydirge
properties.text:
Graydirge is a small, remote, and somber ossuary-city in the foothills of the Shattered Range in north-central Geb. The normal custom of Geb is to re-animate its citizens as undead once they die. Graydirge is literally built out of the bones of those Gebbites who were unwilling or unable to be reanimated. Its inhabitants, no doubt, have their own reasons for living in a city-sized ossuary. Its one notable feature is the Empty Threshold, a temple of Zon-Kuthon. It is home to only one Blood Lord, Berline Haldoli.

Surrounded by a 30-foot wall of fused stone and bone, this city has three main gates to the east, south, and west.

properties.Name: Grayhaven
properties.text: Grayhaven is a settlement built by House Garess in the Golushkin Mountains in Western Brevoy.

properties.Name: Graymoor
properties.text: Graymoor is a relatively peaceful town in Sovereign's Reach, a region of Numeria known more for its history of war and technological horrors. Graymoor is one of the few places on Golarion where androids are welcomed and can live alongside the locals peaceably.

properties.Name: Greenblood
properties.text:
The Free Captains of the Shackles established a pit fight on a rock in the sea just off the coast of the Sodden Lands located northwest of Neruma. It became known as Green Blood on a Black Rock, and its fame spread as far as Avistan.

The popularity of the event led to the settlement of Greenblood growing up close to the site. Its population of brigands are considered to be rough and lawless even by Shackles standards.

properties.Name: Greenglade
properties.text: The Greenglade is a way station on the Marideth River near the city of Tamran in southern Nirmathas. Once a month, it also hosts a bustling market in smuggled weapons and intelligence, particularly for valuable information about the Molthuni Army.

properties.Name: Greengold
properties.text: The port city of Greengold is the second largest settlement in Kyonin, and the only official entry point into the elvish kingdom for non-elves. Situated on Lake Encarthan, Greengold is a popular port of call for traders and diplomats. Greengold generally appears as any other human dockside settlement, except that trees grow in strange places throughout and the yellow roofs on all the buildings makes the city quite distinct.

properties.Name: Gujaraldi
properties.text: Gujaraldi is the capital of Xopatl, located in the central part of the country.

properties.Name: Gulshire
properties.text: Gulshire is a small, exclusive hamlet in Rhuzam region of Druma that specializes in breeding, grooming, and handling prestigious animals.

properties.Name: Gundrun
properties.text: Gundrun is a recently reoccupied town in the area previously referred to as the Worldwound, but now known as the Sarkoris Scar. The people of Gundrun are descendants of the original inhabitants of the area, back when it was known as Sarkoris.

properties.Name: Gunworks
properties.text: The Gunworks of Alkenstar was built in 4620 AR and has been the primary source of firearms in the Grand Duchy and the rest of Golarion ever since.

properties.Name: Gurat
properties.text:
Gurat is a citadel-city nestled high in the Southern Zho Mountains. The imposing city clings to the edge of a precarious mountain spire and is home of the Mouthpiece of Gurat, an ancient cyclops who serves as oracle for the emperor of Kelesh. Visitors are not allowed near the Mouthpiece, who is guarded by a thousand deafened eunuchs. It is believed that the town is named after one of the Mouthpiece's ancestors.

Gurat is considered a holy place to most Qadirans, and pilgrims visit in search of enlightenment. The settlement itself is relatively small, resting on the smallest and flattest of the Zho Mountains, and is surrounded by an 8-foot wall. Gurati locals, known for their open-fire cooking and their weaving, often sit outside their homes, selling their wares to passersby.

The city also has scholarly colleges, with locals traveling there to engage in philosophical and mystical studies. Students are often seen in the streets, discussing such teachings with crowds and passer-byes. Aside from education and basic trade, specialty carpet weavings are often used for flying carpets and it is claimed that some of the woven patterns of their carpets hold secret prophesies, if one can find and interpret their own life thread path.

properties.Name: Hagby
properties.text:
The small trading town of Hagby is located on Glacier Lake in the Irriseni capital province of Thronehold.

Hagby is the last stop for all trade headed to Whitethrone from the west. It is ruled with paranoid scrutiny by the cruel Baroness Ladina. The peasants do not trust anyone knowing that even a hint of the slightest misdemeanor results in harsh punishments. A lot of peasants work their daily duties with missing fingers, eye patches and worse. Yefrem Chelnitsky is the despicable agent of the baroness. He follows her everywhere, with parchment and quill in hand to record every demand and directive his mistress utters.

Despite the overbearing atmosphere, the Heralds of Summer's Return have a lot of members in Hagby including warehouse worker Nakia Serebrynakova and blacksmith Yuri Patasil.

properties.Name: Haigui Wan
properties.text: Haigui Wan is a small town in Shenchu Bay island in the Shackles. It is built on the northeastern peninsula of the island to serve as the base of Shenchu's defensive fleet which protects the island from Dahak's Fang. Most of the fleet's ten ships are kobuksons ("turtle ships").

properties.Name: Hajoth Hakados
properties.text: The small trade city of Hajoth Hakados can be found on the Seven Tears River and was often the first settlement Mendevian Crusaders visited in Numeria on their way north to the Worldwound. Because of this, it seemed more like a city in the nearby River Kingdoms than a true Numerian settlement.

properties.Name: Halabad
properties.text: Halabad is a town on the Rampore Isles in the Shackles, inhabited mainly by slaves who are born and raised there. The town is full of ramshackle housing complexes and equally decrepit breeding centers, where slaves are forced to intermingle and create more slaves. Brutal trainers in the town's training camps teach children at an early age to perform the tasks for which they are made for, breaking their backs and spirits.

properties.Name: Haldun
properties.text:
Haldun is a town on the southern edge of the nation of Rahadoum. It is situated on the main pass linking Rahadoum with the southern lands. At one time it was a thriving centre of trade, dealing with Lirgen and the other lands to the south. The advent of the Eye of Abendego destroyed Lirgen, turning the area into a hurricane-blasted wilderness.

Today Haldun is a fortress town, guarding Rahadoum against incursions of monsters and cultists. It is the centre of the defensive network known as the Rainwall. Its inhabitants are a hardy folk who take a perverse pride in their harsh lives, and see the devastation to the south as a warning as to what happens to those who trust their lives to the gods.

properties.Name: Halgrim
properties.text: The city of Halgrim is the second largest settlement in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings; only Kalsgard is bigger. Located on the northwestern shore of Battlewall, one of the largest islands in the Ironbound Archipelago, Halgrim was founded by King Igarven in 2655 AR. Today, it is ruled by the Linnorm King White Estrid from her palace. The Rustflow River flows out to the sea through Halgrim and, famously, seven bridges cross the river within the city. The city's defenses are greatly enhanced by the constant presence of White Astrid's linnorm thrall, Boiltongue.

properties.Name: Halidon
properties.text: Halidon is a small logging community on the edge of the northern Backar Forest in Molthune. Lying roughly halfway between the capital of Canorate and Braganza, the town is a frequent stop for travelers and has, therefore, a large number of inns with respect to its resident population.

properties.Name: Hallein Town
properties.text: Hallein Town is a small Lastwall settlement located on the Path River downstream of Vigil. Situated at the foot of a high tarn rising from the shores of Lake Hallensee, access to it by land is almost impossible. Hallein Town is the home of the workers for the salt mines in the Virlych hills of nearby Ustalav, and provides vital trade goods for the rest of the nation.

properties.Name: Halmyris
properties.text: Halmyris is a settlement in the Halikarnassos Hills of southern Cheliax, just north of the Cliffs of Fury and located at the eastern end of the Archduchy of Longmarch.

properties.Name: Halvon
properties.text: Halvon is a town in northern Galt, just north of the Boarwood.

properties.Name: Hanpa
properties.text: Hanpa is a town in the Ketz Desert of Qadira.

properties.Name: Harse
properties.text:
Founded in 4536 AR by Sarwin Harse, the town of Harse is an important gateway between Korvosa's inland holdings and its seaward settlements. Positioned at the junction of the Sarwin and Falcon Rivers, the town's twin ferries provide the easiest means of crossing both rivers for travelers in the area.

The town is built on a narrow strip of land between the Sarwin and Falcon rivers, and has been a river crossing since the time before the Chelish arrived. It contains only a few dozen buildings, including a church of Erastil, two grocers, and two taverns (the Spotted Pony, and the Nag Bag). Most of the inhabitants do not live in the village proper, but on isolated farms and ranches spread about the local countryside. The town is known for its horse and livestock breeding, and holds a large rodeo at the Harse Market each year to determine Varisia's top riders and animals.

properties.Name: Haseong
properties.text: Haseong is the cosmopolitan capital of Hwanggot in eastern Tian Xia. This bustling port city is known for its diverse crafts, artworks, and industries, and the many festivals that promote and celebrate them. Each of its many festivals feature competitions and are open to outsiders.

properties.Name: Hatavit
properties.text:
The settlement of Hatavit is a small work camp located in Qadira, south of the Northern Tapur Forest. Designed to house slaves who harvest the bounty of the nearby forest, the town was also a post for woodworkers and carvers.

Recently, a severe sandstorm struck the townan unusual event for the region. It destroyed the town's watchtowers and drove away its guards. The unsupervised slaves fled northeast into the forest to escape their captors, and Katheer has had no contact with the town since.

properties.Name: Haugin's Ear
properties.text: The Isgeri town of Haugin's Ear is situated on the Keld River south of the Chitterwood, right on the border with Cheliax.

properties.Name: Haven
properties.text:
This is an article on the settlement in the Tusk Mountains. For information on the island and settlement in the Mwangi Expanse of the same name, see Haven.

Haven is a secluded and tranquil village nestled within a hidden valley to the north of Hillcross in the Tusk Mountains. Unusually, the village is populated by both Kellids and giants who live peacefully together, who also work together on the terraced farms built into the nearby slopes. Its inhabitants dwell in crude stone structures characterized by monastic simplicity, and the streets regularly see the presence of strangely calm dire bears, smilodons, winter wolves, mammoths, and mastodons.

Despite its serene exterior, Haven guards a deeply unsettling secret. Concealed within the village's grand hall is a cold-tolerant bodysnatcher, a creature notorious for consuming and duplicating the village's guests. The primary servitor of this insidious entity is the druid Lenas. Lenas was the one who discovered the bodysnatcher seedling, nurtured it to maturity, and ultimately offered his own body for its purposes.

Lenas bears the Verdant Stone, an ancient amulet with multifaceted properties. This artifact not only bestows regenerative abilities upon nearby plants but also ensures the longevity of Lenas's vegetative form. Additionally, it grants him complete access to the druidic powers he wielded in life.

properties.Name: Haven
properties.text:
This is an article on the island and settlement in the Mwangi Expanse. For information on the settlement in the Tusk Mountains of the same name, see Haven (Tusk Mountains).

Haven is a clouded island in the middle of Lake Ocota that contains the largest settlement of Kallijae elves. The fog that surrounds the island serves the Kallijae well, as they prefer highly defensible and hard-to-find areas to settle. Because of how hard it is for others to find, Haven serves as a place to retreat to and recuperate. The Kallijae sometimes call it Last Stand to reflect this.

properties.Name: Hawah
properties.text: Hawah is a city in the Ketz Desert of Qadira.

properties.Name: Hazrak
properties.text: Hazrak is a minotaur settlement located in the Riven Hills of the Isle of Kortos in Absalom. Its inhabitants can trace their town's origins all the way back to the First Siege of Absalom in 23 AR. During this war, the minotaur warlord Voradni Voon brought thousands of his kind through the Brazen Arch to lay siege to Absalom. After their defeat by the god Aroden himself, the surviving minotaurs fled to the central highlands of the island, where they (or their descendants) founded Hazrak, and continue to harass the other races of the island to this day.

properties.Name: He Ming
properties.text: He Ming is the rowdy capital of Quain, in southern Tian Xia, and home to the nation's temples and government. Its heroes often demolish property while testing themselves and each other in its bustling streets, to such a point that tradesfolk have a well-known saying about the city: "To grow rich, move to He Ming."

properties.Name: Heger
properties.text: Heger is a Qadiran city in the Meraz Desert region that separates Qadira from the rest of the Empire of Kelesh. The Meraz Desert once used to be fertile land before it was sapped of life by the Heralds of Dust. Heger is located along the coastline where the desert meets the Obari Ocean, between the cities of Izzet to the north and Husanah to the south.

properties.Name: Heggapnod
properties.text: Heggapnod is a small village on the Cannibal Isles in the Shackles. Heggapnod has been at war with the neighboring village of Kukgukmol for years. The two villages rapidly lose men, and they will surely obliterate one another if nobody steps in to stop them. The Blood Queen enjoys this bloodshed and watches the weekly massacres through its kuru surrogates in each village.

properties.Name: Heldren
properties.text: The peasant village of Heldren is found in the Sophra Prefecture in southern Taldor lying close to the Border Wood.

properties.Name: Helkgen
properties.text:
Helkgen is a small town on the shores of Glacier Lake in the Irriseni province of Bleakmarch.

The Ulfen residents of Helkgen are struggling to support the merchant ships hugging the shores of Glacier Lake as Jadwiga overlords demand, but also to collect sufficient tribute throughout the year to give to the unforgiving scrags of Scrag Deep.

The current Helkgen's mayor is Valka Dagsdottir who is earning the ire of townsfolk while working hard keeping them safe from the scrags.

properties.Name: Hell Harbor
properties.text:
Hell Harbor is the largest settlement on the island of Devil's Arches, in the Shackles. It is ruled by the pirate lord Arronax Endymion, a member of the Pirate Council. Endymion is a fan of traditional Chelish opera, and the town boasts the Shackles' only opera house, the Three-Horned Hall. It is not clear whether the other residents share his passion for the arts, but those seeking the pirate lord's favour make a point of sitting through performances.

The city takes its name from the numerous imps which live in the area. Endymion is a mutineer from the Chelish Navy, and is worried that some of the imps may be Chelish spies. As a result, he has recently started trying to eradicate them. Ethnic Chelaxians (apart from members of Endymion's own squadron, the Devils' Own) are not welcome in the town, for the same reason. Any who arouse Endymion's suspicions are thrown into the city's prison, the Wretched Furnace.

Pirates established the port town of Hell Harbor in the early years of the Shackles, as the natural harbor is deep and easy to defend. They used limestone from ancient quarries and Ghol-Gan ruins to build tall watchtowers flanking its narrow harbor entrance. The Faded Seahorse is a tavern renowned for its cyclops bouncer Eriboe.

properties.Name: Hellirinn
properties.text: The town of Hellirinn can be found on the banks of the Rimeflow River a few miles downstream from Trollheim in the Linnorm Kingdom of Hagreach in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The town is located near an ancient Pharasmin shrine: a warm spring located in a cave.

properties.Name: Helsingbyen
properties.text: Helsingbyen is the largest town in Almhult. It is located on the tip of Cape Almhult, where the Steaming Sea meets the Gulf of Svallmundr, not far to the east of Roshik.

properties.Name: Heslandaena
properties.text:
Heslandaena is a subterranean settlement below the island of Dahak's Tooth in the Shackles. The cenotes that dot the island offer aquatic entry to miles of sea caves, which eventually emerge into unflooded, humid caverns. These moldy dark caves and passages lead to Heslandaena. The isolated town is inhabited by drow cut off from the Darklands many years ago by a curse.

The dark elves were part of the Harkule clan. They offended a powerful matriarch and were banished for their insolence. The isolated drow town is ruled by matriarch Pelanquelle, wicked and resentful for her exile. A number of pirate captains know about the drow settlement and are trusted by its ruler: Adis Vraisdottir, captain of the fast sloop North Wind, which sails out of Mezdrubal; White Hollis Dobilo, captain of the brig Stormrunner, which sails from Drenchport; and Constanza Purgote, captain of the sloop Constanza's Whim which sails from Port Peril.

The three pirates, each unaware of the others, all have lucrative trading deals with matriarch Pelanquelle bringing foodstuffs and supplies in exchange for raw gemstones and rare subterranean substances.

properties.Name: Hidden Lake
properties.text: Hidden Lake is a hidden city of alchemists that is concealed within the depths of Forest of Thieves in the north of central Xopatl. Hidden Lake remains hidden thanks to the magical properties of the Forest of Thieves. Those who venture into the forest with a destination in mind re-emerge mere hours later; only those who can clear their mind and embrace getting lost can ever find their way to Hidden Lake. The city itself is home to many alchemists who use the magical plants of the Forest of Thieves to create particularly potent concoctions.

properties.Name: High Isle
properties.text: High Isle, along with its sister city of Low Isle, provides much of the seafood for the nation of Xopatl. Located along the south-western coast of Xopatl on a small island in Lake Tapipallati, High Isle is renowned for its seafood. The fishermen of High Isle go on weeks-long fishing trips into the lake's depths to hunt for giant catfish and other large lake monsters.

properties.Name: Highdelve
properties.text: Highdelve is a settlement built by House Garess in the Golushkin Mountains in Western Brevoy.

properties.Name: Highhelm
properties.text:
This article covers the dwarven city. For the Pathfinder Lost Omens sourcebook, see Highhelm (sourcebook).

Highhelm is among the most influential of the ancient and expansive dwarven settlements known as Sky Citadels. Constructed and founded in -4880 AR during the Age of Darkness within and beneath lofty Emperor's Peak in the Five Kings Range, it has remained the center of dwarven culture on Avistan for millennia.

properties.Name: Hillcross
properties.text: Not so much a true city as a stable, permanent location for a vast tent city, Hillcross serves as a meeting ground for the various nomadic tribes of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords.

properties.Name: Hinji
properties.text: Hinji is a Chelish port city in the Archduchy of Longmarch, located on the Inner Sea west of Longmast Cape and east of Macini.

properties.Name: Hisuikarasu
properties.text: Hisuikarasu (pronounced hee-soo-ee-Kah-rah-soo) is the capital of the tengu nation of Kwanlai, in Tian Xia. A relatively prosperous city in chaotic Kwanlai, Hisuikarasu is ruled by the half-celestial benevolent autocrat Lady Sutarai-Gongen. Lady Sutarai-Gongen's popularity is such that her power is beginning to spread beyond the capital to the rest of Kwanlai.

properties.Name: Hiyosai
properties.text:
Located on the edge of the Okaiyo Ocean, Hiyosai is the capital city of the Dokaigan Province of Minkai. Dokaigan Province is known as "the eastern treasury of Minkai" due to the rich copper mines that sit to the south of the city of Hiyosai. Unfortunately, Hiyosai is regularly attacked by ferocious siyokoy that dwell amongst the coral-encrusted ruins of Sangoshi. As a result of this the harbor guard and local samurai train endlessly with various pole arms to help them repel aquatic attacks.

Families in Hiyosai with unusually light skin and green eyes claim to be descended from survivors of Sangoshi, a once-thriving city that sank beneath the Okaiyo Ocean centuries ago.

properties.Name: Hoarwood
properties.text: The city of Hoarwood lies in the cold, northern nation of Irrisen. Situated at the heart of the Hoarwood Forest, the entire city is carved from the trunk of a petrified tree of incredible size. Its only other claim to fame is the wild debauchery of the constant parties thrown by its ruler, Anelisha Elvanna, and her brother and lover Ghrathis.

properties.Name: Hokkshi
properties.text: Hokkshi is the largest city in northern Minkai and a crucial stop for travelers on their way to the nearby Forest of Spirits.

properties.Name: Holvirgang
properties.text: The frost giant town of Holvirgang is located in the far north of the witch realm of Irrisen, hard against the icy tundra of the Crown of the World. Built into the side of a glacier, the town is composed of an outer walled bailey open to all, and the caverns of Holvir carved into the ice, where only the frost giants are allowed.

properties.Name: Hunthul
properties.text: Hunthul is the capital of the relatively new hobgoblin nation of Oprak. This is where the largest connection to the Onyx Citadel in Oprak is located.

properties.Name: Husanah
properties.text: Husanah is a Qadiran city in the Meraz Desert, the barren region that separates Qadira from the rest of the Empire of Kelesh. The Meraz Desert once used to be fertile land before it was sapped of life by the Heralds of Dust. Husanah is located along the coastline where the desert meets the Obari Ocean and is the southernmost city in Qadira. The city of Heger is the nearest large settlement and located north-west along the coastline.

properties.Name: Hyannis
properties.text: Hyannis is an Ustalavic coal-mining settlement in the county of Versex; the forlorn shacks of the villagers are set on the edge of the Hungry Mountains near to the source of the Danver River. The village and the mines are still haunted by the greenish spectre of the witch called Black Aggie, whom the villagers rose up against nearly forty years ago; they ripped the monster to pieces then burnt her before casting her remains into an abandoned mine. Worse than the hauntings, though, are the miners who become possessed by what is considered Black Aggie's suffocating breath.

properties.Name: Hyrantam
properties.text: Hyrantam, the Drowned City, was once the capital of Lirgen, in what today is known as the Sodden Lands. The Saoc Brethren built hundreds of towers for use as observatories. The coming of the Eye of Abendego drowned the city, but the tops of the towers remain above the water. The city's remaining population live atop the towers, which they have connected with a crude network of rope bridges and pulleys. For some reason, aberrations from the depths of the Arcadian Ocean are drawn to these observatories, so the city is a dangerous place.

properties.Name: Iadara
properties.text: The illusion-shrouded city of Iadara (pronounced eye-uh-DAR-ah) is the beautiful capital of the elven kingdom of Kyonin.

properties.Name: Iadenveigh
properties.text: Iadenveigh is a reclusive and isolated town of woodsmen and hunters in southern Numeria on the upper reaches of the Dagger River. Located on the northern outskirts of the Echo Wood, the citizens of Iadenveigh reject any association with the Technic League that controls the Numerian capital of Starfall.

properties.Name: Iarna
properties.text:
Iarna is a small town on the Marbleflow River in the Irriseni province of Wintercrux. The town is a popular destination for Jadwiga and rich foreign merchants because of its famous hot springs. There are three resorts catering to the aristocracy as well as expensive restaurants and two grand theaters.

The hot springs began bubbling up some 200 years ago and are thought to have magical and medicinal powers although nothing has been proven. Hundreds of ageing or sick Jadwiga bathe in the hot springs every year. The truth is that a trapped and insane magma elemental heats Iarna's springs. The elemental was summoned by druids of the Heralds of Summer's Return 200 years ago but was captured and bound by Iarna's baroness at the time. The current ruler of Iarna, Baroness Iracetta knows the truth but prefers not to damage the town's businesses. The ageing Iracetta is a strong advertiser of the springs' therapeutic qualities.

Jazdya Vacalav, captain of Iarna's town guard, often fights fire and magma scamps who are attracted by the insane elemental.

properties.Name: Icestair
properties.text: Icestair is the largest settlement in the Realm of the Mammoth Lords, wedged against the wall of ice that marks the edge of the Crown of the World.

properties.Name: Ihalar
properties.text: Ihalar is an underground city that sits between the Obari Ocean and the Meraz Desert. It is the westernmost example of the Khattibi-style underground settlements. The residents emerge only to graze their herds and trade with passing merchants. The city boasts many underground gardens sustained by the city's light wells although the lowest levels of the city have quietly been abandoned.

properties.Name: Ilizmagorti
properties.text:
The city of Ilizmagorti (pronounced ihl-izz-mah-GOR-tee) is the only settlement of any size on Mediogalti Island.

Known to its foes as Scum Tide City, and to its friends as the Black Pearl of the Tropics, the city's exact location is unlikely to appear on any map thanks to the efforts of the Red Mantis to remove it from all records. Many of the ships that dock in the harbour are pirates, but the port is also used by a number of (comparatively) honest merchant vessels.

The population is also assumed to include a large number of Red Mantis assassins, which means a certain wariness is probably advisable when dealing with strangers.

properties.Name: Illmarsh
properties.text: Illmarsh, formerly called Baytown, is a town in the southern Ustalavic province of Versex. It is rumored that a significant fraction of the population is a member of the Old Cults.

properties.Name: Ilsurian
properties.text: Ilsurian is a small agricultural and fishing town situated on the northern banks of Lake Syrantula at the mouth of the Skull River. The town is on the Yondabakari Road, 64 miles northeast of Whistledown (and a total of 359 miles east of the city of Magnimar). The Yondabakari Road continues towards the town of Biston, 45 miles to the east.

properties.Name: Inahiyi
properties.text: Inahiyi (pronounced ee-naa-HEE-yee), located in the flooded crater of Mount Shibotai at the center of Minata's Shibobeka Islands, is home to tribes of wayangs. Many of the city's wayangs work to appease a demon thought to still live in the caldera.

properties.Name: Indapatta
properties.text: Indapatta is the breathtakingly beautiful capital of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra that was founded by the first Maharajah Khiben-Sald. The city is located within the Golden Basin region of Vudra on the north-eastern banks of Sona Lake.

properties.Name: Ipeq
properties.text: Located along the banks of the Crook River, Ipeq (pronounced ahy-PECK) is the third-largest city in southern Osirion. According to legend, Ipeq was summoned into existence in a single day by Pharaoh An-Hepsu VII. Ipeq stands on the southern bank of the river and completely blocks the Shallows of Ipeq, one of only three ways of crossing the Crook on foot.

properties.Name: Iqaliat
properties.text:
Iqaliat is a small village of Erutaki humans in the Crown of the World, built into the side of Alasek Ridge on the southern boundary of the High Ice some miles west of the Path of Aganhei. It is constructed beneath the cliff's overhanging ridge. Most of the town is made up of small stone and clay brick buildings and subsists on water from an underground stream.

Iqaliat is protected by its location beneath the cliffs. Travelers can only enter the village through a gatehouse above several earthen ramps. Other sites in the village include low towers inhabited by the village's chieftain Nalvanaq and its shaman Tunuak, Hearthmistress Sonavut's small house, a goat pen, a kennel for the village's dogs, and a subterranean cistern. A small tunnel leads up to the cliff top, where one can find several inukshuks, altars to the Erutaki wind spirits.

The white dragon Vegsundvaag keeps her lair not far from Iqaliat.

properties.Name: Irim
properties.text: Irim is a city of aquatic elves hidden in the continental margin off the northern coast of Ravounel and west of Nidal in Nisroch Bay.

properties.Name: Irrere
properties.text:
The town of Irrere, located on the island of Irrere in the Ironbound Archipelago, is renowned for its exotic architecture. The establishment of the gnome monastery of Shay Citadels close to the town led to an increase in the town's population.

Its residents enforce a policy of extreme isolationism, although gnomes frequently make pilgrimages to Irrere, especially those who are feeling the effects of the Bleaching. It is believed that the monks of the Shay Citadels possess curative magic that can ward off this racial curse.

Although few natives leave Irrere, those who do often possess great wisdom and insighta result of deep self-reflection typically uncharacteristic of other gnomes.

properties.Name: Isa
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Isa", please see Isa (person).

Isa is a Qadiran town in the south of the Maharev region located on the banks of the Meraz River where the river acts as the border between Maharev and the Meraz Desert region. The Maharev region is one of the safest and most fertile regions in all Qadira.

properties.Name: Isarn
properties.text: The city of Isarn remains the capital of Galt and the home of its legislature, as well as of the Revolutionary Council.

properties.Name: Ishad
properties.text: Ishad is one of the numerous large, prosperous cities that dot the fertile Qadiran region of Pashman. It is located on the banks of the Pashman River along Pashman's south-western border with the neighbouring region of Tapur.

properties.Name: Isseld
properties.text: Isseld is a minor town on the Frozen Road in Irrisen's Feyfrost province where most people earn their living from the trade on the river. The settlement has recently become known as the center of the trade in "primitive wares", mostly carved fetishes and talismans crafted by the Kellid barbarians of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords.

properties.Name: Iz
properties.text: The city of Iz (pronounced IZ) was the first to fall to the demonic forces which poured out of the Worldwound in 4606 AR.

properties.Name: Izzet
properties.text: Izzet is a Qadiran city in the Meraz Desert region that separates Qadira from the rest of the Empire of Kelesh. The Meraz Desert once used to be fertile land before it was sapped of life by the Heralds of Dust. Izzet is located along the coastline where the desert meets the Obari Ocean, between the cities of Ihalar to the north and Heger to the south.

properties.Name: Jaagiin
properties.text: Jaagiin is a trade town in the Crown of the World that lies along the Path of Aganhei at the western end of Lake Buriyiim. The capital of the Osman Confederation, it is home to a permanent assembly of speakers who represent the numerous villages that crowd about the lake.

properties.Name: Jaha
properties.text: Jaha is a great crumbling city in the northern part of the Mwangi Jungle in the Mwangi Expanse.

properties.Name: Jainai
properties.text: Jainai is a sarangay city on the southern portion of Bukorang island in Minata.

properties.Name: Jambis
properties.text: Jambis was once a thriving community in the Taldan county of Meratt, but is now nothing more than ruins and has been that way since at least 4708 AR.

properties.Name: Janderhoff
properties.text: Janderhoff is a dwarven Sky Citadel and settlement in southeastern Varisia's Mindspin Mountains, north of Korvosa and south of the Cinderlands. It is a firm trading partner and competitor of Korvosa, and also retains good relations with the Shoanti of the Storval Plateau. It holds the greatest concentration of dwarves in Varisia, and boasts one of the largest populations of Shoanti outside of the Cinderlands. Its smiths are well-known throughout the region.

properties.Name: Jawafeeq
properties.text: Jawafeeq is a city on the Alavah Peninsula of Qadira.

properties.Name: Jayat-Von
properties.text: Jayat-Von is the largest city in the northern region of Vudra known as the Crying Jungle and is that region's capital city. The Crying Jungle is one of the densest, most verdant jungles in all of Casmaron, and like the rest of the region the city is overgrown with jungle foliage.

properties.Name: Jitai
properties.text: Jitai (pronounced gee-TAI) is a city located in the former heartland of Imperial Lung Wa in the Successor State of Po Li. The nation is ruled by the powerful Oracular Council that allows no worship of other gods other than that of the idea of the Eternal Emperor.

properties.Name: Jol
properties.text: The city of Jol (pronounced JOL) is located to the south of the Grungir Forest and is the capital of Southmoor in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The city is old and built on the ruins of the Thassilonian city of Torandey; it was founded in 1102 AR by King Eskir Honeytongue. It is ruled by Linnorm King Ostog the Unslain who recently came to power after his predecessor Opir Eightfingers vanished.

properties.Name: Jolizpan
properties.text: Jolizpan is a city located in the extreme northwest of Xopatl, near Tumbaja Mountain, the nexus of Xopatl's Veins of Creation.

properties.Name: Jormurdun
properties.text: Jormurdun is one of the ten ancient Sky Citadels built by the newly emergent dwarves at the end of their Quest for Sky. Lost from history for thousands of years after invasion and disaster until 4713 AR, it is located in the Wolfcrags, a largely uninhabited range of hills in the northwest of the Sarkoris Scar's (formerly the Worldwound's) Frostmire region.

properties.Name: Jovvox
properties.text: Jovvox is a largely gnomish town east of the city of Mivon. Originally built around a remote monastery by the enterprising gnome merchant Jov, Jovvox's weaponsmiths specialize in producing large quantities of cheap weapons, fast, thereby undercutting competition. Their raw materials come from a small nearby iron mine and from halfling and human scouts who also make Jovvox home and scavenge battlefields throughout the region for cast-offs that could be recycled. Kellywells, the current leader of the town, is known for crafting exotic, novel weapons.

properties.Name: Jula
properties.text: Jula is a coastal village in the southern Sodden Lands, populated by hardy folk who defy the Eye of Abendego and refuse to leave the Sodden Lands for more temperate climes.

properties.Name: Jyito
properties.text:
Jyito (pronounced JEE-toe) is the largely ruined capital of the oni nation of Chu Ye. Located in northeastern Tian Xia on Sapphire Sound, Jyito was a bustling city of almost 30,000 people before the fall of Lung Wa. Oni, giants, and ogres long since roamed the streets, frequently bringing in fresh slaves to replace those who were killed or eaten.

The most prosperous region of modern Jyito is under the waters off its shores, where sea oni and merfolk live, and the old city's sole standing structure is its imposing shogun's castle.
