Traders are grudgingly let into the settlement, provided they do not stray too far from the bazaar and inns.

properties.Name: Oenopion
properties.text:
The Nexian city of Oenopion (pronounced oh-NOH-pee-ohn) is known as a center for alchemical production. Here they brew potions and elixirs which factor heavily in Nex's economy. The homunculi they create have a reputation for cunning and dependability, and the city also has a well-known golemworks. Within laboratories, mages and alchemists also work together in their perfection of the so-called art of fleshwarping.

The central lake is the site of a massive ooze colony that has developed a hivemind.<reef>Ron Lundeen. The Slithering in The Slithering, 8. Paizo Inc., 2020</ref> As well as being a useful means of disposing of unwanted items and people, the ooze has proved to be useful in divination magic.

Oenopion is represented on Nex's ruling body, the Council of Three and Nine, by master alchemist Borume.

properties.Name: Okeno
properties.text: The harbor city of Okeno, located on the southern coast of Stonespine Island off the eastern shore of Katapesh, is the third-largest city in Katapesh. Also known as the Yellow City, its bustling slave markets host up to 1,000 slavers, buyers, and travelers at any given time and is the largest slave market in the Inner Sea region.

properties.Name: Okim
properties.text: Okim is one of the many cities of the Tian Xia nation of Linvarre, which was formerly the Taldan colony of Amanandar. Formerly a military outpost, Okim is now primarily known for its fireworks production, which is said to have drawn organized criminals from Seidoyaji and Todorokaze seeking to sell black powder across neighboring Kwanlai.

properties.Name: Okormirr
properties.text:
Okormirr is a now largely abandoned settlement in the northwestern corner of Iobaria. The first human settlement in Iobaria, it was founded in 752 AR when 20 survivors of an Ulfen expedition set up a longhouse to survive the winter. A settlement soon grew up around the longhouse, becoming Okormirr: the first of nine Ulfen settlements of Njalgard. Resettled many times over the centuries, Okormirr retains much of its original Ulfen character, with log lodges, dragon poles, and wooden palisades.

Okormirr sits on the northeastern shore of the Lake of Mists and Veils, south of the Ardshrod River. Now inhabited mostly by druids and their families, the city resents Prince Tzakiv Korya of Orlov's many promises to restore his city and kingdom to greatness. Okormirr is ruled by the Druid-King Aalgin, who requires all who live in Okormirr to swear allegiance to his druid circle and their god, Perbov.

Regardless of these requirements, the results of Aalgin's rule has led to many positive changes in the area. These include the once-disgusting mire surrounding the town now being drinkable, and the town being protected from the elements by spruce canopies now interwoven to form a magical barrier.

properties.Name: Old Sehir
properties.text: Old Sehir is a small town in western Taldor, approximately 90 miles northwest of the capital city of Oppara.

properties.Name: Olfden
properties.text: Olfden is a large Andoren town located in the nation's Darkmoon Vale region, halfway between Falcon's Hollow and Oregent, and only a few miles away from Adamas, headquarters of the Diamond Regiment.

properties.Name: Ollo
properties.text:
The town of Ollo is one of the largest settlements in the Shackles. It is ruled by the cruel pirate Avimar Sorrinash, a member of the Pirate Council.

Ollo is on Shark Island and is plagued by raids from the sedacthys who live in the sea near the island. These raids are carried out with Sorrinash's permission, and the people of Ollo live in daily fear of a sedacthy attack.

properties.Name: Omash
properties.text: Omash is a fortress-city in northern Qadira near the border of Taldor that lies on the eastern end of the Satrapy's patrols. The city contains a dozen schools of war from which the satrap personally chooses warriors for special duties. Each of them specializes in a different tactic or troop type: there are schools for horse cavalry, camel cavalry, carpet cavalry, archery, polearms, siege warfare, and castle-storming. Some of the Peerless, the personal advisors to the satrap, have come from these schools.

properties.Name: Omesta
properties.text: Omesta is a town in the northwestern Fierani Forest of Kyonin, inhabited primarily by treehouse-dwelling gnomes, who have been living there since before the elves' return to Golarion.

properties.Name: Oppara
properties.text: Oppara, the City of Empire, (pronounced oh-PAH-rah) is the capital of Taldor, and by far the largest city in the realm. It is an ancient and thriving city which earned the title the Gilded City because of the many roofs, spires, and domes that once glittered with gold plating in the high afternoon sun. Even though the metal was long ago stripped away, Oppara remains the example of what the empire once was and what it could be again, though, today, it is plagued with mismanagement, selfish aristocrats, poverty, and crime.

properties.Name: Ordu-Aganhei
properties.text:
Ordu-Aganhei (pronounced ORd AGan-hi) the City at the Edge of the World, is the capital city of the nation of Hongal in northern Tian Xia. It is also only one of two major settlementsthe other being Muliwanin the whole country.

While Ordu-Aganhei is technically the capital of Hongal, the ruler of Hongal spends little time there. Instead, the nation's khan also rules the nation's most powerful nomadic tribe, and wanders with them as the greatest horseback riding tribe. Traditionally, the ruler of Ordu-Aganhei is one of the khan of Hongal's brothers.

properties.Name: Oregent
properties.text: Oregent (pronounced OHR-eh-gehnt) is a city in central Andoran located south of Darkmoon Vale. It is home to the Lumber Consortium, and acts as a gateway for traffic both to and from the Vale.

properties.Name: Orjotoro
properties.text: Orjotoro is a city located in eastern Xopatl, where the Limardero River flows into the Follower's River. It is home to the merchant's guild that monitors imports and exports between Xopatl, Razatlan, and Innazpa via Follower's River, and sees constant traffic from boats picking up and delivering goods. It is the central city of the three Follower's Rests on the river that serve as trade checkpoints along its length.

properties.Name: Orlendas
properties.text:
Orlendas has been destroyed and rebuilt over a dozen times in its history. Plagues, fires, wars, and centaur hordes have all been the cause of Orlendas' fall at least once, but the town's importance to Orlov and Franax as a source of timber for their shipbuilding industries has kept settlers returning. The demand for lumber has waned over the years, but, along with small pelts, it still remains one of the town's primary imports.

The town's current komar, Galtan ranger Kasrel Unilich, has brought investment to the town, and Orlendas is now better defended and more prosperous than at any point in its history.

properties.Name: Orlov
properties.text:
Orlov, the former coastal capital and oldest city of Iobaria, is today but a ruin of its former glory. Located on the Lake of Mists and Veils, Orlov was founded in 753 AR by explorers from Okormirr who discovered the ancient Koloran Roads. Built on top of the ruins of a cyclopean city, Orlov grew quickly, becoming larger than Orkomirr in 764 AR, and eventually the first proper city in the nation of Njalgard.

In 905 AR, Iobar, heir of Orlov's ruler Kjell, usurped the nine koffars of Njalgard and established the nation of Iobaria, with Orlov as its capital. However, after the fall of Old Iobaria in 3150 AR, Orlov was conquered by foreign powers and their pawns. In 3212 AR, Orlov was reclaimed by three warlords, marking the start of the century-long War of Restoration. During the period of New Iobaria that followed, Antoll served as capital instead of Orlov.

During 4000 AR the city was attacked by, and repelled, an invasion by frost giants from the Ice Steppes who had pillaged their way across the nation. In 4659 AR, the "plague of boils and bone-aches" hit Franax, and that town's great shipworks moved to Orlov.

Due to the town's numerous ups and downs, its population now numbers at less than half of its former numbers, and much of the city has crumbled into ruins, with the stonemasons walling off complexes deemed too ruined to inhabit. Its scheming prince, Tzakiv Korya, dreams of re-establishing the Empire, but he lacks enough troops to fully man the city's ancient fortifications. Still, the Prince has managed to build some alliances with adventure-seekers and investors in Cheliax and the River Kingdoms.

The city contains many towering structures, built by cyclopes.

properties.Name: Orolo's Quay
properties.text: Orolo's Quay is a nearly forgotten seaside town on Nidal's Conqueror's Bay. Before the founding of the Varisian city-states of Korvosa and Magnimar, it was the last port before the long voyage through the wilderness to the cities of the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. These days, the town and its Chelish fortress dating back to the Everwar have fallen into stark neglect, as very few ships dock here anymore. The only ships who make anchor at the crumbling wharf are those either desperate for supplies, or are smugglers bringing goods into Nidal who wish to avoid the harsh authorities in Nisroch farther south. The first floor of the fortress has been converted into a shabby inn and trading post, with an attached stable of little note. Recently, rumors have begun to circulate that smugglers pay handsomely to store contraband in the fortress' old dungeons.

properties.Name: Orost
properties.text:
Orost is a trade town of increasing importance in Iobaria. Founded in 780 AR, Orost is the only safe stop on the roads between Mirnbay and Orlov, and thus a site of great importance to the various factions vying for control of Iobaria. Envoys and diplomats from Mirnbay, Orlov, Kridorn, and Veka frequent the town alongside those seeking goods, and local law enforcement is forced to protect local citizens from the intrigue and battles these visitors bring.

At the centre of Orost stands a massive wood and stone building that houses the current komar. The temple is a human construct built over a massive, ancient stone temple. The mosaics on the floor of this temple feature stars, and while the town and its fortifications have taken on a rough star shape over the years, it is from these mosaics that Orost gets its name.

properties.Name: Ortalaca
properties.text: Ortalaca is a small town in the southwestern-most foothills of Taldor's Southern Range mountains, located near the intersection of the Ligos, Lingian, Sophra, and Whitemarch Prefectures.

properties.Name: Osibu
properties.text:
The streets of the southeastern city of Osibu are literally paved with gold. Located in the Screaming Jungle within the greater Mwangi Expanse, the city is protected by a ring of statues called the Circle of Twice-Honored Women, which somehow reduces the cacophony of noise from the jungle and also keeps out the jungle's carnivorous plant life. Osibu is incredibly well hidden, with many maps not even acknowledging its existence, or misleading readers to another city or ruin within the Mwangi Expanse. Finding the city is an ordeal that involves many trials with the dangerous flora and fauna along the way.

The city is a democracy, and life is a veritable utopia for its inhabitants. There are plentiful supplies of fruit and water, and the city's wise-women are able to mix rare herbs to produce an ointment which greatly extends life and staves off diseases.

Osibu is home to possibly Golarion's oldest living creature, the hunched arboreal regent Dimari-Diji, Final Tree of the Elder World. The ancient arboreal regent's first memory is the coming of the Starstone nearly ten thousand years ago. Dimari-Diji guards the Nemesis Well, a way between worlds.

properties.Name: Ostenso
properties.text: Ostenso is a major port city on the southern coast of Cheliax, just east of Cape Erebus, and is the easternmost city in the country. Ostenso is currently the home port of the Chelish Navy with grand, spacious docks. The naval works here are the largest on the continent, making up a quarter of the city that sprawls over the water. Another quarter of the city stands upon a line of stones known as Custodisce Break, which stretches half a mile into the sea and forms the natural harbour.

properties.Name: Otari
properties.text: Otari is a small port town near the Immenwood on the south coast of the Isle of Kortos, about halfway between Absalom and Diobel. It is located at the head of a bay of the Inner Sea. It is a modern but relatively quiet settlement, and is popular among retired Pathfinders, many of whom operate businesses there. Important to the economy of Absalom as a whole is Otari's lumber trade: timber cut from the Immenwood arrives by road into Otari and, from there, is traded across the Inner Sea region.

properties.Name: Outsea
properties.text: Outsea is a town in the River Kingdoms containing farmland, swampland, rivers, and canals. Its citizens include both aquatic species as well as air-breathers. Military service is mandated for all water-breathers and a few landlubbers serve in respected voluntary battalions. Locks and gates separate freshwater and salt water, preventing the districts from flowing into each other. Beneath the waterline, coral reefs and seaweed form underwater structures. Fish, octopuses, and other aquatic animals are prevalent. Mages of Outsea are known for their strong tradition of practicing water magic. Unique spells of merfolk and sedacthy origins can be found only in this kingdom.

properties.Name: Oyster Cay
properties.text:
The port of Oyster Cay is in the Mainland region of the Shackles.

It is currently suffering as two Free Captains vie for control of the port, namely Havalas Grudd and his estranged lover Wide Olga.

properties.Name: Padiskar
properties.text: Padiskar was once known as the Shimmering Jewel of Jalmeray, when it was a city famous both for pleasure and for arcane learning. The Arclords of Nex found a nameless horror in the vaults beneath Old Padiskar, and today the city is reduced to being a community of farmers and fisherfolk. The city rings the ancient ruins, surrounding, but never entering them. Whatever awful thing the Arclords released still roams the darkened depths below Padiskar, howling in the blackness. Unlike many other old ruins, Padiskar has yet to be reclaimed by the Thakur and the locals whisper that there may be some fell reason for this. Some have even claimed the Arclords released a bound god which had been transported to the island by Khiben-Sald himself, thousands of years ago.

properties.Name: Pagked
properties.text: Pagked is a small town in decline, that was once full of bustling factories.

properties.Name: Palin's Cove
properties.text:
Named for the Keyra Palin, naval heroine of early Korvosa, Palin's Cove is one of the most important holdings of the city-state's realm. Originally a military outpost, Palin's Cove played a vital role in early Chelish victories over the Shoanti. Located approximately 80 miles northwest of Korvosa at the mouth of the Falcon River, Palin's Cover served as a naval garrison until 4485 AR, when it became an official settlement of the city.

Over the years, a number of extensive Shoanti sieges were laid on the town, but it never fell, and was rewarded by Korvosa with a strong industrial presence. Modern-day Palin's Cove can be identified for miles around by the cloud of thick black smoke which rises from its many factories. The pollution caused by the industrial epicenter of the town have caused great animosity and even violence from druids, Gozreh worshipers, and even ordinary smiths and craftsmen pushed out of their niche in the market by the overwhelming workhouses.

Not only do the catapults, ballistae, and trebuchets it produces serve as major exports both for the town and Korvosa, but they remain ever ready for another attack, a remnant of the town's military origins. Despite these defenses, Palin's Cove has long been plagued by the red dragon Glarataxus, who has periodically tormented the town since his first attack in 4571.

properties.Name: Pangolais
properties.text: Pangolais is the capital city of Nidal. Located deep within the Uskwood, the trees' heavy canopy makes even the brightest day nearly as dark as the blackest night in the softly glittering, city of shadows. Visitors to the city must seek permission to enter, and once inside must seek the services of a local guide. These guides come at great expense since visitors can easily become lost in the darkness of the city, and because it is illegal for outsiders to roam about unattended. Hidden worshipers of Desna and the rare diabolist also make their homes in Pangolais. These rare few provide the only possible assistance to visitors who arrive without the permission of the city's rulers, the mysterious Black Triune.

properties.Name: Parley Point
properties.text:
The surprisingly welcoming port of Parley Point is on the coast of the Garundi mainland region of the Shackles. It is a popular port of call for merchant captains travelling north, who often stop off here before braving the storms of the Eye of Abendego. It is renowned for its friendly citizens and fine inns (and brothels).

The Parley Point lighthouse warns passing vessels of the nearby reefs and dangerous surf. The crews of those vessels that do run aground are rescued by the town's fleet of galleys.

However, what the sailors fail to realise is that the town also has a second, false lighthouse further inland, that is sometimes used to fool captains into running aground. The citizens rescue these sailors in the same way as the others, but also surreptitiously make off with as much of their cargo as they can salvage.

properties.Name: Pashow
properties.text: Pashow is the smallest of Thuvia's five allied city-states. It lies in the barren south of the country, in a location conveniently close to the Citadel of the Alchemist but lacking in natural resources. It was ruled by Emir Guldis until very recently. The city's inhabitants are known for their magical talents and revere Nethys as their patron deity. They use magic to help compensate for the harshness of the local environment.

properties.Name: Pastorling
properties.text: Pastorling is a small Taldan hamlet that stands in both the literal and figurative shadow of the nearby fortress of Canalsguard. Pastorling sits at the intersection of three of the Lingian Prefecture's canals (alongside Canalsguard) and the reek of their stagnant waters has kept the hamlet free from any real aristocratic interference. The Lingian Canals are notoriously dangerous and at least some of this is due to one of Pastorling's residents: Lesah Voriovixis. To the town, she is but a humble baker but, in reality, she is the heart of a network of organised crime known as the Canal Syndicate. Cunningly, she hides her communications using a hidden cypher based on the braids and fillings of the pies she sends out to certain underlings.

properties.Name: Pawainui
properties.text:
Pawainui, also known as the City of Totems, is a walled fortress city located atop the hills of Lakapuna, one of the Rendah Pulu isles of Minata off the southeastern coast of Valash Raj. It is the seat of the ruler of the insular Tau Nui people, and the ancient fortifications that once granted it a reputation as Minata's most fortified settlement have survived many battles.

The city's opulent interior features more than 1,000 carved totemic columns that depict the histories of the city and its families.

properties.Name: Peddlegate
properties.text: The city of Peddlegate is located in the northeast of the nation of Druma, hard against the Five Kings Mountains.

properties.Name: Pegaduor
properties.text:
Lying within the rural province of Kazuhn in Taldor, Pegaduor is a vast underground city that dates back to the Azlanti Empire and Earthfall itself. Pegaduor was discovered five centuries ago when a farmer stumbled upon a massive sinkhole leading into its depths. At the time, Pegaduor baffled the historians who soon flocked to the site. From the outside, Pegaduor appears as a series of low-lying stone structures but this is only the top-most layer of a truly vast underground city.

Pegaduor was later identified as an ancient Azlanti ruin, built by refugee from the empire's Avistani colonies shortly after the Earthfall. While many other Azlanti sought shelter beneath the earth and delved much deeper into the Darklands, the people of Pegaduor seem to have stayed within a few hundred feet of the surface. As such, it is believed that the residents never succumbed to the isolation and corruption that created the caligni, mongrelfolk, morlocks, and munavri from other groups of Azlanti survivors.

The ruins of Pegaduor are still a hotbed of activity as new chambers and sub-settlements keep being discovered to this day. It is estimated that at its height Pegaduor must have had tens of thousands of residents. Over a dozen researchers and their entourages are currently exploring the site. The most prominent of these researchers is Fareine Oubroulay, a Pathfinder originally from Nex. She has been focusing on a series of hidden temples devoted to Scal, the Azlanti deity of annihilation. Fareine believes that these hidden temples may have something to do with the disappearance of Pegaduor's population.

properties.Name: Peijia
properties.text:
Peijia is the largely empty capital of the Tian Xia nation of Bachuan, built on the northern shore of Naikang Bay. Established by the country's founder Grandfather Pei, the city was designed to hold up to 200,000 inhabitants. However, as of 7211 IC barely 50,000 people had followed Grandfather Pei's commands and relocated there, leaving much of the city uninhabited.

As of 7224 IC, many of the city's buildings are overrun with monsters, magical plants, and squatters despite a recent influx of investment in the city.

properties.Name: Pek Peh
properties.text: The town of Pek Peh is one of the settlements scattered throughout the desolate, monster-haunted land of Shenmen. Ruled over by the fearsome jorogumo, monstrous hybrids of humans and spiders, Pek Peh is forced to resort to banditry and kidnapping to keep up with the jorogumo's demands for sentient sacrificial victims.

properties.Name: Pendaka
properties.text: Pendaka is a tiny thorp located on a rocky promontory that overlooks Claybottom Lake's southern shore near where it flows into the Skull River. Pendaka has a single inn that also functions as a trading post known as the Walleyed Wife, but the settlement's only real claim to fame is its skilled baker, Olam Keecher, and his delicious cranberry turtle egg pies.

properties.Name: Pensaris
properties.text: Pensaris is a small village nestled on the bank of Lake Pensaris and one of the most prosperous settlements in Meratt county of Taldor, behind only the larger trade town of Lotheedar in terms of wealth. This prosperity is due to the wise stewardship of House Okerra under the leadership of Baron Nicolaus Okerra, who rules from the neighbouring Okerra Estate. Baron Okerra assists this prosperity by sometimes giving no-interest loans to the most enterprising people of Pensaris, but recently this practice has ceased due to the increased taxes levied by Count Lotheed, much to the annoyance of Baron Okerra.

properties.Name: Peshaka Naeu
properties.text: Peshaka Naeu is a small settlement of jungle giants in the deepest part of the rainforest of the Devil's Arches island in the Shackles. The giants peacefully raise crops and livestock as long as the humanoids of the island leave them undisturbed. Scholars believe the jungle giants have an oral history that goes back to the days of ancient Ghol-Gan but the giants have never accepted any diplomatic mission.

properties.Name: Petitioner's Port
properties.text: Petitioner's Port is a town in southwestern Druma, in the region of Kahlehlin, near the border with Isger. It is well-connected to the rest of the country, serves as the southern gateway to Druma from Inner Sea nations, and has a reputation for initiating newcomers into the Prophecies of Kalistrade.

properties.Name: Pex
properties.text: The pirate town of Pex is located on the Devil's Arches island of the Shackles, at the south end of the perilous Straits of Balthus. It is a rough, ramshackle settlement, ruled by the capricious Hardluck Massey. He is known for his impulsive punishments against the unfortunates who have annoyed him. Pex boasts a large three-story inn called Damned If It Didn't Rain run by Hegmar of Frembrudd that gathers buccaneers of Ulfen descent as well as Varisian merchants who own warehouses in the town.

properties.Name: Pezzack
properties.text: Pezzack is a town in western Cheliax on the Sallow Coast of the Arcadian Ocean. Nestled in Devil's Perch among the Menador Mountains, the isolated town has long been a seedbed for sedition against the infernal government far way in Egorian. The crown has responded with several naval blockades and year-long sieges that have left the settlement quite isolated from the rest of the country, and moved the seat of the Archduchy of Hellcoast from Pezzack to Belde.

properties.Name: Phaendar
properties.text: The town of Phaendar is located in southern Nirmathas on the southern bank of the Marideth River near the Chernasardo region of the Fangwood. Despite its small size, it is one of the largest settlements in the Nesmian Plains. The town grew out of a Chelish stronghold which itself was built on top of an outpost of the Shining Crusade. The residents of Phaendar, most of whom are skilled craftspeople, mistrust authority and the town has little to no standing government. Most of the town's law enforcement needs are provided by the Chernasardo Rangers who frequent the town to trade for supplies.

properties.Name: Pier's End
properties.text: Pier's End is a small, squalid fishing village on the north coast of the Isle of Kortos within the domain of the city-state of Absalom. It is surrounded by a hard-to-cross bog known as the Dunmire.

properties.Name: Pilgrimage
properties.text: Pilgrimage is a small but growing port town in the nation of Razmiran, on the northeastern shores of Lake Encarthan.

properties.Name: Piren's Bluff
properties.text: Piren's Bluff is a small border hamlet in Andoran that sits atop a flat rock overlooking a narrow canyon leading deep into the Aspodell Mountains. It is surrounded by a tall wooden palisade with six watchtowers. An ancient keep watches over the hamlet from the highest elevation and protects Andoran's western border. The keep is surrounded by massive stone walls and guard towers, and has always served as home to the leaders of Piren's Bluff.

properties.Name: Pitax
properties.text: Pitax (pronounced pih-TAHKS) is a city in the Stolen Lands near Brevoy in the River Kingdoms. It was once a city-state domain of a petty tyrant but fell a few years before 4719 AR after a failed attempt at expansion.

properties.Name: Plumetown
properties.text: Plumetown is the only major settlement on the island of the Smoker in the Shackles. Willa Cloudbuster is the de facto mayor of the town, and oversees Plumetown's sometimes impatient and disruptive visitors with a small army of constables: former pirates who carry massive clubs. The entire town seems designed solely to house, feed and entertain its visitors who seek the wisdom of the mysterious soothsayers, Keeba's Eyes, living in the caverns of Mount Keeba. It boasts a large number of taverns, hostels, gaming houses, and brothels.

properties.Name: Pobashabla
properties.text: Pobashabla is a city-state in the underwater nation of Xidao, in the Xidao Gulf of eastern Tian Xia. The city is dominated by the presence of the Xidao Army, which influences the city's culture but also generates tension with separatists who oppose them as an occupying force.

properties.Name: Pol
properties.text:
Pol is the capital of the Taldan prefecture of Whitemarch after the previous capital of Cydonus was destroyed during the Grand Campaign, Taldor's last war with neighbouring Qadira. Pol remains a work in progress, with much of the settlement existing only on the drawing board of its architects. Pol serves more as a crossroads between the Monastery of the Seven Forms and various settlements and military bases across the rest of the Whitemarch Prefecture.

It is also a source of contention amongst the local aristocracy who vie mercilessly for who gets the rights to build what where within the city, for influence within its burgeoning local political scene, and ultimately for who will rule this new city.

properties.Name: Port Freedom
properties.text:
Situated on the northern bank of the Korir River delta, Port Freedom is Sargava's second port, behind the capital Eleder.

The sandbanks of the delta mean the port cannot accommodate large, deep water ships, and are also a serious hazard to the river trade with Kalabuto. Barges travelling the river normally call upon the services of the Rivermen's Guild.

In theory, the town is ruled by Sargava's leader, the Grand Custodian, Baron Utilinus. However, the Baron lives in Eleder, and has many calls upon his time, and the day to day running of the town is carried out by a council made up of representatives of the various companies which do business along the river. In effect, the town is controlled by the Rivermen's Guild.

properties.Name: Port Ice
properties.text:
Port Ice, on the southern bank of the Lake of Mists and Veils in northern Brevoy, is a refuge for ruffians and lake pirates. While the city was once the capital of the former nation of Issia, it has been part of greater Brevoy since 4499 AR, when Choral the Conqueror united the region with its southern neighbor, Rostland. Even when Choral made New Stetven capital of Brevoy, Port Ice remained the seat of power of the conniving pirate lords of House Surtova.

When Choral's descendants in House Rogarvia mysteriously disappeared to a man in 4699 AR, Noleski Surtova, then ruler of Port Ice, leapt at the opportunity and took control of the nation in the absence of its traditional sovereigns and has since moved his court to New Stetven to the south.

King Noleski's uncle, Domani Surtova, serves in the White Manor as Port Ice's current caretaker.

The Port is often overcome by ice and snow in the winter months and sits closed, only visited occasionally until the spring's thaw. The summer months are spent frantically stockpiling supplies for the next winter.

properties.Name: Port Peril
properties.text:
Port Peril is the largest port in the Shackles and its de facto capital. It is situated on the mainland, rather than on one of the outlying islands, on the edge of the Terwa Uplands and overlooking Jeopardy Bay. The city is protected by walls, and the stronghold of Fort Hazard. All manner of vices can be found in its twisting streets, and its busy markets thrive on the sale of stolen goods. Rumour has it that the plunder from decades of piracy is hidden in sea caves beneath the city.

Despite being the capital of the Shackles Pirates, merchant ships sometimes dock here to trade. Those flying the flags of Inner Sea region nations are not welcome, and gain no protection, but unaligned vessels are permitted to dock.

properties.Name: Port Valen
properties.text:
This article is about the known town in Arcadia. For the mythical resting place of Linnorm Kings and Ulfen heroes, see Valenhall.

Port Valen is an Ulfen colony on the Scarred Shores in northeastern Arcadia. It was founded by Linnorm King Ulvass of Kalsgard in -473 AR, who travelled to Arcadia after hearing the call of Valenhall, a place of unending revelry and glory.

Until recently, in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings and the Inner Sea region as a whole, the colony has only been known through stories, which refer to it as Valenhall and paint it as the final spiritual destination for powerful lords and brave warriors, who attempt the lengthy and dangerous journey to the colony at the end of their lives, though the truth is much less glamorous.

properties.Name: Prada Hanam
properties.text: Prada Hanam is a small port city on the eastern coast of the nation of Jalmeray. The settlement's defining feature is the Murmur Dome of Prada Hanam, an enormous, multi-building structure that suddenly appeared in the town centuries ago.

properties.Name: Promise
properties.text: Promise is the capital and only settlement of any significance on the island nation of Hermea, in the Steaming Sea. It stands in the island's southern corner.

properties.Name: Prophet's Home
properties.text: The city of Prophet's Home is located in the northeast of the country of Druma. It is best known for housing the training facilities of the Mercenary League, the military protection and enforcement arm of the Prophets of Kalistrade.

properties.Name: Purt
properties.text: Purt is a small settlement located along the Eldress River in Nirmathas. Protected on all sides by a wall of thorns 20 feet high and eight feet thick, the hamlet's human farmers grow the largest cabbages in the region. Purt's citizens know the several hidden passages through the wall of thorns. The druids of Acorn's Rest helped build the wall to protect the inhabitants from Molthuni mercenaries.

properties.Name: Qadlus Mavari
properties.text: Qadlus Mavari is a Qadiran city located in the Northern Zho Mountains area, and is the north-easternmost settlement in Qadira. Qadlus Mavari is a flourishing oasis town built around a shrine dedicated to Lugalisimaru, the so called "Palm Tree King". The town does a healthy trade in selling offerings that can be left at other shrines to Lugalisimaru that are built at each of the oases that dot the desert beyond. Qadlus Mavari also boasts a booming trade in water-producing magic items.

properties.Name: Qaharid
properties.text: Qaharid is a major mining city in the Maharev region of Qadira.

properties.Name: Qintong
properties.text: Qintong is a city in the hobgoblin nation of Kaoling that features a system of social mobility for its non-hobgoblin residents, a unique program that is controversial among the nation's ruling Council of Nine. It is ruled by Sun Zhen, a member of the Council.

properties.Name: Quantium
properties.text:
Quantium, a port city on the Obari Ocean, is the capital of the nation of Nex. The city prides itself on its diversity; xenophobia is frowned upon. The city has many palaces, hanging gardens, and open-air mazes, as well as several reputable universities of arcane magic and lore. The city's magnificence has been compared with Oppara in Taldor and Sothis in Osirion.

There are many statues of the archmage Nex, who took control of the then-city-state in -987 AR, as well as of the heroes who helped him forge the kingdom that still bears his name.

properties.Name: Queen Bes
properties.text: Queen Bes is the only settlement of any size on the Shackles island of Besmara's Throne. Because the entire isle is a holy site to the worshipers of the pirate goddess Besmara, the town contains a large proportion of pilgrims.

properties.Name: Quent
properties.text:
Quent is the second-largest settlement in the Shackles after Port Peril. It is on the north coast of Motaku Isle, the Shackles' largest island. Sheltered from the storm by the large barrier islands of its picturesque bay, Quent is known as the finest deepwater port in the region. Moreover, Quent is also known among the sailors as the liveliest and most welcoming of the ports.

The city is ruled by Tessa Fairwind, a charismatic pirate lord and major voice in the Pirate Council.

Quent features a large number of dockside taverns, such as the Lusty Mermaid, Fat Jessup's, the Barnacle, the Three Sailors Smiling, the Drunken Boatswain, and Lilibeth's Tavern and Hostel. Tessa Fairwind often rubs shoulders with fellow pirates in these taverns while she is ashore. The city accommodates sailors in its many boarding houses and inns. Lilibeth's and Three Sailors are the largest, followed by Mama Leroux's and Haekle's Dry Berth. Wealthy buccaneers have built their manors in the bayside hills known as Spendthrift Ridge. The Blue Sky Road, right off the docks and the warehouses is the main thoroughfare through town, lined with every type of merchant shop. Quent has evolved into a real city with a considerable population of landsmen who earn their living supporting the free-spending pirates. Calistria's House of Stolen Kisses in the center of the town, where the sacred prostitutes of Calistria ply their trade, is also known as the Shackles' best information brokerage.

properties.Name: Radripal
properties.text: Radripal, also known as the City of Arches, is a Vudran city dividedboth physically by the Matra River gorge, and socially by class and caste.

properties.Name: Railford
properties.text: Railford is a small settlement located on a small wooded hill a few miles inland from the larger settlement of Golsifar, on the Inner Sea coast of Taldor. The settlement is in the prefecture of Moda.

properties.Name: Raketooth
properties.text: Raketooth is the second largest port on Shark Island in the Shackles. It is a dreary settlement specializing in pilfered luxury wares that usually are sold in Motaku Isle or to the few non-slaver merchants who come to Shark Island. Raketooth doesn't often have difficulties with sedacthys who plague the island. The pirate lords of Raketooth, Mauril Breakwater and "Baron" Venigo Palpathe, maintain the relative peace of the town by providing tribute to the nearby sedacthy tribes.

properties.Name: Raliscrad
properties.text: Raliscrad was a city located at the confluence of the Sarkora and Isk Rivers in the region of the Sarkoris Scar (formerly the Worldwound) known as the Riftshadow.

properties.Name: Rangdol
properties.text: Rangdol is a city of scholarship in southern Zi Ha. Its guildswhich include the Engineering & Architecture Guild, Mages Guild, and Scholars Guildhelp to develop some of the nation's most prominent intellects, and the city is also renowned for its automated transportation, libraries, and second underground city that accommodates its population during the intense summers.

properties.Name: Rapier Bay
properties.text:
Rapier Bay is a rowdy small town on Motaku Isle in the Shackles. It is led by the pirate lord Maxevale Janis, captain of the galleon Motaku Maiden. Maxevale always supports Lady Tessa in the Pirate Council, earning the nickname "the Puppy", though no man dares to say it to his face.

Rapier Bay is not a busy harbor like Quent, but is used by pirates who do not want to draw much attention to themselves while sailing near the island. Rapier Bay is famous for one of its smithies, the Steel-Clad Giant, that makes some of the finest blades west of the Arch of Aroden.

properties.Name: Rashiz
properties.text: Rashiz is a Qadiran city that lies near the centre of the lush Maharev region. This region is one of the safest and most fertile regions in all Qadira. Rashiz itself sits on the southern bank of the Meraz River, with the Maharev Jungle just to the north upon the opposite bank.

properties.Name: Ravengro
properties.text: The Ustalavic settlement of Ravengro is located in the west of the county of Canterwall, close to the contentious border with the Hold of Belkzen.

properties.Name: Ravenmoor
properties.text: While the Varisian town of Ravenmoor appears a normal settlementquaint and isolated along the Lampblack Riverit holds a deeper secret that its residents seem dedicated to keep. During the day, trade takes place as it would in any frontier village, and the citizens are as open and trusting as one would expect. At night, travelers will find that their coin is unable to obtain them a room in any of the inns, and the seemingly pious residents become much more secretive about their religious beliefs. The true nature of this strange town remains a mystery, save to those who live there.

properties.Name: Redleaf
properties.text: The settlement of Redleaf can be found in the western portion of the Ustalavic county of Varno, circling the small Lake Redleaf.

properties.Name: Redtooth
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Redtooth", please see Redtooth (person).

Redtooth is the provincial capital of the Irriseni border province known as the Verge. Queen Elvanna's second son, Arvanoff Elvanna, is the Duke of Redtooth.

properties.Name: Remesiana
properties.text: The Chelaxian city of Remesiana stands at the mouth of the Iseld River, where it flows out of the Whisperwood into the Bay of Solva and the Inner Sea. The Hellknights of the Order of the Nail were based at nearby Citadel Draythe before moving to Varisia at the urging of Queen Domina of Korvosa in 4682 AR. Like much of the southern coast of Cheliax, Remesiana is considered a stronghold of the old noble families who survived the Chelish Civil War. They now fight desperately to remain in the crown's good graces as they see their hereditary powers ebbing away.

properties.Name: Restov
properties.text: Restov is one of the two largest cities in the fertile region of Rostland in southern Brevoy. It is known as the Free City of Restov, but it is allied with Brevoy.

properties.Name: Riba
properties.text: Riba is a small town on the Marbleflow River in the Irrisen province of Hoarwood.

properties.Name: Rickety's Squibs
properties.text:
Rickety's Squibs is a village at the mouth of a nameless river on the Slithering Coast in the Shackles's mainland. The village is concealed from passing ships by a protruding headland and is difficult to find if one doesn't know where to look.

Rickety's Squibs refits and modifies the lines and profiles of ships providing a new identity for a price. These rebuilt vessels are referred to as "squibs." Its facilities are hidden within the jungle. Rickety's Squibs is run by old Rickety Hake, a retired pirate and former mate of the Bearded Whore, captained by Ella Gurnett who was killed at the battle of Nolis Point.

properties.Name: Riddleport
properties.text: Riddleport is the third-largest city in Varisia and its most northern port. The city is a haven for pirates and sea-faring brigands, who find themselves far to the north of the Arch of Aroden. Teeming with criminals and rogues of all kinds, Riddleport is full of potential danger and hard-to-avoid intrigue. Also known as the City of Cyphers, Riddleport takes its name from the Cyphergate, a giant stone arch spanning the natural cove around which the city is built. It is covered on both sides with ancient Thassilonian symbols, although their exact meaning is unknown.

properties.Name: Ridonport
properties.text: Ridonport is a small coastal city located in the empire of Taldor, south of the city of Cassomir. The settlement is best known as the home of General Arnisant, the Taldan hero responsible for imprisoning Tar-Baphon, the Whispering Tyrant.

properties.Name: Ridwan
properties.text: Situated in the foothills of the Menador Mountains, Ridwan sits on a hostile volcanic plain. The city is the religious center for the faithful of Zon-Kuthon, as it is said that the Midnight Lord first emerged upon Golarion from the smokey Shadowflame Rift that dominates the city's central square. The rift itself is believed to be a gateway to a particularly unpleasant chasm on the Plane of Shadow known as the Deeping Darkness. Apart from being a religious center, Ridwan is also home to the training camps of Nidal's military, who hone their skills to spread the word of Zon-Kuthon through guile or force throughout the world.

properties.Name: Riekamesto
properties.text:
Riekamesto is a small town on Glacier Lake in the Irriseni province of Thronehold that has seen quite a bit of recent trouble.

Recently the Cold Sisters discovered that Baroness Urszula and 13 of her councilors had been cheating Whitethrone, hiding tax revenues. Cold Sisters viciously killed these councilors, throwing them from the top floor of the Council House. Urszula was instead buried alive in a great brass coffin wrapped with bands of iron inscribed with strange sigils. They placed the coffin in the center of the town and six months after Urszula's desperate cries and frantic pounding continues from within.

Sister Arminaela is temporarily the administrator of the town, achieving hard work and discipline from the peasants and increased tax revenues.

properties.Name: Rikhist
properties.text: Rikhist is a rough border town in the far east of Qadira's Maharev region. Located near the headwaters of the Meraz River and just west of the Zho Mountains that mark Qadira's border, Rikhist is the largest centre of Rovagug worship in all Qadira despite the best efforts of Satrap Xerbystes II and his predecessors to completely eliminate it. Like a cockroach, Rikhist has withstood all attempts to stamp it out and it is supported by both orc and cave giant tribes that dwell in the surrounding mountains. The town is home to all manner of outcasts, thieves, blasphemers, and murderers of many races, including not just humans and orcs but also numerous bugbears and kholo. Rikhist is ruled by an axe-wielding sadist named Magyarsh, a riftmarked cambion warpriest devoted to Rovagug.

properties.Name: Riverford
properties.text: Riverford is a small Andoren agricultural community situated just over 200 miles upriver from the capital of Almas. It grew up around the Old Bridge, a river crossing of the Andoshen, and has existed in one form or another for 3,000 years. Known for its bountiful harvests and exceptional beef cattle, Riverford has also been the site of at least 10 major battles over the centuries due to it being one of the few places an army can cross the Andoshen River. Farmers still uncover archaeological treasures from these wars, generally selling them off as quickly as possible for fear that their land will be confiscated and turned into an archaeological site.

properties.Name: Riverspire
properties.text: The elven town of Riverspire is located on the Kyonin River in the southwest of the country. It grew from a single family, and the majority of its inhabitants today are still distantly related to one another.

properties.Name: Riverton
properties.text: Riverton is a large village located on the banks of Kallas Lake in the southern River Kingdoms.

properties.Name: Robu
properties.text:
Robu is a small town on the second largest island of the Ushinawa Isles in the Shackles.

The residents of Robu have done their best to eradicate the obscene reminders of its earlier Ghol-Gan occupants. A native evil, the penanggalan named Tiktakara, has laired in the woodlands outside of Robu and entertains herself by tormenting the town's residents and converting its women into subservient manananggals. The Lord of Robu, Kensai Hikarogawa, offers a bounty to any adventurers who can rid the town of this menace.

properties.Name: Roderic's Cove
properties.text: Situated on the Varisian Gulf at the mouth of the Chavali River, Roderic's Cove is a small town that serves as an alternative destination for merchants too nervous to dock at the pirate-controlled city of Riddleport.

properties.Name: Rolgrimmdur
properties.text: Rolgrimmdur is built among the ruins of Grakodan by Khadon's engineers and is one of the most fortified dwarven cities in Five Kings Mountains. It is located about 50 miles southwest of the capital city of Highhelm.

properties.Name: Roshik
properties.text: Roshik is a town in Almhult. It is located on the southern coast of Cape Almhult on the shores of the Steaming Sea, between Asre to the west and Helsingbyen to the east.

properties.Name: Roslar's Coffer
properties.text: Roslar's Coffer is a small town located in southwestern Lastwall along the Tourondel River, near the border with the Hold of Belkzen.

properties.Name: Round Mountain
properties.text: Round Mountain is an earthen sphere 10 miles in diameter that was dropped onto western Po Li in 7219 IC. It was formerly part of the Hao Jin Tapestry, where it was transported centuries ago from the Darklands of Tian Xia by Hao Jin to halt an invasion of the region by the ratfolk of Diguo-Dashu.

properties.Name: Rozenport
properties.text: Rozenport is a bustling town located in the south-west of the county of Versex in Ustalav perched high on the steep cliffs above the Danver River. The town is most famous as the seat of the Sincomakti School of Sciences founded in 4570 AR. Many of the buildings of the town mirror the archaic architectural style of the world-renowned school, for instance, pointed steeples and manor houses topped with flat roofs. The town hall boasts a dome shaped like a bubble. All this is set within a veritable maze of roads and thoroughfares.

properties.Name: Rumbutter
properties.text: Rumbutter is the southernmost settlement on Bag Island in Shackles. It is a sprawling, hilly, farming community known for its apiaries and honey. Rumbutter honey finds its way throughout the Shackles and Sargava. Rumbutter's three taverns on its main road, Bedda's Berth, the Gilded Lily, and Shopin's Roundhouse, serve unique blends of iced butterscotch beers in the rainy season and honey wine in the drier months.

properties.Name: Ruwido
properties.text: Ruwido is a hovel-village secreted away in the notorious Ustalavic county of Virlych where misbegotten, cast out, mad and deformed souls can find a home, hide their faces from the world and find a modicum of peace and acceptance. The village is found on the western hills of the Ghorcha Pass close to the waters of the Barrow Run. The settlement is shunned by practically everyone including patrols from Lastwall and Amaans, while the villagers themselves are suspicious of any strangers approaching. One of the few regular and trusted visitors to Ruwido is the mute cleric of Desna called Azra.

properties.Name: Saad
properties.text:
Saad is a small town in the River Kingdoms region controlled by Daggermark, and home to Daggermark's cavalry.

The two dozen large timber buildings of the hamlet are protected by a motte-and-bailey wall with several tall timber towers that look over the surrounding plains. Outside of the wall are many well-guarded horse farms. All of these war-horses are the interbred stock of Yenchabur stallions brought to the area in 4402 AR.

Saad is also the main trading center for the merchant traffic coming from Tymon, and is often the target of bandits who plague all trade routes across the region.

properties.Name: Saarbotten
properties.text:
Saarbotten is a border town on the Thundering River in the Irriseni province known as the Verge.

Saarboten is organized entirely toward the support of the raiding parties that cross the border south and west into the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The town hosts permanent armories, camps and warehouses. The Wintercrux town of Dalun has the responsibility to supply Saarbotten's food while Morozny and Vasterborg provide weapons and armor. Baroness Urgalaena is the bloodthirsty, enthusiastic ruler of the town, mocking publicly her sister Baroness Nadya of Dalun for her diplomatic efforts in order to improve trade with the Ulfen people. Baroness Urgalaena hosts the vicious "Crimson Tournaments" every week.

Saarbotten is opposite the lands of Southmoor and Ysborg to the south and the eastern part of the Grungir Forest to the west. The nearest Ulfen settlements are the village of Whiterook in Southmoor and Losthome in the Grungir Forest. Saarbotten is also close to the gnome village of Delmon's Glen in the forest.

properties.Name: Sadiyeh
properties.text: Sadiyeh is a city on the Alavah Peninsula of Qadira.

properties.Name: Safani
properties.text:
The settlement of Safani is a small town near the Crook River, in Osirion. Its leader is Efni Raan.

Safani is too far from major cities to receive the benefit of their protection against kholo raiders, so the town's residents came up with a unique defense strategy. The town is fully camouflaged: the buildings are built into the hills and covered in sod. Other vegetation has been carefully cultivated so it can cover more conspicuous aspects of the buildings, like doors and windows.

properties.Name: Sakakabe
properties.text:
Sakakabe is a busy coastal town in Minkai. It is built on a favourable landing on an otherwise treacherous coastline.

Sakakabe is constructed on a series of steep, concentric terraces that extend from the port to the top of the hills, where the richest houses are built, while the lowest terraces lean on the ruins of a stone fortress built millennia ago. The ancient stone walls are adorned with reliefs of ancient warriors, but these images are now almost completely hidden by modern structures.

The town is known for its entertainment district (or hanamachi), which is built on one of the highest terraces, centred on a large street called the Way of the Songbird.

properties.Name: Salav
properties.text: Salav is a Qadiran city located in the Northern Zho Mountains area, sitting at the head waters of the River Ladan in the foothills of the Zho Mountains. The Northern Zho Mountains region is the poorest of all Qadira's regions and faces the neighbouring land of Taldor just across the Jalrune River, as such it is the least hungry for war with the proud kingdom.

properties.Name: Sallowshore
properties.text: Sallowshore is a port town on the coast of Geb directly east from Thornhearth. The town appears to be sinking into the ocean, with half the buildings already partially sunken under the water. The upper floors that poke above the water are connected by shoddy wooden bridges.

properties.Name: Samsara Oasis
properties.text: Samsara Oasis is a small town established by calikangs horrified at their role in the destruction of the region. They use Samsara Oasis as a place to meet and research restoration efforts to try to make up for this.

properties.Name: Sandpoint
properties.text: Sandpoint is known as the 'Light of the Lost Coast' and is a small town in south-western Varisia under the influence of the city of Magnimar to its south. Sandpoint remains the only place of note along the Lost Coast, but it has grown considerably in the past few years and is now Varisia's sixth-largest settlement; nevertheless, it still maintains the air of a sleepy fishing town. Sandpoint is most famous for the arts: particularly theatre and high-quality glass-blowing.

properties.Name: Sangpo-Jong
properties.text: Cut into the side of a mountain, Sangpo-Jong is the nominal capital of Zi Ha in Tian Xia and an isolationist city dominated by samsarans. Most outsiders are forbidden from the city, but for those who can enter, Sangpo-Jong is full of scenic wonders and epic stone carvings.

properties.Name: Sanmeshul
properties.text: Sanmeshul is a Qadiran city that lies to the west of the centre of the Maharev region along the Meraz River. This region is one of the safest and most fertile regions in all Qadira and Sanmeshul is the second largest city of the region, behind only Qaharid in terms of size.

properties.Name: Sarain
properties.text: Sarain is a small village in the River Kingdom of Pitax, close to the border with Mivon. Sarain is famous for its vineyards and, before the arrival of Castruccio Irovetti, the Liacenza family had overall control over most of the wine-making business of the area.

properties.Name: Sardis Township
properties.text:
Sardis Township is a large town on the upper reaches of the River Porthmos in eastern Taldor's Porthmos Gap.

The prefectural capital of the Porthmos Prefecture, Sardis extends for well over a mile in every direction as it was formed as a dozen small mining communities that grew together around rich veins of lead and other minerals. The settlement sits on the chaotic, polluted landscape that stretches just a few miles inland from the South River. Technically, the piers, refineries, and warehouses are also part of the township's domain. Despite being depressing and miserable, Sardis generates a great deal of wealth, trading high-quality metals for foodstuffs to supplement their own meagre crops.

Although not known as a trade hub, Sardis does profit from trade caravans and travelling merchants. Centaur tribes from the Whistling Plains sometimes make the trek this far into Taldor for trade and some even choose to remain. Many are enlisted as enforcers by the local Grand Duke.

Sardis Township is home to both the infamous Porthmos Prison and the governor of the Porthmos Prefecture, Grand Duke Thestro Briarsmith. The former is populated with the enemies of the latter.

properties.Name: Saringallow
properties.text: The Isgeri town of Saringallow is located on the Conerica River, south of the capital of Elidir.

properties.Name: Sascha
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Sascha", please see Sascha (person).

Sascha, once called Ermalin, is a small Irriseni town in the Verge with a troubled past.

properties.Name: Satravah
properties.text: Satravah, an Ustalavic village deep in the heart of Ulcazar, is better known as the Vale of Honorless Gravessite of countless secret burials in the Shining Crusade against Tar-Baphon.

properties.Name: Sauerton
properties.text: Sauerton is a settlement in northeastern Andoran in the Carpenden Plains region, located between the banks of the Andoshen River and the Verduran Forest.

properties.Name: Saventh-Yhi
properties.text: The ruined city of Saventh-Yhi (pronounced saa-vinth-YHEE) sits in the southern Mwangi Jungle, east of the Ocota River, just north of the Bandu Hills. The city was founded over 10,000 years ago during the Age of Legend by the followers of the Azlanti hero Savith, who died while defeating the serpentfolk god Ydersius in the Darklands' tunnels below.

properties.Name: Scrawny Crossing
properties.text:
The abandoned hamlet of Scrawny Crossing is in the western River Kingdoms. It served as a ferry crossing and caravan stop until 4706 AR, when its inhabitants disappeared in mysterious circumstances.

Unbeknownst to the folk of the region, Scrawny Crossing now serves as a base for a band of aquatic slaversscrag/ulat-kini cross-breeds. These monsters capture humanoids for use in strange experiments. Their leaders are a naga ("Lord Slissk"), a scrag sorcerer ("Thult-Lorth") and a sea hag ("Mother Slug"), although they in turn take their orders from a telepathic creature that might be an alghollthu master.

Stranger still, next to the ruins of Scrawny Crossing's old smith sits an oddity known as the Boiling Well, a well whose water always came out at body temperature. Unbeknownst to anyone living there, this was because the well harboured a secret soulgate that linked to the Infernal Duke Eaqueo's domain of the Finishing Knot on Hell's first layer, Avernus.

properties.Name: Sedeq
properties.text: Sedeq is a city in southern Qadira and the center of the nation's lucrative slave trade. It is located on the Alavah Peninsula south of the Zho Mountains, and is also known for its warm breezes and lush gardens.

properties.Name: Seer's Home
properties.text: The capital of Icemark, Seer's Home, is actually no more than a large village by population size; it is found on the western coast of the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Seer's Home is the largest and the only permanently inhabited Varki shelter and home to the elderly and wise of Varki culture who have retired to this more permanent residence. This group of wise folk are known as the Varki Seers.

properties.Name: Segada
properties.text: Segada is a city of Mahwek Arcadians that serves as a gateway to Degasi and other reaches of Arcadia's interior. Its economic importance, already significant as a hub for Arcadian commerce, has grown from recent trade with Avistan.

properties.Name: Seidoyaji
properties.text: Seidoyaji (pronounced say-doh-yah-jee) is one of the many cities that dot the tengu kingdom of Kwanlai. The thieves' guild of Seidoyaji is responsible for the Autumn of Iron Tears, a conflict with the thieves' guild of the city of Todorokaze that escalated into a full-blown proxy war between the two cities.

properties.Name: Sember Cove
properties.text: The village of Sember Cove is nestled just inside the Ravounel border at the point it meets the Hellcoast in Cheliax.

properties.Name: Senara
properties.text: Senara is a Chelish town located in the devil-spawn-infested Whisperwood. It is often used as an example of Cheliax's infernal experiment gone too far. More than half of the town's inhabitants are descended from devils, and nearly a quarter are cambions.

properties.Name: Senghor
properties.text: The port city-state of Senghor is located on the Bay of Senghor, which is part of the Fever Sea on Garund's western coast. It is on the western end of the peninsula known as the Kaava Lands (the kaava are a pygmy tribe of kech) in the southern Mwangi Expanse.

properties.Name: Seredain
properties.text: Seredain is a large town in the River Kingdom of Touvette.

properties.Name: Sevenarches
properties.text: Sevenarches is a town in the southwestern River Kingdoms built around seven stone arches scattered around the settlement. It is an ancient site sacred to elves, but has not been in elven hands since they left Golarion for the safety of Sovyrian millennia ago. Since then, Sevenarches has been under the rule of the Oakstewards, a group of secretive druids. Indeed, Sevenarches is the only surviving kingdom from the initial wave of Kellid migration into the River Kingdoms region after the exit of the elves.

properties.Name: Sezgin
properties.text: Sezgin is a small town in the River Kingdom of Lambreth.

properties.Name: Shadow Spring
properties.text: Shadow Spring is one of the northernmost hot springs in the Frostmire Fen, which can be found in the region of the Sarkoris Scar known as Frostmire. A small village of degenerate humans surrounds Shadow Spring (the village and the spring share the same name), populated by the descendants of evacuees from the nearby city of Dyinglight.

properties.Name: Shamara
properties.text: Shamara is one of the numerous large, prosperous cities that dot the fertile Qadiran region of Pashman. It is located north of the banks of the Pashman River along Pashman's southern border with the neighbouring region of Southern Zho Mountains.

properties.Name: Shatterglass
properties.text:
Shatterglass is a small and picturesque village located in the nation of Mendev, near the Lake of Mists and Veils. The village's name is derived from the shimmering lake glass that blankets its shores.

The settlement is primarily inhabited by retired pirates, and the entire village is constructed from salvaged ship lumber. The carpenters of Shatterglass are meticulous in choosing the source of their materials. They prefer using the hulls of famous pirate ships for construction, even though many of these buildings have a reputation for being haunted.

properties.Name: Shileh
properties.text: Shileh is one of the numerous large, prosperous cities that dot the fertile Qadiran region of Pashman. It is located north of the banks of the Pashman River along Pashman's south-western border with the neighbouring region of Tapur.

properties.Name: Shiman-Sekh
properties.text: Shiman-Sekh is the northwestern-most city of Osirion, located a good 100 miles inland of the Inner Sea, on the western edge of the great Golden Oasis. It sits on a trade route connecting Osirion with its western neighbor, Thuvia.

properties.Name: Shimmerford
properties.text: Shimmerford is a town in the River Kingdoms known for legends of the cryptid Mosquito Witch, in whose name the town stages an annual festival.

properties.Name: Shogokabe
properties.text: Shogokabe is the capital of Hofunawan Province in Minkai and the nation's primary fishing port.

properties.Name: Shoreline
properties.text:
Shoreline is a small town located just outside the never-breached walls of Absalom, directly west of the district called the Puddles. It began as a settlement for those who make their living from the sea, illustrated by its many docks and fisheries, but is also home to some of Absalom's more fragrant businesses, such as tanneries and breweries. General artisans and laborers are also found here aplenty. Most of Shoreline's inhabitants are quite poor, although they comfort themselves with the fact that at least they are dry most of the time, unlike the people who live in the Puddles.

The siege castle called the Pyramid of the Dog is located on a beach just south of Shoreline.

properties.Name: Siavenian
properties.text: Siavenian is a small town in the northern Fierani Forest of Kyonin, just east of the Endowhar River. It grew up around a disused elf gate that was activated by a group of adventurers fleeing the Darklands in 4708 AR.

properties.Name: Sihadrimon
properties.text: Sihadrimon is one of the numerous prosperous coastal cities that dot the shores of the Betul Sea in the Western Ghats region of Vudra.

properties.Name: Silverhall
properties.text: Silverhall is a city that is located on the Awzera River in Brevoy, just before the river empties into Lake Reykal. This town is the family seat of House Lebeda, and it was here that the Lebeda family kept the Horn of Aroden for many years.

properties.Name: Sipplerose
properties.text: The small gnome community of Sipplerose can be found in the northern Sanos Forest in Varisia. It is largely unknown, but is known to be the home of the lyrakien Novi.

properties.Name: Sirathu
properties.text:
Sirathu has long been overlooked by its ruling city of Korvosa, holding the undesirable honor of being both the poorest and farthest removed of the city-state's holdings. It was a relatively late addition to Korvosa's realm, ceded from Kaer Maga in the Treaty of Sirathu in 4663 AR.

The town is constantly reminded of their leaders' disregard for them by the White Prince's Fountain which sits in the town square. While the fountain was being constructed, nobles in Korvosa promised that it would be enchanted to provide a clean and endless supply of water for the town, so they would never be dependent on wells. The fall of the Chelaxian Empire diverted the Korvosans' attention, and the well was sadly never completed. In 4707 AR a local girl was found unconscious on the edge of the fountain, which was miraculously flowing for the first time. Since then, this young girl, blessed by Pharasma, has been a galvanizing force in a growing unrest among the citizens of Sirathu, prophesying that change was coming and that the town should break free of Korvosan control.

properties.Name: Skathen
properties.text: Skathen is a trade city on the Brokenbridge River in Taldor's Northern Tandak Prefecture.

properties.Name: Skelt
properties.text:
A place that is nigh impregnable to its enemies, the city of Skelt is of strategic importance to the whole of Nirmathas, being situated along the Shining River, which flows into the Tourondel River in northern Nirmathas. The city is located atop a large bluff and is only accessible one of two ways: either by water-powered lifts, or by several ramps, each of which has multiple drawbridges that can be raised at a moment's notice. The main forms of industry in Skelt are mining and lumber. The ore mined from the depth of the earth is brought up by huge lifts powered by dwarf-crafted waterworks. These same waterworks also power the ore grinders that help refine the ore into usable metals. Lumber is also a big industry in Skelt, with sawmills dotting the Tourondel River for miles down-river.

Skelt is heavily reliant on trade; for a long time it only traded with the nearby dwarf hold of Kraggodan, but with the re-opening of the Bloodsworn Vale as a viable trade route, Skelt now has access to all Varisia, particularly the large cities of Korvosa and Magnimar.

properties.Name: Skjoldmur
properties.text: Skjoldmur is a small whaling town in the south of the island of Aegos, the larger island comprising Broken Bay in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings.

properties.Name: Skrata
properties.text:
Skrata is a small town on the Rimeflow River, in the westernmost Irriseni province called the Verge that acts as a waystation of goods shipped to the capital of Whitethrone from the north, through the Iceflow River, and as a supply depot for the army. Skrata's docks are always busy, and its warehouses are full with goods destined for the army or the Rimeflow route.

Baroness Slavena is the ruler of the town. She is not interested in running the town, leaving the task to her subordinates and her Jadwiga husband Ivan Betyrina. Slavena is the current paramour of Duke Arvanoff. She cuckolds her husband believing herself to be discreet but everybody in town knows her immoral relationship with the duke.

There are three prominent members of the Heralds of Summer's Return in Skrata: dockworker Cherni Oslonovich, blacksmith Left-Arm Karastov, and apothecary Sanzina Rodoc. Their main concern is how they could interrupt the transport of goods south to Vasterborg and the Irrisen's armies.

properties.Name: Skywatch
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Skywatch", please see Skywatch (Starfall).

The city of Skywatch was founded by Yannet Surtova, built around a massive observatory high in the Icerime Peaks on Brevoy's eastern border.

properties.Name: Slipcove
properties.text:
Slipcove is a small port on Bag Island in the Shackles.

The lord of Bag Island, Jolis Raffles, attacks the slave ships of Cheliax and offers the slaves the chance to live on Bag Island. As a result, Slipcove has the largest halfling population in the Shackles.

properties.Name: Slither Cove
properties.text: Once a reasonably prosperous village, Slither Cove is now nothing but a sinking ruin being rapidly consumed by the surrounding swamp. Slither Cove's current name comes from the wide variety of snakes, lizards, and other reptiles that now inhabit it.

properties.Name: Snemmevik
properties.text: Snemmevik is the northernmost town in Almhult, located at the head of a bay in the Gulf of Svallmundr. It serves as a handy base for prospectors seeking gold in the nearby Hellrung Mountains. The Maganis River empties into the gulf nearby.

properties.Name: Soduras
properties.text:
Soduras is a small fishing community on the Iceflow River, which forms the border between the Irrisen province of Bleakmarch and the Linnorm Kingdom of Hagreach. Due to its location, it is frequently used as a stopover and resupply point for raiding parties of ice trolls, winter wolves, or mercenary bands conducting cross-border raids.

The ruler of the town, Baroness Vjera encourages the martial visitors, ordering the townsfolk to provide housing, food and entertainment. Soduras' north end houses a large number of inns as well as fighting pits that cater to ice trolls and winter wolves. Human mercenary companies usually stay in the south end of the town enjoying themselves at the brothels of Madame Plana Vectenstyn. Life is hard for Soduras' residents but has given birth to tough adventurers.

properties.Name: Sojourner's Rest
properties.text: Sojourner's Rest is a village in the south of the Grungir Forest, in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings situated in the foundations of Thornwall Castle.

properties.Name: Solanas
properties.text:
Solanas is a frontier town in the region of the River Kingdoms controlled by Daggermark. It is ruled by the Solanas Concern criminal gang. The sheriff of the town does what he can to keep the peace, but the Concern has the real control of the town and interferes to protect its interests. The people are used to killings and assassinations that happen every day. The mayor has sent an emissary to Daggermark, to beg lord Martro Livondar for help.

Solanas is home to an important Pathfinder lodge, complete with a main hall, a dormitory, and a stable full of fresh horses. The lodge is guarded by a group of mercenaries.

properties.Name: Solku
properties.text: The large town of Solku is located near the western mountains of Katapesh (the Barrier Wall mountains), where it is relatively cut off from the rest of the nation. The settlement is frequently besieged by kholo slavers, and thus rests within a tall wall, though this does not always provide enough protection to keep the townspeople safe. Today the town is guarded by a small band of paladins of Sarenrae known as the Dawn Vigil who prepare for the rumored war ahead, as kholo amass in the mountains under the banner of Noor, the Red Sultana, who has her eyes set on Solku as the starting point of a massive campaign eastward.

properties.Name: Solskinn
properties.text: Solskinn is located to the south of the Grungir Forest and to the north-east of Jol (the capital of Southmoor) in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Today, it is officially ruled by Southmoor's Linnorm King Opir Eightfingers, but the local leaders will take control when they feel they can. Pleasant during the day, the small town is under forced curfew at night, as anyone leaving their homes gets abducted by the visiting shadows.

properties.Name: Sosulka
properties.text:
Sosulka is a small town on the Marbleflow River in Irriseni province of Wintercrux. It is located between the towns of Veshtak in the south and Iarna in the north.

Its ruler, Baroness Vilhema has become paranoid, convinced that the peasants upriver in Veshtak are cheating the throne. She repeatedly reports her concerns to Duchess Svetochka in Morozny and to the Cold Sisters. Lady Vilhema believes there is a serious peasant conspiracy in Irrisen, centered in Wintercrux.

What Lady Vilhema does not know is that her fixed attention to Veshtak, blinds her to the fact that her own steward Maxum Geranazov, is secretly a member of the Heralds of Summer's Return; he regularly arranges the theft of shipments to help the resistance.

properties.Name: Sothis
properties.text: The Osirian capital city of Sothis is located just south of the River Sphinx delta, and is the largest, and most prosperous city in the kingdom of Osirion. The city is built around the molted husk of Ulunat, a colossal beetle that was one of the spawn of Rovagug and slain by Ancient Osirion's first pharaoh, Azghaad. Except for a short time under the Four Pharaohs of Ascension, it was also the Osirian capital city before the millennia of Keleshite rule.

properties.Name: Sotto
properties.text: Sotto is a tiny thorp in the Meratt County region of Taldor. The population is almost entirely made up of two extended families of goat herders. Some have claimed that the residents are cursed, because every few seasons wolves and other predators attack and steal large portions of their livestock. Others just think this is a clever ruse to avoid taxes from the Lotheeds.

properties.Name: Souston
properties.text: Souston is a small Andoren fishing village on the Inner Sea, approximately 240 miles due east of the capital of Almas. The town consists of small, brightly colored shacks that cling to the gently sloping coast.

properties.Name: Stachys
properties.text: The Hamlet of Stachys is a nearly forgotten village in Meratt county in the Tandak Prefecture of Taldor. The village boasts a single public house, Wolf's Whisker.

properties.Name: Starfall
properties.text:
This is an article on the city of Starfall. For information on the fall of the Starstone, see Earthfall. For the debris shower across Numeria, see Rain of Stars.

Starfall is a city just as brutal and as harsh as the unforgiving Numerian land that it is capital of. The place is a mockery of the soft capitals of the south, with a level of decadence that would even put Taldor to shame. This decadence is surrounded by the filthy reek of human misery. Here the Black Sovereign, currently Kevoth-Kul, rules utterly unchallenged, his every whim catered to, while the rest of city suffers under his harsh rule. Until recently the only people who benefitted were those who help the court of the Black Sovereign indulge in his carnal decadence.

properties.Name: Stark Point
properties.text:
Stark Point is a trading post on the River of Lost Tears in the extreme east of Sargava. It is southeast of Fort Bandu and north of Kalabuto.

It was founded in 4414 AR as a mining community under the leadership of the church of Aroden. As a result, in addition to an inn, stable, and general store, it also boasts a surprisingly large cathedral. However, the mineral deposits were eventually exhausted, and the death of Aroden led to the cathedral being closed down and boarded up. Most of the population soon relocated to Kalabuto, and Stark Point become little more than a general store.

The abandoned cathedral might be haunted, and some have claimed to have seen strange lights and heard chanting coming from within.

In 4690 AR, the Sclerizi brothersArno, Carlo, Gudo, and Ikhaiabought the store and converted it into a trading post.

properties.Name: Stavian's Hold
properties.text: Stavian's Hold is a large town on the Whistling Plains, located on Taldor's eastern Porthmos Prefecture. The establishment of the settlement was motivated by Grand Prince Stavian III, who saw the project as a means to strengthen the power of the crown when he came to power, as well as divert the attention of his critics.

properties.Name: Stavintower
properties.text: Stavintower is a town in eastern Galt, just south of the Boarwood.

properties.Name: Steyr
properties.text: Steyr is an inland town in far-eastern Andoran on the Carpenden Plains, approximately 150 miles west of the Sellen River. It houses a large community of expatriates from the tumultuous nation of Galt, many of them artists and philosophers.

properties.Name: Stoneclimb
properties.text: Stoneclimb is a fortress along the eastern side of the Icerime Peaks in Brevoy. It is south of Skywatch and it is in the north of lands controlled by House Medvyed and from where that House lives and rules.

properties.Name: Storasta
properties.text: Storasta was once one of the greatest cities of the Kellid nation of Sarkoris in northeastern Avistan. Founded in 3844 AR, it was finally abandoned in 4644 AR like the rest of the Worldwound. During its occupation, Storasta was overrun by demons until it was freed at the end of the Fifth Mendevian Crusade. Due to its complete corruption, however, the crusaders decided to raze the city rather than rebuild it.

properties.Name: Sturnidae
properties.text: The town of Sturnidae is found in the south of the Ustalavic county of Barstoi, very close to the blasted wasteland known as the Furrows. Its proximity to the Furrows is never forgotten as, when the wind blows aright, a pall of grey ash from the wasteland is blown over the town; it lands on the fields tainting the crops and the food with decay. Furthermore, locals report seeing visions of the war in the clouds of dust, such as marching peasant soldiers and charging knights.

properties.Name: Sukri
properties.text: Sukri is a city on the Alavah Peninsula of Qadira.

properties.Name: Sumadhadra
properties.text: Sumadhadra is a massive port city located on the easternmost tip of Vudra's Divine Garden region, where it meets the Embaral Ocean, and is the subcontinent's easternmost city. Sumadhadra is a prominent trade centre, particularly with the continent of Tian Xia, and is where most visitors from that continent first enter Vudra. Sumadhadra is the home city of the monk Sajan Gadadvara and his twin sister Sajni.

properties.Name: Sunder Horn
properties.text: Sunder Horn is a small town in the Sellen Hills of eastern Numeria that is home to the Kellid Sunder Horns tribe.

properties.Name: Surat Prakan
