properties.text: Surat Prakan (pronounced sue-RA-ht pra-KHAN) is the traditional capital of Tang Mai, home of its ruling kamraten and their Cinnamon Throne, and is the Tian Xia nation's largest city.

properties.Name: Surtse
properties.text: Surtse is the westernmost town in Almhult. It is located on the southern coast of Cape Almhult on the shores of the Steaming Sea, to the west of Asre. It lies in the shadow of the Hellrung Mountains further west.

properties.Name: Szamrak's Haven
properties.text: Szamrak's Haven is a hidden enclave of androids. It is the largest settlement of androids in Numeria.

properties.Name: Sze
properties.text: The town of Sze is one of the settlements scattered throughout the desolate, monster-haunted land of Shenmen. It has been ruled for centuries by a cruel ghostly governor named Chou Mingxia, whose pointless pursuit of lumber is driven by her refusal to acknowledge the fall of Lung Wa.

properties.Name: Taggoret
properties.text:
The city of Taggoret was the center of the Everlasting Kingdom of Taggoret: one of the five dwarven kingdoms in the Five Kings Mountains, founded in 1562 AR by Taggrick I.

Nowadays Taggoret is a thriving city with iron gates and stone walls on the surface and refined great caverns within the mountain. It is located at the north end of the long trail of dwarven tunnels that run beneath the Five Kings Mountains. Its main industry is iron mining and smelting. Taggoret's iron is known as the finest in Druma and Andoran.

properties.Name: Taggun Hold
properties.text: The Chelish settlement of Taggun Hold is located in the Menador Mountains near the Nidalese border.

properties.Name: Talpas
properties.text: Talpas is a city in the Arcadian nation of Xopatl that is renowned for brewing and distillation. Once Talpas was little more than just another sleepy fishing village sat along Xopatl's western coastline but, in the last few centuries, it has instead embraced distillation and grown in size enormously. Various lake plants found on Lake Tapipallati, which surrounds the island Talpas is built on, can be crushed into a paste that is then fermented for several weeks. The drink created from this fermentation, also called "talpas", is highly intoxicating. The exact process of creating the drink talpas is such a closely guarded secret that the brewers and distillers of the city are willing to kill to ensure it remains secret.

properties.Name: Tamran
properties.text: The city of Tamran, capital of Nirmathas, is a ramshackle city, especially for a nation's capital. It is built on piers and pilings over the marshlands at the mouth of the Marideth River, where it meets the banks of Lake Encarthan. The city is connected by a web of bridges, ramps, and causeways, and a flotilla of barges and skiffs, and all of the buildings are made from wood. Due to the fact Tamran is still standing after its violent history, it is seen as a symbol of Nirmathas's tenacity and resourcefulness. Considering Nirmathas is a country at war, Tamran seems to lack any sort of defences, including a city wallbut as history has shown, this is in fact its best defence.

properties.Name: Tamrivena
properties.text: The county town of Tamrivena is located in the western Ustalavic county of Canterwall, one of the Palatinates, in close proximity to the unsettling Shudderwood. The county of Tamrivena was one of the first to declare its independence from traditional rule after nearby Lozeri did so in 4670 AR, replacing its hereditary ruler with a Palatine Council in a bloodless coup and changing its name to Canterwall.

properties.Name: Tanadesh
properties.text:
Tanadesh is an unusual mahajanapada in the Cradle region of Vudra. Unlike most mahajanapadas composed of Vudrani, Tanadesh is a kingdom of vishkanyas, humanoids who possess a supernatural affinity for poison and guile. It is a jungle kingdom located toward the centre of the Cradle.

Emissaries from Tanadesh travel seasonally to Radripal for study in the city's ashrams.

properties.Name: Tar Kuata
properties.text:
The monastic settlement of Tar Kuata is dedicated to the god Irori, and can be found among the peaks of the Barrier Wall in southwestern Osirion, near the Footprints of Rovagug and the borders of Thuvia and the Mwangi Expanse. The Monastery of Tar Kuata was founded by Narmek Tar Kuata, a Sothan priest of Irori now venerated as a saint.

Many among the Pahmet, the sand dwarves, claim that Tar Kuata is home to some of their contemplative brethren, the Ouat, who are scholars of the martial arts taught in the monastery. The Ouat are in fact an isolated caste of dwarven monks based in the mountain valley near Tar Kuata. They are led by Menkha Helg.

properties.Name: Tar-Kazmukh
properties.text: Tar-Kazmukh is the northernmost settlement in the Five Kings Mountains. It's famous for its rather impressive arcane library which not only draws dwarven wizards from all over the region, even distant Janderhoff, but also human and elf visitors. The librarians, called the Blue Warders, serve all visitors, but pay particular respect to the local Sages' Guild, whose members are dedicated to study of arcane and planar knowledge.

properties.Name: Tashagrot
properties.text: The ruins of Tashagrot are all that remains of the capital of the former Irriseni province of Rimetusk, wiped out by predators coming from the Realm of the Mammoth Lords that were eager to regain their old territories. It is said that the site, which lies on the eastern bank of the Gullik River south of Coldwater, is infested with the ghosts of massacred residents.

properties.Name: Tastikka
properties.text: Tastikka is a small village in the Ravounel Forest, and is home to the strix Kitkasiticka tribe. They have traditionally isolated themselves from human contact until the defeat of the Grundlescorn sisters encouraged them to pursue careful and cautious negotiations. The tribe's rokoa Rarrnir, who came to power after the abdication of her predecessor Solmestria, has meet with representatives from the Silver Council, but has yet to secure an agreement concerning the new settlements along the Ravounel Forest's borders.

properties.Name: Tekeh
properties.text: Tekeh is a city in the Ketz Desert of Qadira.

properties.Name: Tephu
properties.text: Tephu, the City of the Reed People is a city in the Sphinx Basin region of Osirion named for the reed-covered marshlands where the rivers Crook and Asp join. The city's major industry is its near-monopoly on the harvest and processing of the abundant papyrus. Consequently, the city houses the largest academy of scribes in Osirion, who have preserved a massive catalogue of records from the time of its founding in -1605 AR by Djederet II, pharaoh and cleric of Nethys. Tephu's current leader is the preservationist governor: Haty-a of Tephu Deka An-Keret.

properties.Name: The Foundry
properties.text: The Foundry is an ancient fortress constructed centuries ago in the eastern Kodar Mountains at the height of dwarven power on the surface of Golarion. Then called the Ironhearth Foundry, they dedicated it entirely to the pursuit of metallurgy, engineering, and smithing, taking advantage of the surplus of nearby mines. Like the Sky Citadel of Urgir, the Ironhearth Foundry eventually fell to the orc hordes in -3709 AR.

properties.Name: Thom
properties.text: Thom is a small gnomish town in the central River Kingdoms.

properties.Name: Thornhearth
properties.text: Thornhearth is a small thorp in Geb just south of the Axanir River.

properties.Name: Thornkeep
properties.text:
This article covers the River Kingdoms town of Thornkeep. For other uses of the term, see Thornkeep (disambiguation).

The small town of Thornkeep is located within the Echo Wood of the northwestern River Kingdoms, about 10 miles east of the West Sellen River and 100 miles northwest of Daggermark at the junction of the Mosswater, Dagger, and Forest roads. Its reputation as a rowdy and dangerous settlement draws unscrupulous adventurers, bandits, and entrepreneurs for many types of illicit trade. The large number of nearby ruins and monsters attracts many adventurers looking to start making a name for themselves. This includes those interested in the nearby Emerald Spire.

Thornkeep has a wizard's guild called the Goldenfire Order.

properties.Name: Three Pines Ford
properties.text: Three Pines Ford is a sizable town nestled on the Tourondel River of Lastwall, east of the forest of Fangwood, and directly on its border with Nirmathas. It serves as a meeting-place for Lastwall officials and fresh recruits from Nirmathas. Heroes of Nirmathas use Three Pines Ford as a hiding place from agents of Molthune, due to the town's close proximity to the Nirmathi border.

properties.Name: Three-Troll
properties.text: Three-Troll is a small town in the Irriseni province known as the Verge which holds a great number of ice trolls. Three-Troll began as a camp for ice trolls raiding the neighboring Grungir Forest and over time grew into a small town. Three rock troll statues stand in the town square; these were rock trolls petrified when they were caught in the sun during the Winter War and have since given the name to the town. The ruler of Three-Troll is Baroness Nedyalka but she prefers to stay in the duke's court and rarely visits the town leaving the ice trolls to govern themselves.

properties.Name: Thronestep
properties.text: Thronestep is a port city on the banks of Lake Encarthan, and the capital of the growing theocracy of Razmiran. A city of sharp contrasts, it is among the newest settlements in Avistan, having been built by the Living God's faithful less than 50 years ago.

properties.Name: Thrushmoor
properties.text: The settlement of Thrushmoor can be found in the Ustalavic county of Versex. A fishing community on Lake Encarthan's Avalon Bay, the town is known to harbor a significant number of followers of the unsavory Old Cults, and the equally unsavoury Night Heralds.

properties.Name: Thulsadus
properties.text: Thulsadus is one of the many cities of the naga empire of Nagajor. Nagajor consists of 25 different kingdoms, each of them ruled over by their own naga monarch; the biggest cities of Nagajor each form the capital of a smaller naga kingdom.

properties.Name: Tiven's Reed
properties.text: Tiven's Reed is a small gnome settlement in central Katapesh, very similar to Yavipho. It is located near an oasis and began as a stopover for merchant caravans.

properties.Name: Todorokaze
properties.text:
Todorokaze (pronounced toh-doh-roh-Kah-zeh) is one of the many cities that dot the tengu kingdom of Kwanlai. It is the only city in the Kimu Mountains and a throughpoint for travelers and caravans crossing the range, and also is home to Tian Xia's largest shrine to the tengu deity Hei Feng. Todorokaze is known for its volatile weather, which its structures harness through myriad use of lightning rods.

The thieves' guild of Todorokaze is responsible for the Autumn of Iron Tears, a conflict with the thieves' guild of the city of Seidoyaji that escalated into a full-blown proxy war between the two cities.

properties.Name: Toduc Wa
properties.text: Toduc Wa (pronounced tu-duk wah) was once the largest city in the Tian Xia nation of Linvarre, which was formerly the Taldan colony of Amanandar. The Monastery of the Blended Forms, a renowned martial arts retreat inspired by Taldor's Tian-founded Monastery of the Seven Forms, is located in Toduc Wa.

properties.Name: Tolguth
properties.text: Like the Realm of the Mammoth Lords' largest settlement, Icestair, Tolguth is nestled against the icy walls of the Crown of the World. Unlike Icestair it is a warm, almost tropical town, surrounded by great ferns, rhododendrons, and green cycads. The reason for this vast difference in temperature is the volcanic vents and thermal springs that dot the area. Within this valley roam fantastic creatures that are not found anywhere else in Avistan. These include duck-billed dinosaurs, swift raptors, mighty tyrannosaurs and predatory terror birds like the axe beak. Unsurprisingly, the city is walled for the protection of its inhabitants, but these walls provide only a slight hindrance to the largest of the valley's creatures. Despite being surrounded by a dinosaur-infested wilderness, the biggest danger to the people of Tolguth comes from the Worldwound and its fell demonic influence.

properties.Name: Tomgruv
properties.text:
Tomgruv is located to the south of the Grungir Forest and to the north-east of Jol (the capital of Southmoor) in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Today, it is officially ruled by Southmoor's Linnorm King Opir Eightfingers, but the local leaders will take control when they feel they can.

The town is on the road between Jol and the Kopparberget mine. It is built around the entrance to an old abandoned mine. The locals who are mainly farmers and herders use the mine as a stronghold and storage facility. A few miners work on meager copper veins in the surrounding hills.

Kobolds and other underground enemies dwell in the lower levels of the Tomgruv's abandoned mine but so far the residents have managed to keep the upper levels safe. Troll raiders find nothing worth outside the heavily fortified mine entrance.

properties.Name: Torch
properties.text:
For another meaning of "Torch", please see Grandmaster Torch.

Torch is an unusual town in central Numeria that sits in a crescent around a bizarre, black hillock of shiny black stone known as Torch Hill. Atop the hill is the town's namesake, a brilliant purple bonfire that occasionally explodes into a devastating miles-high pillar of flame.

properties.Name: Torcova
properties.text: Torcova is a small town in northwestern Taldor in the southwestern foothills of the Fog Peaks in Northern Tandak Prefecture. Outside of the town, lies the manor home of a local noble, Lord Sauton Beane, who hides a terrible secret. He is secretly an ogrekin, albeit a handsome one, who has gone through seven wives in the hopes of begetting a human offspring. He has not succeeded so far, and has locked his monstrous progeny in a cave beneath his home after murdering their mothers. He only releases his ogrekin children to punish his enemies or kidnap his next wife.

properties.Name: Totra
properties.text:
Totra, founded in -2587 AR by the Conquering Pharaoh An-Hepsu II, is the largest of Osirion's ports outside Sothis. The city is often seen not only as a symbol of the country's power, but a symbol of its excesses as well. When the An Dynasty subjugated what would become Thuvia and Rahadoum with its fleets (known as the Great Atoqua), Totra saw an influx of slaves who would build the country's pyramids and monuments. The city's under-classes and nobility are still almost exclusively Garundi, and harbor suspicion and prejudice against Keleshites for their millennia of foreign rule. Following the death of the Fallen Pharaoh and the Qadiran invasion of 1532 AR, many of Totra's ancient monuments were toppled by the invaders. In a turnaround, the city's harbor now hosts a red granite statue of An-Hepsu II, built on a new island created from the toppled statues of Qadiran satraps.

The city is loyal to Khemet III, but the nobility bemoan the heavy taxation they suffer.

properties.Name: Tradecross
properties.text: Tradecross is a small collection of farmhouses and an inn in the Plains territory of Molthune. The town is mainly known for the occasional appearance of the mysterious Tradecross Peddler.

properties.Name: Tregan
properties.text:
Tregan is a small town on the border of Taldor and Galt, and is renowned as a refuge for Galtan refugees of the Red Revolution, who make up a fair percentage of the population.

Among the town's businesses is the Hornet's Nest tavern, owned by the bard Vallyn.

properties.Name: Trezira
properties.text:
Trezira is a small town on the Frozen Road River in the eastern part of Irrisen's Bleakmarch province. It single distinguishing feature is that it was granted a monopoly on "ice cleaving" (the process of keeping a river navigable year-round) the Frozen Road in 4623 AR by Queen Elvanna. Nearly a hundred years later, fur-wrapped citizens of Trezira still patrol the river in their "breaker barges", using any means at their disposal to maintain a navigable channel through the ice.

The ruler of the town is Baroness Marcia who is not very oppressive of the peasants provided they do whatever is necessary to fulfill their obligations and especially do nothing to endanger the "ice cleaving" monopoly. Most successful of the seven "ice cleaving" companies is the White Stewards led by Trepek Gorny. Trezira is also the main trading partner of the frost giant hold of Holvirgang. The frost giant guests in town usually prefer the Horned Helm Inn run by the Ulfen Ludmil Arronsson, a giant of a man himself.

properties.Name: Tribulation
properties.text: The small town of Tribulation can be found in the eastern edge of the Southern Range mountains in southeastern Taldor, on the far side of Emperor's Pass.

properties.Name: Triela
properties.text: Triela is a large town on Star Bay of the Inner Sea near the mouth of the Sellen River in south-eastern Andoran, close to its border with Taldor. It is the final stop for hundreds of lumberjacks every year who float their logs down from the Verduran Forest and flood the settlement with their hard-earned pay, spending it on company and drink. This has given Triela a reputation for debauchery, one which the wealthier citizens who reside on the bluff above the taverns and brothels have tried hard to overcome.

properties.Name: Tripolne
properties.text: Tripolne is the seat of the Backar territory of Molthune.

properties.Name: Trollheim
properties.text: The city of Trollheim can be found in Hagreach, the easternmost of the Linnorm Kingdoms, hard against its border with Irrisen and on the banks of the Rimeflow River. Trollheim has no current king and is ruled by Castellan Freyr Darkwine.

properties.Name: Trunau
properties.text:
Trunau is a small human farming community located just south of the old Hordeline in the Hold of Belkzen. When the orcs breached this defensive border in 4515 AR, the citizens of the town refused to abandon their land, unlike most of the farmers in the surrounding region. They built wooden palisades and ramparts, surrounding the defenses with pits and stakes, and defended the walls of their town with great ferocity. The orc invaders eventually gave up besieging the town and simply started circumventing it. Those few orcs who trade with the inhabitants began naming the settlement Manhome. The inhabitants of this town are called 'Trunauans'.

Every able-bodied citizen of Trunau is tasked with defending the town at a moment's notice and is grimly aware that the town is the lone human outpost in a savage land. Children on their twelfth birthday are presented with a hopeknife and shown precisely which arteries to cut should they or their families be taken alive by the orc hordes.

properties.Name: Tsering Springs
properties.text: The Tsering Springs (pronounced SEAR-ing Springs) are the ancestral home of the samsarans of Zi Ha in Tian Xia. The settlement allows entry to outsiders only on invitation or when accompanied by a samsaran guide.

properties.Name: Tsukiwa
properties.text: Tsukiwa (pronounced TSOO-key-wah) is a former mining town turned independent fortress located in western central Chu Ye, on the western end of the Nightford Mountains.

properties.Name: Tulaupan
properties.text: Tulaupan is one of the three cities in Xopatl, along with Orjotoro and Ziplatna, that are together known as the Follower's Rests. Tulaupan is vital to Xopatl for trade with its neighbouring nation of Innazpa.

properties.Name: Tuotuo
properties.text: Tuotuo (pronounced tow-tow) is a city located in the former heartland of Imperial Lung Wa in the Successor State of Po Li. The nation is ruled by the powerful Oracular Council that allows no worship of other deities other than that of the idea of the Eternal Emperor.

properties.Name: Turpin Rowe
properties.text: Turpin Rowe is a small logging town on the Isle of Kortos managed by the Yalbrough Consortium of Absalom. Its economy is driven by the lumber trade but derives its name from the nearby distillation of turp spirits.

properties.Name: Turtleback Ferry
properties.text: The town of Turtleback Ferry was until recently a relatively quiet frontier hamlet located on the banks of the Skull River in central Varisia. Events related to the failed giant invasion of the Varisian lowlands in 4707 AR caused quite a bit of disturbance, but the town has since regained much of its former innocuousness.

properties.Name: Turvik
properties.text: Turvik is a small fortified city in the north of the Thanelands in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings on the Path of Aganhei.

properties.Name: Tuvar
properties.text: Tuvar is the de facto capital of the Ulaagor Clans of the Erutaki, located on the shore of Ulaagor Bay at the outlet of the Niiset River. This town is the site of the Ulaagor clan moots and trade fairs.

properties.Name: Twingate
properties.text: The city of Twingate is located in the north of the nation of Druma on the Gulf of Accord. It is a semipermanent city of tents where the curious come to be initiated into the mysteries of the Prophecies of Kalistrade.

properties.Name: Tymon
properties.text: The city-state of Tymon lies southwest of the city of Daggermark on the very western borders of the River Kingdoms next to the nation of Razmiran. Tymon is renowned for its gladiators, as it boasts both a huge arena and many prestigious gladiator colleges.

properties.Name: Tyvas-Devas
properties.text:
Tyvas-Devas is an inland fortress town on the Devil's Arches island in the Shackles. It is made of stone by slave labor on the banks of the Holshod River. Arronax Endymion, the ruler of Devil's Arches, forbids outsiders from entering the town without his permission. The castle at the town's center is built as the admiral's redoubt should his Chelish enemies arrive.

Tyvas-Devas is overseen by Endymion's fiercely loyal lieutenant, Iome Paemadar. The black-clad summoner and her fearsome eidolon are known to walk the streets at night, making certain that everything is ready for her beloved admiral. The town is surrounded by rich farmland tended by slaves, which provides food crops for all of Devil's Arches. It is known that the admiral's great wealth lies in the cellars below the Tyvas-Devas' fortress.

properties.Name: Udayasankar
properties.text: Udayasankar is a small village in the northern reaches of the Golden Basin region of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. A nearby cave contains the Stone Egg of Jayalakshmi, an incredibly powerful artifact that opened the minds of monks who first found it during the ancient Age of Destiny.

properties.Name: Ukhrul
properties.text:
Ukhrul is one of the numerous prosperous cities of the Wide Water region of the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. Ukhrul sits at the eastern end of the Seabound Road, which with its completion heralded a new era of prosperity for the once desolate region of the Western Ghats. Ukhrul itself, however, sits on the eastern side of the Johar Mountains in the north-west of the Wide Waters region, sited nearby the source of the Matra River.

Ukhrul has a reputation as a somewhat grim city, ruled by the militaristic Rajah Shavit, and is renowned for its production of firearms and other technological weapons. Rajah Shavit offers these weapons for export but only to distant mahajanapadas so that his expansionist ambitions cannot be hampered by the advanced weapons made in Ukhrul being used against him by his neighbours.

properties.Name: Ul-Angorn
properties.text:
Ul-Angorn is a small town on the Crown of the World, lying on the shores of Saltsea Lake. It is the largest settlement of Erutaki humans in the Ruun Uvas basin. Ul-Angorn is a resting spot for caravans along the Path of Aganhei between the High Ice and Ovorikheer Pass.

Ul-Angorn is prosperous for a town its size, and its inhabitants are inquisitive and garrulous.

properties.Name: Ullerskad
properties.text:
Ullerskad is an Ulfen city situated on the northern banks of the Rimeflow River in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Ullerskad is a major settlement in the region known as the Thanelands and is a hub of trade and commerce in the region. Many of the wealthiest Ulfen's live in the city, which is known for its popularity among retired Huscarls of the Ulfen Guard, returned from their (well paid) services to the emperor of Taldor.

Numerous hunting lodges dot the surrounding region, and hunting the local wild boars (and the troublesome wolves that prey on the farmers' flocks) is a popular pastime.

Ullerskad is the location of a gold-adorned temple to Gorum. The nearby stream and grove of trees is the site of sacrifice, especially during the spring equinox.

properties.Name: Ulm's Delve
properties.text: Ulm's Delve is a small gold-mining settlement in Druma.

properties.Name: Umnyango
properties.text: Umnyango (population 11,340), known as Kalabuto during colonial times, is the largest settlement in Vidrian. It is a crumbling city built by Mwangi tribesmen in the pre-colonial era, and the overwhelming majority of the inhabitants are Mwangi, until recently ruled over by a minority of Sargavan colonialists. It was the main target for the anti-colonial feeling of the Mwangi city of Mzali to the east, and, in time, the internal and external Mwangi united to expel the Sargavans from the city.

properties.Name: Umok
properties.text: The gnome settlement of Umok can be found in central Isger on the northeastern edge of the Chitterwood. It has suffered an existence rife with conflict with local goblin tribes, and only the intervention of a visiting gnome paladin of Shelyn, Challo Fignoble, protected Umok through the final battles of the Goblinblood Wars.

properties.Name: Unaimo
properties.text: Unaimo is a trade town on the Crown of the World, in the eastern Hoarwell March. It is constructed from mounds built into the bluffs on the shore of Lake Yamunaq near the Alasek Ridge, and serves the Path of Aganhei as the trade route climbs the nearby Koumssa Gap onto the High Ice.

properties.Name: Undarin
properties.text: The central city of Undarin in the Sarkoris Scar can be found on the Sarkora River, and was once a center for the selling of livestock and ore in the kingdom of Sarkoris. Once the city was overrun by demons after the opening of the Worldwound in 4606 AR, its stockyards and animal pens were used to temporarily control the human population before being sent off for further processing. Like most of the cities in the region, the holy warriors of the Fifth Mendevian Crusade deemed Undarin to be too corrupted to be rebuilt, and instead razed the city in 4718 AR.

properties.Name: Urgir
properties.text: Urgir is the unofficial capital of the orc-ruled Hold of Belkzen. The nation has no true capital as Belkzen has no centralized government, yet the ruler of Urgir is generally seen by most orcs as the most powerful chieftain in the area. The disparate tribes of Belkzen are fiercely independent and fight against each other even more than they fight outsiders, although Urgir's leader, the intelligent Ardax the White-Hair, has instituted changes in the hopes of encouraging cooperation and greater unity.

properties.Name: Urglin
properties.text: The predominantly orc city of Urglin (which means "Second Home" in the orc language) is the only population center of any sort in the Cinderlands region of Varisia's Storval Plateau.

properties.Name: Uringen
properties.text:
An enigma among the settlements of the River Kingdoms, Uringen lies in the eastern regions of the country near the Embeth Forest. The settlement seems to exist in two realms, part of it "static" in reality, the other "unstuck"disappearing and reappearing with the mists its inhabitants speaking Skald, a language not spoken in the River Kingdoms for ages.

Most outside the town theorize that the town is under some sort of foul magic or evil spell, but the true source of its strange behavior is a malfunctioning time-altering magical clocktower at the town's center that warped a third of the town to a pocket dimension between the Material Plane and the First World. The frequency of this phasing seems to be increasing, leading many in town to worry that it is moving closer to the First World.

properties.Name: Uruuknus
properties.text: Uruuknus is a city-state in the underwater nation of Xidao, in the Xidao Gulf of eastern Tian Xia, and Xidao's ancient capital. It hosts Xidao's largest magical academies and centers of research and is renowned for its sea dragon worship.

properties.Name: Usaro
properties.text: The majority charau-ka city of Usaro is the former domain of the Gorilla King who served Angazhan, demon lord of beasts. The city is located on the Blood River where it flows into Lake Ocota from its southern shoreline. Its inhabitants are feared throughout the Mwangi Expanse, and the former king's treasure vaults are reputed to contain priceless riches, including the mighty bombard Worldbreaker, but the ominous sound of human-skin drums carrying across the lake deters all but the bravest or most foolhardy of treasure hunters.

properties.Name: Ushumgal
properties.text: Ushumgal is a wealthy city on the Alavah Peninsula of Qadira.

properties.Name: Vaktai
properties.text:
Vaktai is one of the many mahajanapadas that dot the storied region of the Cradle in the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. Located on the coastline of the Embaral Ocean at the southern end of the Cradle, the city of Vaktai is controlled by rakshasas.

The rakshasas of Vaktai are also well-connected traders of luxury goods in the High Bluff district of Radripal.

properties.Name: Valahuv
properties.text: As of 4713 AR, Valahuv was a tiny town in the Sarkoris Scar that hadresisted the invading demonic hordes of the Worldwound for over a century. Unfortunately, it drew the strength for its independence from its daemonic overlord Ommors, the Bringer of Twilight, who was worshiped as a goddess.

properties.Name: Valas's Gift
properties.text: Valas's Gift is a small town in the north of the nation of Mendev, located on the West Sellen River.

properties.Name: Valishava
properties.text:
Valishava is a temple city sat on the banks of the holy Matra River in the Wide Water region of Vudra. The goddess Matravash is commonly worshipped here in large waterside temples, but the city also serves as a centre of commerce halfway along the river's length.

The city is also famous for its high priest Razdara who leads her acolytes on pilgrimages into the Outer Sphere. Her most recent trip saw her return alone, looking deeply haunted and carrying predictions of some dire fate that she claims is soon to befall the people of Wide Water.

properties.Name: Vannarak
properties.text: Vannarak is one of the many cities of the naga empire of Nagajor. Nagajor consists of 25 different kingdoms, each of them ruled over by their own naga monarch; the biggest cities of Nagajor each form the capital of a smaller naga kingdom.

properties.Name: Vannisaria
properties.text: Vannisaria is one of the many cities of the Tian Xia nation of Linvarre, which was formerly the Taldan colony of Amanandar. Vannisaria was founded by Brutus Vannisar and has since been home to multiple generations of the Vannisar family, including General Jiayi Vannisar, Brutus's great-granddaughter and Linvarre's leader as of 4724 AR. The city is also host to the Temple of the Eternal and Exquisite Rose, the largest temple to Shelyn on the continent.

properties.Name: Varnhold
properties.text: Varnhold is a seemingly abandoned settlement located southwest of Restov, near the northern Tors of Levenies in the Nomen Heights region of the Stolen Lands. It is notable for being inexplicably and suddenly vacated save for a single word scrawled on one of its buildings.

properties.Name: Varook's Deep
properties.text:
Varook's Deep is both the lowest dwarf-inhabitated point of the Five Kings Mountains at 17,621 feet below sea level, a defensive city that keeps watch over the Darklands, and a trading post that hosts caligni, drathnelars, and underground fey. Its garrison is led by General Flinda Strikespark.

Due to the city's depth, few surface-dwelling dwarves visit Varook's Deep.

properties.Name: Vasterborg
properties.text: Vasterborg is a heavily fortified town in the Irriseni province known as the Verge. It is located close to the border with the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, and a large part of its population consists of soldiers, ice trolls, and winter wolves.

properties.Name: Vauntil
properties.text:
The small town of Vauntil is located in the Ustalavic province of Caliphas on Lake Encarthan's Avalon Bay. The settlement is notable for its skilled folk artisans, fierce competition for noble patronage, flowers, and good food and wine.

The town is perhaps the most scenic and affluent regions in the county, largely due to the miles of vineyards and flower farms surrounding the settlement. Each year, chefs, vintners, perfumers, jewelers, and artists of all walks compete in the annual "Last Breath" festival for the highly coveted mantle "Worth Dying For". The competition is mired in regular tragedies and scandals including the use of human ingredients, assassinations, and mysterious deaths. Modern participants are unperturbed by this disasters, giving the competition a dangerous reputation and a morbid theme which has served to heighten its infamy.

Vauntil was the location where troops of the Shining Crusade established a beachhead in their war against the Whispering Tyrant in 3801 AR.

properties.Name: Veka
properties.text: Veka is an Iobarian town located on the shores of the Nyvyrd and has stood as a garrisoned fort since its founding. The easternmost Iobarian settlement in the Ice Steppes, it is home to a number of smithies, where all metal weapons and goods in the region are forged. The owner of these smithies is the ruthless Koffar Rjul, who holds control over the entire Nyvyrd region.

properties.Name: Veldraine
properties.text: The town of Veldraine is perhaps the most important strategic holding of Korvosa, and the second-oldest Chelaxian settlement in Varisia. Located at the mouth of Conqueror's Bay, Veldraine's ships make up most of the Korvosan Navy, and its naval academy trains most of the city-state's sailors and captains. It also contains a giant winch that allows the military to pull an immense chain taut across the entrance to the bay, keeping invading navies or pirates out of the watersor trapped within it to be dispatched one by one. The chain is inspected monthly by Korvosan officials, and has only been used once in 4685 AR in order to fight pirates from Riddleport.

properties.Name: Vellumis
properties.text: Vellumis is the oldest and largest city in the nation of Lastwall. Situated on the shores of Lake Encarthan, it serves as the port of embarkation and debarkation for soldiers traveling in and out of the country on their way to keep watch over the terrors of Ustalav and the Hold of Belkzen.

properties.Name: Veshtak
properties.text:
Veshtak is a small town on the Marbleflow River in the Irriseni province of Wintercrux. The town is in a strategic location where the merchants load their cargo onto ships traveling the river north.

Veshtak won the right to govern itself a generation ago, using bribes and political connections. The town exploits its position, exacting high tariffs, soliciting bribes and demanding a share of the goods. The Cold Sisters keep an eye on the greedy Ulfen townsfolk of Veshtak. A number of former mayors, dock wardens, warehouse managers hang in cages in the town's main square.

Veshtak's current mayor is the greedy Vidlof Haradsson. Few know that the dockworker Marina Gnetsky is actually Vidlof's boss. When the Cold Sisters come to town, Marina will make sure that Vidlof will be punished instead of her.

properties.Name: Vezhnu
properties.text:
Vezhnu is a small town on the shore of Rampore Isles in the Shackles. Large herds of livestock graze in the plains surrounding the town, and several slaughterhouses are arranged on the shore. The excess blood from the slaughterhouses drains into the ocean, attracting ravenous sharks.

The Docks of Chastening are used for the punishment, which entails lashings on the docks andfor more serious crimesbeing repeatedly dipped beneath the shark-infested waves until the beasts consume the victims.

properties.Name: Vigil
properties.text: Vigil was not only a mighty fortress that drew warriors of good like a beacon, but also the capital of the country of Lastwall. It was a city of music, joy, and faith that came to a terrible end in the summer of 4719 AR when the Whispering Tyrant escaped from his centuries-long confinement and unleashed the destructive weapon known as the Radiant Fire upon the city, destroying it completely. Its ruined remains now mar the Gravelands.

properties.Name: Vilelock
properties.text:
Vilelock is a shady, lawless settlement on the Shark Island in the Shackles. As expected, gory brawls, lurking cutpurses, and casual murders are frequent in town.

A thriving market in Vilelock specializes in the acquisition and sale of exotic poisons and alchemical substances outlawed in the more civilized nations of the Inner Sea region.

The town changes overlords often but its current overlord is Nisia Gbele, the Mwangi captain of the frigate Bloody Cudgel.

properties.Name: Vinpinna
properties.text: Vinpinna is a town in the foothills of the Pardaparbat Mountains in the Impossible Kingdoms of Vudra. Located in the south-western reaches of the Narhari Desert region, the nearby towns of Vinpinna and Adhaarm are each controlled by an order of undead martial artists.

properties.Name: Vische
properties.text: The Ustalavic settlement of Vische is located in the county of Barstoi, close to its border with Numeria. The House of Solace is located in the town and there clergy of Pharasma are ordained.

properties.Name: Visheksrad
properties.text: The largest city on the Crown of the World, Visheksrad is the capital of the dwarven nation of Zavaten Gura. The iron citadel is warmed by powerful coal forges, and is where the nation's ruler, Utograf Voislav, makes his home. Visheksrad is located on the coast of the Shining Sea.

properties.Name: Vladmirr
properties.text: Vladmirr is an isolated Iobarian town on the shores of the Castrovin Sea. The southernmost major settlement in Iobaria, Vladmirr is surrounded by the delta of the Pharrus River, close to the Icerime Peaks. Though the town is rich in natural resources with a bounty of arable lands and precious minerals, its lack of a protected port and the Castrovin's high waves often leaves the town overlooked in favour of Kridorn or Mirnbay.

properties.Name: Voinaris
properties.text: Voinaris is a small village in the Meratt county area of northern Taldor that is home to around 150 people. Voinaris is named after its aristocratic lords of House Voinum, and its current leader Baroness Adella Voinum takes great pride in her community. Voinaris shares in House Voinum's military traditions, and many of the county's soldiers are drawn from this village. The village's main exports are wine and vinegar, and they can be smelled from miles away.

properties.Name: Volod
properties.text: Volod is a small Iobarian town in the Norinor built in 4400 AR to replace the former logging town of Hroran. Located on the Noyrus River, the town has been dominated by logging and woodcrafting trades for much of its history. Recently, strange events have been occurring around Volod, and the town's druids have been speaking of new gods in the highlands and Norinor who are demanding worship.

properties.Name: Voluse
properties.text: Voluse is a small town in the River Kingdom of Touvette, located on the confluence of the Yhalt and Pitax Rivers.

properties.Name: Vurnirn
properties.text: Vurnirn is a centaur settlement situated in the north-east of the Hoofwood, in the region of Iobaria known as the Dvezda Marches. It acts a meeting place for the various centaur tribes. It was founded in 1466 AR.

properties.Name: Vyre
properties.text: The decadent independent city-state of Vyre (also known as the City of Masks), is located on Vyre Island in Nisroch Bay abutting the territory of the newly independent nation of Ravounel.

properties.Name: Wait's Span
properties.text: Wait's Span is the name of a tiny hamlet next to a wooden bridge of the same name that sits near the southeastern shore of Lake Kavapesta in the Ustalavic province of Ulcazar. It is located only six miles east of the Monastery of the Veil, and was the site of a massive fire that destroyed most of the village. Although Bishop Senir of the Monastery claims this was a natural event, most locals believe otherwise.

properties.Name: Waldsby
properties.text:
Waldsby is a typical peasant village located near the Hoarwood Forest in the Irriseni province of Hoarwood.

Waldsby's last leader was Tjorvar Leikovich. In 4710 AR was accused of being member of the underground resistance group, called the Heralds of Summer's Return and Nazhena Vasilliovna ordered Tjovar's house to be burned down with his wife and child inside and himself to be hung from town hall's clock tower. Since then Waldsby has been without a local leader.

properties.Name: Wanshi
properties.text: Wanshi is the capital of Hogosareta Province in Minkai, as well as the primary commercial port and naval base on the nation's southern coastline.

properties.Name: Wartle
properties.text: Though it is not a new settlement, the town of Wartle remains something of a frontier trading post, primarily populated by swampers and trappers who do not mind the inhospitable environment amidst the Mushfens. The buildings of the town rise out of the murky swamp water on stilts, connected by wooden boardwalks. Major exports of the town are peat, fungus, and furs, mostly sent down the Yondabakari River to Magnimar. The town sports a few successful brothels and a precariously tilted tavern called the Lean-To, which serves a local liquor called Bog Grog.

properties.Name: Wati
properties.text: Wati, also called the Half-City, is located in southern Osirion at the confluence of the Asp and Crook rivers and the birth of the River Sphinx. It is best-known for its enormous necropolis, or city of the dead, a relic of a bygone plague.

properties.Name: Waunomani
properties.text:
Waunomani (pronounced Wau-noh-MAA-nee), also known as Silungan, is the closest thing to a capital in the archipelago nation of Minata, off the eastern coast of Tian Xia. The diverse and heavily fortified city serves as a center of sea trade on the eastern coast of Belem and port for Minata's defensive fleet of warships.

"Waunomani" is a word of the Tau Nui people, a once-nomadic folk who claim descent from the ancient empire of Taumata and now primarily live in the Minatan isles of Rendah Pulu.

properties.Name: Westcrown
properties.text:
For 800 years, Westcrown was the capital of Cheliax, and the rumored birthplace and home of the god Aroden. Known as the "City of Nine Stars", it was a shining example of the greatness of the Chelish empire. Westcrown was a classic, enlightened metropolis, even a rival to Absalom as a destination of religious pilgrimage and tourism. But then tragedy struck: Aroden died in 4606 AR, a bloody civil war swept over the nation, and decades of turmoil and strife plunged the city into despair.

The ascension of the House Thrune to the Chelish throne in 4640 AR cemented Westcrown's fate, as the capital was moved north to Egorian; no longer the City of Nine Stars, Westcrown now became the City of Twilight. The remains of the Chelish nobility huddle in Westcrown as a home-in-exile, as the city itself crumbles under the weight of mismanagement, crime, and a mysterious plague of creatures that hunt the streets at night.

In 4716 AR, Westcrown found itself the target of an uprising led by the Glorious Reclamation, an Iomedaean group of knights opposed to House Thrune.

properties.Name: Westerhold
properties.text: Westerhold is the richest of Absalom's outlying towns. Members of Absalom's wealthiest families own small estates in Westerhold. The town is also known for its large number of dwarven inhabitants and trustworthy stables.

properties.Name: Westpool
properties.text: The small port towns of East Rikkan and Westpool lying to the north of Westcrown in Cheliax are known collectively as the Rikkan Ports. These settlements house large numbers of merchants dealing in the trade of goods up and down the River Adivian, as well the numerous slaves required to operate the Stavian Arches and portage stations. Westpool is larger due to the presence of the Arch. Since 4674 AR, Chelish forces frequently occupy the town looking for rebels and traitors. The current mayor of Westpool, Vismargrave of the Adivian Falling Tibalt Khrocini openly engages in politics and has gained much power and many enemies by controlling the transport route to Lake Sorrow and the capital Egorian.

properties.Name: Westsher
properties.text: Westsher is an important military garrison in the Plains territory of Molthune.

properties.Name: Whispertruth
properties.text: Whispertruth is a small settlement of runaways located in the Vergan Forest of Razmiran. Paranoid of being discovered, they do everything they can to keep the location of their town a secret from the government.

properties.Name: Whistledown
properties.text: The town of Whistledown is one of the few settlements in Varisia not affiliated with either Korvosa or Magnimar, though it is located almost exactly halfway between the two larger cities. Founded at the western edge of the Fenwall Mountains, where Lake Syrantula flows back into the Yondabakari River, the town is known primarily as the heart of the gnome population in Varisia, despite the fact that it contains just as many humans as gnomes. Nevertheless, much of the town's buildings and its white-walled cottages are sized for gnomes. Its name derives from the strange wooden charms which produce haunting melodies in the night winds off the lake, and this nightly music tends to put off most non-gnome visitors.

properties.Name: Whiterock
properties.text: Whiterock is a city located on the bank of the Yolubilis River, 50 miles south of Kintargo. It has long been maintained by the wealthy House Jhaltero, and originated as a stop where rocks mined from Jhaltero quarries were smoothed and catalogued for shipment to Kintargo, but has since grown into a market town for local farmers and ranchers who do not wish to take the long trip to the capital. Its ruler, Canton Jhaltero, is casual and disinterested, viewing himself due an easy life after securing his family's place on the Silver Council.

properties.Name: Whiterook
properties.text: Whiterook, sometimes denoted White Rook, is located in the east of Southmoor in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings hard against the border with Irrisen, from which nation the people of Whiterook are defended by their own fierce fighters and a magically-enhanced vine and birch wall. The settlement lies on the banks of the Thundering River.

properties.Name: Whitethrone
properties.text: Home to the Jadwiga ("children of the witch-mother"), the descendants of the witch Baba Yaga, Whitethrone was a playground for evil nobles under the 100-year reign of previous Queen Elvanna's family. This has changed since the ascent of Elvanna's successor, Queen Anastasia, in 4713 AR.

properties.Name: Wilkesmont
properties.text:
Wilkesmont is a small town located inside the Shroudwood in the River Kingdom of Daggermark. The town was the home of the bandit lord Miklos Jakab, self-proclaimed ruler of the Shroudwood.

Jakab, the last serious bandit threat to Daggermark, was killed in 4566 AR; his followers swore fealty to Daggermark. Due to its location in the wood, the town is relatively cut off from the rest of the kingdom and an easy target whenever the Daggermark military fails to protect it. Wilkesmont has been burned to the ground three times, and each time has been rebuilt bigger than before. The town lacks any fortifications, relying on the heavy wood to keep most raiders away.

Recently, a bandit lord from Sevenarches boasted he will claim the Shroudwood, so the residents of Wilkesmont plan to use assassins from Daggermark to stop him.

properties.Name: Willowside
properties.text: Willowside is an old, reclusive town on the northwestern coast of the Isle of Kortos, which has suffered greatly from a strange phenomenon known as the Welt in recent years.

properties.Name: Winterbreak
properties.text: The city of Winterbreak is located on Acuben Isle in Brevoy on the Lake of Mists and Veils. The city is controlled by House Lodovka . To the city's south-east is located Winterbreak Bay.

properties.Name: Wispil
properties.text: Located in the depths of the Verduran Forest, Wispil is the gnomish city responsible for most of Taldor's supply of timber and much of its wood craft. Wispil provides the timber that fuels the bustling Imperial Naval Shipyards of Cassomir, which in turn grant the Taldan Imperial Navy its power.

properties.Name: Wolf's Ear
properties.text: The town of Wolf's Ear is located in western Varisia where the Lampblack River empties into Ember Lake. It gains its name from the unusually large population of lycanthropes who once called the community home.

properties.Name: Woodsedge
properties.text: The home of one of the fathers of the revolution, Darl Jubannich (who wrote the damning book On Government that helped start the Red Revolution), Woodsedge has always served as the traditional home for dissident thought and radical philosophies in Galt. Even with the country in its current state, nothing has changed. No matter who is currently in power, one can almost guarantee that the opposition to them will begin in Woodsedge, and any visitor is almost certain to find some sort of dissident movement afoot.

properties.Name: Wyvernsting
properties.text:
Wyvernsting is the second largest settlement in Belkzen by population. It is located in the northeastern-most spur of the Kodar Mountains, surrounded by a high wooden stockade. It controls one of the Belkzen's rare forests and is close to the valuable and dangerous beasts of the Realm of the Mammoth Lords to the north, bringing wealth and power to its rulers. The Murdered Child clan, led by Hundux Half-Man, occupies Wyvernsting from their headquarters in Fort Hundux. It is said that Hundux is preparing for an assault on Urgir.

Wyvernsting is located near the mouth of Cleftbone Canyon. The steep slopes of the surrounding mountains cloak the city in shadow for most of the day allowing the light-sensitive orcs to be easily active even during daylight hours. The tunnels and chambers that honeycomb the walls of the Cleftbone Canyon are home to the wyvern-riders of the Wingripper tribe, close allies of the Murdered Child.

properties.Name: Xer
properties.text:
Xer (pronounced ZER) is an important port on the banks of Lake Encarthan and the Glass River. It serves as one of the two main ports for all Razmiran, and much of the trade goods that flow from across the lake are funnelled through Xer. The importance of Xer means it is tightly controlled by the priests of Razmir, who collect tithes from every business in Xersince anyone who lives in Xer must be a worshiper of Razmir, they collect from everyone.

Unfortunately for those who visit the city, the priests aren't fussy about who they demand tithes from, and happily "indoctrinate" any foreign sailor or merchant with the tenets of Razmir's religion until they agree to the "willing donation" asked of them. Even worse, this sort of behaviour is not just limited to those who walk the streets of Xer. Faith barges piloted by Razmir's masked priests sail the surrounding waters, boarding the ships of those who are not making port in Xer to spread the word of their faith (generally by bullying non-believers) and collect tithes (by demanding tribute to pass).

Rumour suggests that because Xer was the first city Razmir conquered when he came to the area, some of its inhabitants remember certain secrets that the faithful would deem blasphemy, including the fact that Xer might be home to a number of bastard offspring of the Living God.

properties.Name: Xin-Cyrusian
properties.text: Xin-Cyrusian was the capital of Cyrusian, the Thassilonian realm of pride, and that empire's largest city. It was said to have been protected by legions of bound angels, dragons, and enslaved giants. It was located in the western Kodar Mountains.

properties.Name: Xin-Edasseril
properties.text: Xin-Edasseril was the capital of the Thassilonian realm of envy, Edasseril. It is now the capital of the kingdom of Edasseril within the nation of New Thassilon.

properties.Name: Xin-Shalast
properties.text: The fabled city of Xin-Shalast was once the capital of the Thassilonian realm of greed, Shalast, under the reign of Runelord Karzoug. Located far from civilization in the heart of the Kodar Mountains, Xin-Shalast's existence was considered mythical until it was recently rediscovered.

properties.Name: Xiwu
properties.text: The fortress city of Xiwu, one of the most populated settlements of Tian Xiaor indeed, on Golarionis the capital of militaristic Lingshen. The city appears to be a military installation unlike anything else in the world.

properties.Name: Yalakheen
properties.text: Yalakheen is a sacred city of the deity Yahaiya located in the Alavah Desert of Qadira. Its residents are priestesses of the goddess who tend to visitors seeking their prayers to be fulfilled, usually through suicidal sacrifice.

properties.Name: Yan Tloml
properties.text: Yan Tloml is the largest agricultural centre in Xopatl since the fall of Chdanza. The land surrounding it yields an incredible bumper crop each year, but no one knows which crop will benefit, so each farmer plants multiple crops each year and waits to see which will flourish. When one of the plants starts thriving beyond all the others, it sparks a mad rush of farmers scrabbling to secure more seeds and land to grow more of this bumper crop. Due to this element of chance and the chaotic competition to capitalise on the flourishing crop, Yan Tloml's agricultural influence has yet to equal Chdanza's.

properties.Name: Yanmass
properties.text: Yanmass is a Taldan city that stands along one of the trade routes that flow across the deserts of the Casmaron linking it with the heartland of the Empire of Kelesh and, from there, with lands even further away. Unsurprisingly, Yanmass is a city based on trade and providing vital services to caravans after their long treks across the continent; Yanmass plays host to caravans from across the known world.

properties.Name: Yanti Iulde
properties.text: Yanti Iulde is a city within Xopatl that is renowned as the nation's religious centre. Yanti Iulde was the home town of the last hero-god to be born in Xopatl back in the nation's ancient history. From this Yanti Iulde rose as a centre for religious worship of the hero-gods and other deities beyond that, becoming a city riddled with temples and shrines, some so old that the deities they were built to honour have been completely forgotten. The city holds a week-long festival to celebrate all the deities worshipped within the city, including those whose memory has been all but lost to time.

properties.Name: Yashabaru
properties.text: Yashabaru is the capital of the underwater nation of Xidao, in the Xidao Gulf of eastern Tian Xia, and the largest of its athamaru-ruled city-states.

properties.Name: Yavipho
properties.text:
The village of Yavipho is a tiny, predominantly gnome settlement in central Katapesh, very similar in nature to Tiven's Reed. It grew up around an oasis stopover for merchants and continues to serve as a place where one can sell almost anything to its curious inhabitants.

Constant harassment by slavers (especially from the kholo population) eventually forced the gnomes to migrate beneath the oasis, where homes and workshops are dug from the rock. Most dwellings have secret escape routes, and the settlement itself is carefully monitored by guards for fear of discovery from hostile outsiders. Few visitors are accepted into the community, and those select few are searched before allowed entry. Paranoia is the price of security.

properties.Name: Yelligo Wharf
properties.text:
Yelligo Wharf is a small pirate settlement on the island of Dahak's Tooth in the Shackles.

The settlement was established in 4709 AR and hides itself in Leatherwing Bay. The ramshackle settlement consists of a few squat buildings made of driftwood and dirt clinging to the shore. It is home to four pirate crews that prey on the merchant ships travelling close to the mainland, east of Shenchu Bay. Kamshika Heavyhand captains the armored sloop Baleful Glare, Mean Steebyn captains the barkentine Rough Customer, Noila the Knife captains the brig Harm's Way, and Pendahl of Rahadoum captains the sloop-of-war Baalzebul.

These four captains capture Inner Sea merchant vessels on their way home from Port Peril, stealing their cargoes and selling their crews to the cultists of Dahak for sacrifice. Chadric of Laekastel, who lives in the only stone building of the town, is the apparent head of the business.

properties.Name: Yemal
properties.text: Lost Yemal is presumably a ruin of the ancient Jistka Imperium, located in the nation of Rahadoum. It is situated in the south-east of the country, in the Napsune Mountains near the mouth of the Uta River.

properties.Name: Yensa
properties.text:
The border town of Yensa lies on the Iceflow River, separating the Irrisen province of Bleakmarch from the Linnorm Kingdom of Hagreach. Its ruler, Countess Marcelyna, does her best to encourage trade between the two nations, even going so far as to bar entrance to the town to mercenary companies and other ruffians intent on conducting cross-border raids.

Countess carefully cultivates a friendly image is order to foster commerce but the Yensa's inhabitants know their mistress' cruel nature. None dare to reveal the truth to visitors who hear nothing but praise for the countess from her secretly brutalized subjects. The blacksmith Vanak Usztony lost his wife from Marcelyna's cruelty and he still doesn't speak a word of complain in order to protect his four children.

properties.Name: Yiangma
properties.text: Yiangma is a small tengu town in the nation of Kwanlai in Tian Xia. Situated in the Kimu Mountains, the isolated town is also near the border with Tianjing. The town is near a shrine dedicated to a group of fallen celestials.

properties.Name: Yin-Sichasi
properties.text:
The underground city of Yin-Sichasi beneath the Gossamer Mountains is home to the witch-queen Lady Lang Loi, who rules over the monster-dominated brigand nation of Shenmen in Tian Xia. Most people who live in Yin-Sichasi are the witch-queen's slaves.

Many of the inhabitants are jorogumo, like the ruler herself, and on rare occasions will turn into undead known colloquially as "bone-fang jorogumo". These creatures occupy a half-ostracized, half-exalted position as occult advisors and spiritual intermediaries within the city.

properties.Name: Yled
properties.text: Yled (pronounced EH-lehd) is the largest city in the land of Geb and also home to most of its undead armies.

properties.Name: Ysborg
properties.text:
Ysborg is located just below the snowline on the northern slopes of Mount Gnarlfang, in the western Kodar Mountains at the far south-eastern corner of the Linnorm Kingdom of Southmoor, where borders provide no real barrier to the eternal winter of neighboring Irrisen.

Ysborg, the 'Steading of the Ice Trolls', is something between a town and a fortress, consisting of crude wooden buildings and hide tents, all sized for giant occupants, surrounded by a stout wooden palisade. The entire fortress is surrounded by a moat of nearly freezing water inhabited by numerous river drakes.

Ice trolls, ettins, ogres, and other giants come from all across the Linnorm Kingdoms to join the army of the Blue Jarl, a huge powerfully muscled ice troll with a giant battleaxe curved from magical ice.

The streets of Ysborg are dangerous, with brutal fights and fresh blood on the snow to be a common sight. The Blue Jarl's "Winter Palace" is one of Ysborg's few stone buildings. It is nothing more than a blocky pile of icy rocks but it is well-fortified. The throne of the Blue Jarl is made from carved mammoth tusks and is decorated with human skulls. The Blue Jarl's kennels, just outside the palace are filled with winter wolves who have sworn allegiance to the jarl and the Bear Pits host ferocious polar and grizzly bears armored and trained to fight.

The Blue Jarl is always accompanied by his loyal frost giant shield maidens, as well as by the huge, white-furred dire bear that serves as his mount.

Ice troll marauders from Ysborg frequently raid neighboring human settlements for slaves, or more often, fresh food, for ice trolls relish the taste of human flesh. The villages have appealed to Trollheim for aid but for now usually defend themselves or abandon their villages. Rumors hold that Irrisen has been courting Ysborg as an ally, but so far, the trolls remain independent.

properties.Name: Ytterjorna
properties.text: Ytterjorna is a trading town on the eastern shores of Glacier Lake in the Irriseni province of Thronehold.

properties.Name: Yuming
properties.text: Yuming is a massive city located in the former heartland of Imperial Lung Wa in the Successor State of Po Li. The nation is ruled by the powerful Oracular Council that allows no worship of other deities other than that of the idea of the Eternal Emperor.

properties.Name: Zaplava
properties.text:
Zaplava is a little village on Rimeflow River just before reaching Glacier Lake in the Irriseni province of Wintercrux. Few travelers stop at the village, inhabited by as many as seven intermarried families. The miserable superstitious peasants live in fear of the dreaded Frozen Fog to the east. The fog's icy tendrils and the strange horrors that sometimes wander close to the village make the frightened peasants hide in their stone hovels. Arko Arkosson is the mayor of Zaplava.

Todora Navanya, a renowned adventurer in Avistan, comes from this tiny village.

properties.Name: Zeibo
properties.text: The town of Zeibo was built by elven and half-elven citizens of the shogunate of Ushinawa Isles in the Shackles. Its wooden buildings are constructed around the thick trees of the isle in an almost organic fashion. Zeibo is known for the Petal Seminary, a small school for geisha that has also combined aspects of elven culture. The elegant school attracts bards from all over the Inner Sea region. The Petal Seminary's respected instructor is Kazumi Nanbatwa.

properties.Name: Zelen
properties.text: Zelen is a peasant settlement on the Rimeflow River in the westernmost Irriseni province known as the Verge. It handles merchant barges heading eastward to Algidheart or Whitethrone, or westward to Iceflow. Most river captains choose Zelen to sleep in a warm bed for at least one night. Baroness Pribuska is the ruler of Zelen. She was a paramour of Duke Arvanoff, and nourishes great hatred for Baroness Slavena of Skrata who has replaced her in the duke's affections in 4710 AR. The waters of the Rimeflow near Zelen are rich with fish and the town sends a large portion of its catch as far as south as Redtooth. The Vasterborg Run is a caravan of dogsleds led by Raisa Gevenovna and Zavid Menavich that makes the challenging monthly trip to Redtooth.

properties.Name: Zetang
properties.text: Zetang is capital of the empyrean-ruled Tian Xia nation of Tianjing. A port city on Point Aykishe along the nation's eastern coast, Zetang was victim of Zo pirate attacks when Lung Wa fell but has since been rebuilt. Rumors suggest the unhappy dead still persist among the shipwrecks in its harbor.

properties.Name: Zhenbarghua
properties.text: Zhenbarghua is the westernmost kuru settlement in the Cannibal Isles and maybe the least dedicated to the Blood Queen. Kuru from Zhenbarghua sometimes manage to escape their depraved culture and islands in search of a new life.

properties.Name: Zilpatzi
properties.text: Zilpatzi is a city in Xopatl that has suffered greatly since the nearby Manzinago Forest became too dangerous to log. Before the Deepweave came to the Manzinago Forest, much of its wealth came from boat caravans that would float down the rivers of Xopatl accompanying the floating cut wood. Since they can no longer safely make lumber, the focus of these floating caravans has now pivoted to focus entirely on trade and shipping goods up and down the length of the rivers. These voyages can sometimes venture further afield across all of Arcadia and can last months at a time. Within the city, local legend claims that some kind of smoke dragon lives beneath the local church of Cihua Coatl.

properties.Name: Zimar
properties.text: One of the main defensive Taldan strongholds against any future invasion from the south, Zimar is vital to the long term survival of the nation. Even though the war with Qadira, the Grand Campaign, ended over 100 years ago, Zimar still serves as a bastion for the Taldan army and is home to several Taldan Phalanx regiments (the name given to one of their huge formations of heavy infantry) and several other formations including cavalry and capital ships. Even though Taldor has not been openly at war with its southern neighbor since 4079 AR, the city remains ever watchful and is the most heavily fortified settlement in Taldor.

properties.Name: Ziplatna
properties.text: Ziplatna is the northernmost of the cities known as the Follower's Rests and acts as hub for trade between Xopatl and the neighbouring kingdoms of Innazpa and Razatlan. Ziplatna is renowned for its hunger for labour and anyone in need of work can visit the city and find it on one of the ships leaving Ziplatna's docks.

properties.Name: Zlatomesto
properties.text:
Zlatomesto is a small town in Irriseni province of Wintercrux. It is located at the southern part of the province and serves as the shipping center for the ice diamonds mined at Hope Lost and the products of the mines and stone quarries of Skala Foothills. Baroness Sabina Kseniya and her five sullen offspring rule the town with iron efficiency. Zlatomesto's peasants work hard day and night under the lash like slaves, loading the caravans' wagons and sledges.

The Tin King Alley Tavern is the place that the masters of the work gangs prefer. The tavern is famous for the potato vodka it serves. The owner of the tavern, Liisu Nyetesky is a secret agent of the underground movement, called the Heralds of Summer's Return. The information she gathers from the drunken patrons concerning the schedule of the most important shipments headed east is valuable for the organization in order to set up ambushes.

properties.Name: Zom Kullan
properties.text: Zom Kullan, the capital city of Nagajor, is located inside a volcano deep in the Kullan Dei mountain range. The volcano Zom Kullan is built around is still active and it is believed that it is only through rituals conducted by the royal naga queen, First Mother Vassath Shethagri and her naga royal family that stop the volcano's fury and prevent its eruption.

properties.Name: arula
properties.text:
arula is a city in the south-west of Xopatl that once thrived on logging the nearby Manzinago Forest, but has been forced to adapt to the ever-growing danger of the Deepweave infestation.

arula once grew rich from exporting timber across Xopatl and to the neighbouring kingdom of Nalmeras, but the forest has since grown dangerous from the Deepweave infestation of carnivorous plants that devour any who enter it. The people of arula have taken to ranching by using arcane secrets shared by the city of Jolizpan. arula's citizens have created their own arcane ley lines near their ranches which has resulted in huge livestock, but some locals fear that because of their prodigious size ranchers can no longer control these animals.
